3:00.race_name: Eric Turner Memorial Race Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Collingham
runners.comment: Quite useful 2m hurdler at best; won claiming hurdle on debut for this yard; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Quite a useful 2m handicap hurdler for Donald McCain; bought for £18,000 in October; won a Catterick claiming hurdle on debut for new connections last month (1m7f, good); not sure what to expect on belated chase debut.

quotes.race: Wetherby Racecourse Supporting Spinal Research Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought Collingham might need it a touch because he hasn't been away for a gallop but he's been doing plenty at home. The quick ground would have helped him and he's a grand little horse - Theo Gillard, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us from France last season and has been a remarkably consistent horse, winning three times with five second placings. He ran a nice race when second to stablemate Nayati in the valuable Hogmaneigh Handicap at Musselburgh off a mark of 121 and he went back to the Edinburgh track last weekend for the County Hurdle on Trials day and he won well. I was very pleased with that win - it was a good performance and clearly the drying ground made the difference. We have no immediate plan but to keep enjoying him while he is in this form. 09-02-23

runners.name: Paddy In The Caddy
runners.comment: Three wins over fences at about 2m on good to soft; below par latest; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins at around 2m on good to soft, the latest at Wincanton two runs ago; not at his best last time when losing a shoe but a good contender if quickly back on song.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paddy In The Caddy enjoyed the quicker ground today as he floated over it. He's keen enough but they go a quicker pace in handicaps which has suited him - Sean Houlihan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A new horse we bought from the Cheltenham May sales who ran once in a point-to-point and finished second. We'll start him off in a month or so and we like him. He's a strong horse so we'll run over hurdles this season. 23-11-23

runners.name: Flamelco
runners.breeder: A Blin, Mme A Blin, Et Al
runners.comment: Two wins over fences this season; not at his best last twice but not without a chance
runners.spotlight: Has won over fences at Catterick (1m7f, good) and Huntingdon (2m, soft) this season; hasn't been quite at his best on last two starts but wouldn't rule out.

runners.name: Followango
runners.comment: Point/bumper winner; maiden over jumps under rules; bit to prove on second chase start
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; yet to win over jumps under rules (placed in nine of her ten races over hurdles); unseated rider in only previous chase; bit to prove.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very genuine and consistent mare who was a close second again at Ffos Last last time, when we stepped her up to 3m. It was the seventh time she's been second or third in her last eight runs. She wants plenty of cut in the ground. She won her bumper and, although she doesn't win a lot, always runs her race. Hopefully she'll get her nose in front soon - last time she was beaten only a head. There's no doubting she's definitely got the look of a staying chaser further down the line. 24-12-24

runners.name: Mount Washington
runners.comment: Won two of his last three hurdle races; conditions suit; quite interesting on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Won two of his last three races over hurdles, last time keeping on well to score here (2m, good); these conditions suit and he's quite interesting on chase debut.

4:40.race_name: RHN Travel Destinations In Comfort Handicap Hurdle
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Fils De Roi

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Michael Rizieri, Y Fouin & Ecurie Thomas Sivadier

runners.comment: Two runs this autumn, on second occasion showing he stays 2m4f when runner-up at Uttoxeter
runners.spotlight: 351 days off before two runs this autumn, on second occasion showing he stays 2m4f when runner-up at Uttoxeter; he'll need a bit extra to win this, though.

runners.name: Holeshot
runners.comment: Up another 8lb in a more competitive race but he's won the last two of his three handicaps
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to make a lot of the running at Taunton (extended 2m3f, good to soft) in February and win by 7l; faced only three opponents at Warwick (2m, good) ten days ago but they too were dispatched comfortably; up another 8lb and into a more competitive race but he's on a roll and has contested only three handicaps.

runners.name: Monviel
runners.comment: Well beaten all five starts from November onwards; has another career-low mark
runners.spotlight: All three wins in 2022; twice second in the mud at Uttoxeter (2m4f) last spring but well beaten all five starts from November onwards, even when the cheekpieces returned back at Uttoxeter on latest; another career-low mark.

stable_tour.quote: He kept knocking on the door last season without winning and the handicapper knows exactly where he is. He's consistent and genuine. We might let Alice Stevens take 5lb off him this season. 01-11-24

He joined me this summer from Philip Hobbs and Johnson White. He won at Ascot last season over hurdles. He's going to go chasing and I'm quite excited about him. He'll start on October 21 at Newton Abbot in a novice handicap chase. There's a novice handicap chase at Ascot in early December over 2m2f and that could be a good spot for him. I've got a suspicion he might want 2m4f but we'll start him over shorter and if we need to go up in trip we will. 18-10-23

runners.name: Onewaywest
runners.comment: Second at Windsor (2m4f, good to soft) on return but last on both starts since
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who fell on handicap debut in late 2023 and wasn't seen again for 12 months; career-best form when second at Windsor (2m4f, good to soft; 3lb higher today) on return but finished last on both starts since.

stable_tour.quote: He goes well and isn't slow, so I think he'll hold his own. He probably needed the run when second again at Huntingdon last week, but there was promise in that run. 10-11-23

runners.name: Copper Jack
runners.owner: Acorn Builders Dorset Ltd & Sl Racing
runners.comment: Up 9lb but good chance to score again after winning by 8l on handicap debut 17 days ago
runners.spotlight: Point winner; made his handicap debut at Chepstow (extended 2m3f, good) 17 days ago, following wind surgery and with tongue tied, and he raised his game dramatically to justify favouritism in nine-runner race by 8l under Callum Pritchard; up 9lb but good chance to score again.

runners.name: Djo Dela Barriere
runners.comment: Best of his handicap form was on penultimate start but he'll need better to win this
runners.spotlight: Won novice hurdle at Hereford (extended 2m, good) in November; has come up short in handicaps on his five outings since, best of that form at Ludlow (2m5f) on penultimate start but he'll need better to win this.

stable_tour.quote: I'd say he was lucky to win probably the worst novice hurdle to be run this year, at Hereford in November. I think that was good placing by the trainer! He ran okay the other day at Plumpton, when he was fourth, but his mark of 115 is very overrated and he has no chance of winning off that. He'll be a bit of sport around the country and will pick up some prize-money, but in my view he's way too high in the handicap to be winning. 24-12-24

runners.name: Kepagge
runners.comment: 11yo and the lack of equipment is striking, but the return to this track is interesting
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in spring 2023; he's not fired in the same way since and is now 11 but took second back over C&D last May (4lb lower today); absent since November and the lack of any equipment is striking (for a start, he's been tongue tied all starts under rules) but he's worth a second look.

quotes.race: 888Sport Follow Us On Instagram Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kepagge has his quirks but he's done it nicely again under a penalty. He's jumped well in the main after doing plenty of schooling at home. He's a really nice horse - Tom Scudamore, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's not the easiest to keep together but had a really encouraging end to last season, winning two of his last three. He'll be going over fences now and wants two and a half miles. He'll be out shortly. 31-10-23

runners.name: Master Dancer
runners.comment: Possibly a non-stayer when he tried 3m in October, after wind surgery; absent again since
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m Stratford novice hurdle on British debut in October 2022 but rather patchy form since; possibly a non-stayer when he tried 3m in October, having had wind surgery, and he's been absent again since.

runners.name: Kate Madrik
runners.comment: French chase winner;  50-1 for novice at Ludlow in October for Alison Thorpe, tailing off
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in French hurdle races but she did win two chases there last spring on soft ground; 50-1 for British debut in novice hurdle at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) in October for Alison Thorpe, tailing off; absent since and this is her handicap debut, with a hood (worn on most French starts) reintroduced.

runners.name: Saint Cyr De Pail
runners.breeder: J Breton, F Breton & B Beaunez
runners.comment: Tailed off at Warwick six weeks ago; needs to resume improvement
runners.spotlight: 2m maiden winner at Exeter on good last April; second on handicap debut at Bangor (2m3f) and respectable fourth over nearly 2m6f next time, both on soft, but he tailed off at Warwick six weeks ago; needs to resume improvement.

quotes.race: Clifton Inn Newtown Exeter "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Saint Cyr De Pail is so big and he's taken a bit of time. He was much sharper today and I jumped well down the back. He was a bit green late on and is a big, raw individual but he was very willing and there's a nice future ahead - David Noonan, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

4:05.race_name: RHN Your Professional Travel Partner Mares' Handicap Hurdle
4:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Marys Fortune
runners.comment: British point winner in 2023; well beaten in chase after break last time; others stronger
runners.spotlight: British point winner in November 2023 (2m4f, good to soft); not at her best after long break in handicap chase at Carlisle last time; ran over hurdles in France but this is her first run over them in Britain.

runners.name: Jasmine Dairy
runners.breeder: J Dubois & Scea De La Vallee De L'Orne
runners.comment: Bumper winner; three fair runs over hurdles and has a chance on her handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; fair efforts on her three runs over hurdles, last time finishing runner-up in a mares' maiden at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft; pulled hard, not jump fluently); better than that latest run; chance on handicap debut.

runners.name: Realta Liath
runners.comment: Point winner; good second over hurdles last time; one with a chance on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Point winner in 2023; yet to win under rules but sound run when second at Wetherby last time (2m3f, good; fourth has won since); contender on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's the first Kingston Hill I've had. She won a point-to-point and is very nice. She does everything right and we've taken our time, but she'll probably run in a bumper before Christmas and ought to go in any ground. She's a good jumper and was quite eyecatching in her point. 13-12-23

runners.name: River Of Joy
runners.comment: Two wins in summer of 2023; off for 596 days; not without a chance if fully fit
runners.spotlight: Won two races over hurdles in the summer of 2023 (2m/2m4f, good); has since been off for 596 days; not without a chance if fully fit.

stable_tour.quote: She won twice over hurdles two summers ago but then was off last year. She'll be a good chaser this year - she's a lovely mare. 26-03-25

runners.name: Kalista Love
runners.comment: Fair second two runs back; not at her best latest; back after wind op; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Sedgefield maiden hurdle in December (2m4f, soft); well held either side of that; returns after a wind op; each-way chance.

runners.name: Koo Star
runners.comment: Irish raider; modest form in a bumper and over hurdles last year; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Irish raider; modest form in bumpers and over hurdles last year; pulled up in a point after a break last time; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Ironed Out
runners.comment: Won 2m mares h'cap in January; not so good latest; a possible but stamina to prove.
runners.spotlight: Won a Taunton mares' handicap in January (2m, soft); not at her best stepped up to 2m5f last time; could go well but best efforts at shorter.

2:25.race_name: RHN Travel VIP Transport Service Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Diagon Alley
runners.comment: Irish point second; yet to complete the course in 3 runs over hurdles; back after wind op
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point in November 2023; yet to complete the course in three runs over hurdles; back after a wind op with plenty to prove.

runners.name: Followcato
runners.comment: Irish point second; good third over hurdles at Wetherby in February; a possible
runners.spotlight: Secord in an Irish point in February 2023; some fair form over hurdles, notably when third at Wetherby in February (2m3f, soft); faced stiff task latest; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: Third in his bumper at the end of last season, he was a bit green on his debut over hurdles at Aintree and made a couple of mistakes at the wrong time. He'd have never beaten Mister Meggit but would have been a good second if he'd jumped the second-last. I think he's a proper horse and might be an EBF Final type if not a bit better. 21-11-24

runners.name: Jack To Bat
runners.owner: Martyn & Elaine Booth & The Maiden Over
runners.comment: £130,000 buy after Irish point second; third in strong C&D novice on hurdle debut; chance
runners.spotlight: Bought for £130,000 after finishing second in an Irish point in December 2023 (3m soft); creditable 9l third behind two useful novices over C&D on hurdles debut in November (soft); definite chance if handling this better ground.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in a point last year and is a proper National Hunt horse by Jack Hobbs. He'll be starting off in the next couple of weeks over two and a half miles and is a nice prospect. 06-11-24

runners.name: Newton Tornado
runners.comment: Irish point winner; second on last four runs over hurdles but beaten at 1-2 last time;
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in May 2024 (3m, good); runner-up on four of his five starts over hurdles at up to 2m7f; contender, but didn't jump well when second of three at Chepstow last time (2m7f, good; 1-2 shot).

stable_tour.quote: We've always thought a lot of him. He's still very weak and backward, so there's loads of improvement to come and he should progress for a step up in trip. We've entered him at Uttoxeter on Saturday for a novice hurdle over 3m and if he did seem to come forward we'd consider the Albert Bartlett at the festival. We could look at the handicaps possibly, but he's one to look out for next season too as he'll be a lovely chaser. 10-02-25

runners.name: Nil Vert
runners.comment: Poor form so far; may improve for the better ground but hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Poor form at long odds in three runs over hurdles on soft/heavy; may improve on this better ground but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Shannon Victor
runners.comment: First foal of a French 2m1f-2m2f hurdle/chase winner; worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: 85,000euros yearling; first foal of a French 2m1f-2m2f hurdle/chase winner; quite an interesting newcomer; worth a market check.

runners.name: Slade Shore
runners.comment: Placed twice in Irish points; well beaten in bumper on stable debut; best watched
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his three runs in Irish points; well-beaten 22-1 shot in a Huntingdon bumper on stable debut; best watched for now.

runners.name: Taymount
runners.comment: Won point in December; well beaten on hurdles debut but likely to improve on that
runners.spotlight: Won a British point in December (3m, good); well beaten when 12-1 for a Market Rasen maiden hurdle last month (2m4f, good); improvement likely.

runners.name: Courageous Strike

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner at up to 1m4f; sold 75,000gns in October; interesting debutant
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on the Flat, the first a 9.5f AW handicap, the second a 1m4f handicap at the Curragh (good) when with Adrian Murray; bought for 75,000gns in October; an interesting hurdle newcomer, although not sure to be suited by 2m4f.

1:50.race_name: RHN Travel Airport Transfers Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
1:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Ben Solo
runners.comment: Won Chepstow novice in October; second on last three starts, two over 2m4f here; chance
runners.spotlight: Chepstow novice winner in October (2m, soft); runner-up on last three starts, twice over 2m4f here (good/heavy) and the other at Chepstow (2m, soft); chance.

quotes.race: Century Racing Club Free Horse Giveaway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Ben Solo is a big baby and he's a really nice horse - he'll be a proper chaser next season. He'd been working well at home and he has a really good attitude. I thought two miles might have been short enough for him but he got away with it at a track like this. Ben [Jones] said he was green as grass so he should improve a lot from this - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse and will be very exciting when we go over fences next season because he's a brilliant jumper. We'll look to win a novice hurdle under a penalty and then possibly a nice handicap hurdle later in the season. 10-02-25

runners.name: Palacio
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Croix Sonnet Et Al
runners.comment: Won Chepstow novice in October; not progressed; pulled too hard latest; hood now tried
runners.spotlight: Looked quite a useful prospect when winning a Chepstow novice in October (2m, soft); hasn't really progressed and pulled too hard when 20l fourth at Hereford last time (2m, soft; rider reported he hung left-handed and made a respiratory noise); hood now tried; needs to settle better after a break.

quotes.race: Century Racing Club Free Horse Giveaway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Palacio is a big, rangy sort and in time he'll learn to race and be even nicer. He can be a tricky horse at home and the team have done a great job with him - Dylan Johnston, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken a lot of time to come to himself. He travelled strongly at Exeter on his debut at Exeter in November but then stopped a bit quickly. He's had a wind operation and hopefully we can get him to show us what he can do next time. He'll be out in the next few weeks. 05-01-24

runners.name: Roysse
runners.breeder: R F Broad &  R S Bebb
runners.comment: Looked a useful novice last year; pulled too hard up in grade latest; hood now tried
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a Grade 2 novice at Kempton last time after pulling too hard; in fair form prior to that, getting off the mark at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft; long odds-on) having fallen at the last when a long way clear in a Newbury novice (2m, soft) on previous start; hood now tried; interesting contender, but not sure to get the run of the race.

stable_tour.quote: He has a huge engine, but his jumping has let him down at times. We like him though and he'll probably run in the Dovecote at Kempton on Saturday and then we'll see about the Supreme. 17-2-25

runners.name: Tutti Quanti
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Figerro & Hubert Favre
runners.comment: Sixth in the Supreme having previously won over C&D and finished 2nd at Newbury; contender
runners.spotlight: Never on terms when 28l sixth in the Supreme at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft; fifth won at Aintree on Friday); two good runs leading up to that, winning over C&D (good to soft) before good second at Newbury (2m, soft); player.

quotes.race: Weatherbys & Birdie Calendars Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Tutti Quanti is very green but he's quite a smart horse. He's only four and still quite weak but he's improving all the time. Harry Cobden, jockey, talking to Sky Sports.

stable_tour.quote: He won very well on his reappearance at Ffos Las and we really like him. He'll come on for his second at Newbury on Saturday, which was his first run after a setback, and we're considering running in the Supreme. 9-2-25

runners.name: Falcao
runners.comment: Modest efforts in a bumper and a Ludlow novice hurdle; not an obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts in a bumper and a Ludlow novice hurdle; not an obvious contender.

runners.name: Ifan Full Pelt
runners.comment: Has plenty of stamina in his pedigree and has a stiff task on his racecourse debut
runners.spotlight: Wings Of Eagles half-brother to a point/3m3f chase winner and a 2m/2m2f hurdle winner; dam 2m4f-2m6f hurdle winner; stiff task on debut.

runners.name: Jager Time
runners.comment: Irish point third; modest form in two bumpers; improvement needed on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Third in an Irish point in January; modest efforts in two bumpers; improvement needed on hurdles debut.

3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Montmartin
runners.comment: Second off this mark on handicap hurdle debut two years ago; not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 7yo who was creditable second of 13 off today's mark on handicap hurdle debut at Southwell (3m, good to soft) in April 2023; not seen again since but still looks interesting on this chasing debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Airtothethrone
runners.comment: Made low-key stable debut last month but may have needed the run; eased in grade
runners.spotlight: Rather inconsistent for Tim Vaughan since Taunton win in 2022 and made low-key stable debut last month, but has possibilities in this lower grade if that recent outing brought him on.

runners.name: Pride Of Paris
runners.owner: Dallyn, De Wilde, Haggett, Metters, Yeo
runners.comment: Only fifth over hurdles when favourite for stable debut but could have chasing potential
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider on chasing debut for Victor Dartnall a year ago and managed only fifth over hurdles when favourite for stable debut in February, but remains lightly raced and could still have a good future over fences.

runners.name: Monbari
runners.breeder: Haras De La Rousseliere & M Baconnet
runners.comment: Back in fairly good form two runs ago but safely held on latest outing; others look safer
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; emerged from spell in the doldrums with respectable fourth here (2m3f, heavy) in February, but was safely held over that trip on good ground at Chepstow last month; back up to 3m today; others look safer.

runners.name: Ileny Royale
runners.comment: Battled on well for 2m3f course win in November but two lesser efforts have followed
runners.spotlight: Battled on gamely to open account here (2m3f, soft) in November and, judged on that performance, looks a good candidate for 3m; however, two lesser efforts have followed and he now has a point to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't fired but has a nice pedigree and I reckon we could have him back on track after some issues. I expect him to improve as he's been running on heavy ground and probably just wants better conditions. 20-03-24

runners.name: Mister Barclay
runners.owner: M Baker, K Ibberson And H Pearman

prev_owners.owner: C & M Baker, K Ibberson, H Pearman

runners.comment: Second on chasing debut last spring but below that form lately; cheekpieces given a whirl
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on chasing debut at Uttoxeter (3m, soft) last May, despite some rather sketchy jumping, and returned from a layoff with good hurdle run in January; below form twice since, though (chase/hurdle), and needs a boost from the new cheekpieces.

runners.name: To Be Sure
runners.breeder: Mrs Tessa Greatrex & Mr D Futter
runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat when back over fences last month; 2lb rise looks manageable
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in 2023; out of form over hurdles this season but ran big race in defeat when back over fences at Exeter (3m, good) last month; can handle a 2lb rise if in the right mood again.

runners.name: Chauffeur Driven
runners.comment: Second over hurdles two starts ago but too inconsistent to rely upon; chase debut
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over hurdles; ran well when second in first-time visor at Exeter (2m5f, heavy) two starts ago but is far too inconsistent to rely upon heavily, and drying ground may not be ideal for him on this chasing debut.

stable_tour.quote: won his only start in Ireland and will probably begin in a bumper in November. He'll probably want a trip in time but has strengthened over the summer. 31-10-23

runners.name: Another Lord
runners.comment: Off workable mark if judged on hurdling form but lacked fluency in his first two chases
runners.spotlight: Did pretty well to take second (no threat to winner) on chasing debut at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) in February, given he lacked fluency and the trip may have been too sharp, but again had some jumping issues when well-held fourth over 3m at Exeter (good; behind To Be Sure) last month; needs to get into a better rhythm here.

stable_tour.quote: He was running over hurdles but has now had a couple of chase starts, finishing second at Uttoxeter behind Lucky Lugger and fourth at Exeter last time out. He's taken a while to get his jumping together but I'm sure that once we get that sorted he'll win one or two. He's still a bit novicey over a fence and we could even go back over hurdles for a bit to give him confidence. He's another one who can get his head in front. 26-03-25

runners.name: Nine Nine Nine
runners.comment: Pulled up after bad jumping error last week; earlier form gives him an each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Won twice on soft ground at Leicester last season (2m6f/2m4f) and has posted some good efforts there this term; pulled up last week, having made a bad jumping error, but has each-way claims if first-time cheekpieces have positive effect.

quotes.race: Best Ticket Deals Online @ leicesterracecourse.co.uk Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Nine Nine Nine has been running well, but we've just been having mishaps with him. He's still got a lot to learn, so hopefully he can learn from that - Sarah-Jayne Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Sheeka Supreme
runners.comment: Irish point winner in 2022 but has not shown a great deal under rules this season
runners.spotlight: Absent for over two years after good-ground Irish point win in 2022 and has not shown a great deal under rules this season; beaten 31l and 53l in her first two chases (both in February); needs subsequent wind op to have made a difference.

5:15.race_name: DragonBet Sponsors Alan Johns Handicap Chase
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.4) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 1.50 +48yds, 2.25, 4.05 & 4.40 +69yds, 3.00 +38yds, 3.30 +75yds and 5.15 +65yds)

runners.name: Walkinthewoods
runners.comment: Kept on strongly to go close over C&D two starts ago and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on some of last year's form and attracted the stewards' attention when running on strongly to go very close over C&D (heavy; jockey suspended for misjudged ride) in February; had excuses when struggling (refused at eighth fence) in Leicester race won by Bumpy Evans last month (bled from the nose) and is versatile regarding ground; can be dangerous if back on song.

quotes.race: Inscapes Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walkinthewoods ran well at times last season, but was very babyish and it was a low-grade race so you wouldn't get carried away - Evan Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a grand horse and we'll just tip away with him this season over fences. He's suited by various tracks and, while he's not big, he'll enjoy chasing. 02-11-23

He's the sort of horse you need as a trainer. You can run him over hurdles or fences and he gives the owner some sport. He's a little pony of a horse but when you're desperate for a winner he gets you one. He's probably best with a light weight in a better race. 28-02-24

runners.name: Eileens Milan
runners.comment: Became very disappointing over hurdles for Paul Nicholls; now chasing for new stable
runners.spotlight: Went close in Newton Abbot novice hurdle (2m5f, good) for Paul Nicholls last summer but quickly became very disappointing for him; drying ground might aid his cause on today's stable/chase debut but he has a lot more to prove than some of these.

runners.name: Tedwin Hills
runners.comment: Easily reeled in after leading on recent stable debut; drops back from 3m today
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with two disappointing runs for the Newland/Insole stable this season and was easily reeled in after leading on recent debut for Warren Greatrex (3m); will presumably be ridden very positively again over this shorter trip but still has questions to answer.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Sponsors Huntingdon Jockeys Championship Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Tedwin Hills is gorgeous and promised the world in his early days. We thought we were teaching him on the job for his hurdling days and that he's every inch a chaser. Nothing's happened since - he's been a textbook morning glory to be honest. Everybody's been patient with him, the owner especially because he's cost him plenty of money. He's had a wind op and things like that to no avail at all, so it's very rewarding for everybody - Tom Bellamy, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He'd been frustrating but we eventually got everything right at Huntingdon last month which was down to team perseverance. He's usually a fantastic jumper but jumped out to the left at Hereford on Tuesday and was just way too keen. We'll check him over and make sure he's okay, but he definitely wants three miles and a bit of nice ground. 22-11-23

A nicely-bred youngster who could make his debut at Uttoxeter on Friday. We gave him a gallop at Newbury racecourse last season and he looked nice. He is something of a dark horse but I think he will be all right. 26-10-21

runners.name: Get Cracking
runners.comment: Ran well in latest chase but was well beaten over hurdles last time; now 0-8 under rules
runners.spotlight: Gave pretty good account when fourth over fences at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) in February and should be fine over today's shorter trip, but last month's hurdle run was very disappointing and he's now 0-8 under rules.

runners.name: Palawan Du Mazet
runners.comment: Began chasing career with ready win at Taunton two months ago; must be considered
runners.spotlight: Began chasing career with ready win at Taunton (2m2f, soft) two months ago, drawing nicely clear of the others with a dual subsequent winner; may not want the ground to dry out (withdrawn with good ground deemed unsuitable last month) but could still be well handicapped after a 7lb rise.

runners.name: Pescatorius
runners.comment: Won stylishly at Catterick in December and has remained in good form this year; a player
runners.spotlight: Won stylishly at Catterick (1m7f, good) just after Christmas and has remained in good form at up to 2m4f this year; unseated rider on two of last four appearances but has a big role to play if he avoids mishaps.

runners.name: Bumpy Evans
runners.comment: Off the mark under rules with clearcut Leicester win last month and remains lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner last spring; bettered his encouraging return to rules action when well-backed winner at Leicester (2m4f, good to soft) last month, where he built up a big lead, came right back to the field on the final circuit and then kicked on again in the straight; 6lb higher but remains lightly raced; shortlisted.

runners.name: Ceejaybe
runners.comment: Ran well for long way on chasing debut and has been given a good chance by the handicapper
runners.spotlight: 0-15 under all codes but ran well for a long way before weakening into fourth on chasing debut at Leicester (2m4f, soft) in December and looked stretched by 2m7f when below that form at Huntingdon last month; given a good chance by the handicapper; could have a say.

runners.name: Mini Fortune
runners.comment: Well beaten over hurdles but this five-time point winner looks interesting on chase debut
runners.spotlight: 5-15 in points (all wins on good/good to soft); well beaten in three novice/maiden hurdles this year (2m-2m3f) but looks very interesting now switched to fences off a basement handicap mark.

runners.name: Higgs
runners.comment: Won twice over 3m last spring but out of form since returning from a break in November
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 3m last spring (soft/good; once here) but has been out of form since returning from a break in November and is getting very long in the tooth now.

quotes.race: Double Delight Hat-Trick Heaven At totesport.com Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Higgs is still learning and should improve again. I did not think he might handle this sticky ground, but he has done well and we will keep him going for another run or two before he has a summer break - Sarah-Jayne Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Illico Du Breuil
runners.comment: Pulled up in two slow-ground hurdles in the autumn; 4lb wrong for chase/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in a soft-ground Irish point in March 2023 but showed only a glimmer of promise on hurdle debut the following June and, following a long absence, was pulled up twice here in the autumn; makes chase/handicap debut after another break and from 4lb out of the weights; had wind op in January; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Shadows
runners.comment: Remains very unexposed but stable has much more obvious chance with Bumpy Evans
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in three 2m maiden/novice hurdles last spring/summer and is 5lb wrong for this chase/handicap debut; remains very unexposed but stable has much more obvious chance with Bumpy Evans.

4:55.race_name: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Diligent Harry
runners.comment: Not at very best so far this year but smart on his day and not impossibly treated
runners.spotlight: Smart performer, including two AW Listed successes in February 2024; not at his best in two runs this year but not impossibly treated back in a handicap (successful off 2lb lower on his last handicap run in February 2023); the return to 6f should suit too.

quotes.race: 1895 Duke Of York Clipper Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We did our fight there, then the first and second came at us late in the day. I'm very proud of Diligent Harry, it was a big run. I'm very pleased and he's in a good place. I couldn't be more happier bar winning. We've got him in the King Charles III at Royal Ascot as a stiff five furlongs is more in our favour - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: BetUK Hever Sprint Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We were worried about the drop back to the minimum [trip], but Clive thought there would be plenty of pace on which would suit Diligent Harry and he was right. There are plenty of options going forward after that - Martin Bosley, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Championships Conditions Stakes
quotes.quote: It was a great ride. I'm looking forward to the summer with Diligent Harry, he's exciting. He's got a bit of confidence, gelding has helped him and he's matured - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 3 Year Old All-Weather Championships Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We're a little bit away from that [Commonwealth Cup] at the moment but let's hope Diligent Harry takes a step forward. I still think he could be quite special - Adam Kirby, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet New Instant Roulette Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Diligent Harry is still a bit of a baby but he has some size about him and he should be a nice horse for the turf this summer - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a great campaign on the all-weather and to win a big pot like he did at Newcastle so early in the year is wonderful. I'm delighted he's back to his best and I don't see why he can't produce a similar level of form on turf on the right ground. He can't handle soft and good ground is perfect. He's in the Duke of York Stakes and we'll give that serious consideration, while we'll have the Chipchase at Newcastle in mind in the summer because he's shown such a liking for that track. 02-05-23

It was great to see him back to near his best when second in the Group 3 Hackwood Stakes at Newbury. He had enjoyed a good campaign before that, having won twice at Newcastle, the latter being the All-Weather Sprint Championships. The form of that race is pretty hot as the runner-up, Witch Hunter, went on to win at Royal Ascot, while further down the field Vadream has gone on to win the Group 3 Palace House Stakes at Newmarket. He has yet to win on grass, but his head second to Commanche Falls last time, one of the most consistent horses in training, shows that there are big races to be won with him. I think the Hopeful Stakes at Newmarket is a possible logical step after that fine effort. At some point we will give him a break before preparing him for the next all-weather season. 02-08-23

runners.name: Purosangue
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & R C Dollar
runners.comment: 0-7 in 2024 but ran some fine races in defeat; sold 150,000gns in Oct & gelded; AW debut
runners.spotlight: Listed winner as a 2yo; 0-7 in 2024 but he ran to a useful level on a couple of occasions, second in a 5f Group 3 at Sandown and a 6f Listed race at York; sold for 150,000gns in October but remains in the care of Andrew Balding; has been gelded over the winter and appeals as the type to carry on improving; AW debut.

quotes.race: Coral Rockingham Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: When I rode Purosangue the last day, he bumped into a really nice horse of Karl's (Burke, trainer). I was very confident he'd stay the six and he stayed well. He was a willing partner who has been so consistent all year and deserved to finish off the year on a high note. He wouldn't be the biggest but he's solid. He's got great mental strength and I'd be confident he'd train on" - P J McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: Jaeger-Lecoultre Molecomb Stakes (Group 3) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We're just thrilled Purosangue is back on form - he created a very good impression first time out, and we just thought he did things the wrong way round at Newmarket. That was much more like it, and he was beaten by a very good horse. He won on pretty good ground at Haydock so I think he's quite versatile. He looks like he'll be made for the Roses at York - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Wiltshire
runners.comment: Can be a slow starter but progressive, including on Tapeta; has more to come
runners.spotlight: Can be slowly away but progressive for William Haggas last year, winning a big-field Newbury handicap one year ago and showing smart handicap form when beating 13 rivals at Newcastle last June (6f); far too free in an Ascot Group 3 in October and faced a stiff task behind Night Raider in a Newcastle Listed event when last seen but looks a Pattern performer in the making.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet 200 Shops Nationwide Handicap
quotes.quote: I was very impressed. The race developed in front of us and we picked up the pieces. The gaps got tight but Wiltshire stuck his neck out and he kicked on well. The ground went against him last time as it was a bit quick and he didn't let himself down on it. You've seen the best version of him and he's improving - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

runners.name: Shartash
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Useful 7f performer; promising return at Lingfield but lacklustre effort over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Two 7f wins last spring, including Listed; made a promising seasonal/handicap debut when third at Lingfield in February (6f) but he was disappointing over C&D last month, awkward leaving the stalls but unable to make up any ground in the straight; dropped another 2lb; more appealing over further.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Spring Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shartash is a proper horse and we're delighted. Gelding him has been the key, I've never known more of a transformation with a horse for it. I think he can be versatile between six and seven furlongs, but I thought he looked like a sprinter there - if you stop that race at the furlong pole he wins by three lengths. He'll go straight to the Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee now, and he'll be going for all of those six and seven Group races and Group 1s - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race
quotes.quote: Coming here I was confident that it would take a smart one to beat Shartash. He's a sharp colt, and for one of the Aga's he shows plenty of pace. It was a bit close for comfort, the other one was battling back at the end. He's a nice colt. He's tough, he's hardy and we'll stick him up into stakes class now - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Korker
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood

prev_owners.owner: Fine Claret Racing & More Turf Racing

runners.comment: 3rd in Ayr Gold Cup off this mark last year; promise in one AW run; no great record fresh
runners.spotlight: Habitual slow starter; failed to win in 2024 but he ran some fine races in defeat, including in top-end handicaps (third in the Ayr Gold Cup off today's mark); ran well in his only other AW start (5f, Newcastle); has the ability to feature but first time out perhaps not the day to catch him.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Korker seemed to get away reasonably well, he was tracking the pace and he finished strongly - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka, The Jewel Of Asia Handicap
quotes.quote: Korker was very good and he especially jumped the gates nicely. He was very relaxed at the start and he picked them off. He bumped into a horse rated 111 at Ascot [Emaraaty Ana] and wasn't far behind him. His last three runs have been very good and he's been frustrating at the gates before, but he's really come on. He's grown up now. He's got a bit of a confidence booster now and after speaking to the boss that might be it for the year, so he'd be ending it on a high - Clifford Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Eddie And Violet Smith Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Korker has been so unlucky as he keeps missing the break and deserves his win. I've ridden him loads and when he doesn't miss the break, he never actually races through, but when you miss it slightly he hits the frame. He didn't miss it today, but we couldn't get into stride in the first furlong. I thought we were going to get lapped but he really got me back into it - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Irish Champions Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Korker was very relaxed for a sprinter. He'll go for the Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot.

quotes.race: Lee Thomas Christy Memorial Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Korber is a little bit quirky in the stalls, hence he goes in last with the hood on, but he jumped reasonably quickly and had a nice smooth run. He's a high-class horse, who we've thrown in the deep end, and he's proved he's got a lot of ability. We'll see what Listed races are around for him and I'm sure he'll be a lovely horse next year - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper 5f horse who finished last year really well and has finally started to jump properly. He should have been a Royal Ascot winner but he got left ten lengths in the Holyroodhouse two years ago and got beaten by three and a half. If he keeps jumping, he's a Listed/Group 3 horse. He doesn't mind cut in the ground. 03-04-24

A horse I have a lot of time for. He was most unfortunate not to win on his debut at York last year when missing the break, giving up several lengths and only going down by a head. He has not done a lot wrong since, winning three times as a juvenile and ending up the season on a mark of 92. On his second run this season at York last time he defied top weight with an impressive win over 5f, but the handicapper has really hammered him hard with a 9lb rise. He was going for the Holyroodhouse after that but it will be tough now off 104. We will still head to the royal meeting and see how that pans out, but off his new mark we will have to start looking at Listed and Group 3 races for him. I think there is more to come - I certainly hope so after such a sharp hike in his mark. 01-06-22

runners.name: Holkham Bay
runners.comment: Progressive last year; goes well fresh and on AW; still capable of further improvement
runners.spotlight: Had a good year in 2024 winning three handicaps, notably a Class 2 event at Ascot (6f, soft) when last seen in early October; up 4lb but he boasts a good record on AW and when fresh so he's further up the list than most.

quotes.race: BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm delighted and the little bit of juice in the ground helped Holkham Bay, as it was quick enough at Doncaster last time. We'll put him away now but we'll be looking forward to next year, and we hope he can be a nice horse for the big Saturday TV races. He loves Ascot and we'll definitely be looking towards June next year, especially if there's some juice in the ground, but for now he's earned a well-deserved holiday - William Knight, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Dash (Handicap)
quotes.quote: The owners have been telling me for about three months that the Portland at Doncaster is his race, and they could be right. I think Holkham Bay is a premium sprinter but the key is a flat course and a strong pace. There is a race at York on the final day of the Ebor in two weeks that we are considering on the way to Doncaster - William Knight, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had been pleasing me before his debut at Lingfield this month and ran a lovely race to finish second over 6f. We'll try to win a novice back at Lingfield in the next fortnight. Further down the line there are some sales races we may look at. 30-06-22

runners.name: Strike Red
runners.comment: York win last October (6f, soft) is strong form; back from a break and drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: As good as ever last year, notably when winning a strong York handicap last October (6f, soft); 6lb higher today and first time out perhaps not the time to catch him either.

quotes.race: Coral Sprint Trophy Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Strike Red had a bad injury last year that you wouldn't really see on Flat horses and more on jumpers. He's been better than ever this year and this worked out easily enough. I always told Richard [Fahey, trainer] he feels like a Group horse and he's a top-end handicapper. There's plenty still to look forward to - Billy Garritty, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Scurry Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Strike Red has been a good horse for me. He keeps winning these big handicaps so I'm absolutely delighted. I didn't think Ripon really suited him the last day.  When he gets there he doesn't do a lot. He pricks his earls a little bit - Billy Garritty, rider

runners.name: Ferrous
runners.comment: Ready win at Lingfield (6f) in February but up 4lb in a better race and drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Started last season with a bang and he repeated the feat with a ready win at Lingfield in February (6f; well backed); 4lb rise, deeper opposition and the widest stall could be enough to scupper a follow up.

quotes.race: BetUK AWC Sprint Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: Ferrous has done that well in a smart race. It's his first go round here and he took a bit of getting round the bend but he's in a great spot - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Betonline At BetGoodwin Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: We've had to wait a while for Ferrous as he's been slow maturing but he's worth waiting for. He did that well as he had to tough it out - Mick Channon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has started back really well, winning a 6f handicap at Lingfield in February. His form screams he's a better horse on the all-weather than turf, but I believe that's more down to circumstances than anything else. He's a little bit tricky to get spot on but I feel like we have him there at the moment. There are two big handicaps to target him at - one at Southwell on Sunday and one at Newcastle. We may look at something on the turf later on, maybe the Stewards' Cup or the Wokingham, but then he'll have an early break with a view to having him back for the all-weather again. 02-04-25

runners.name: Vintage Clarets
runners.comment: Two 5f wins last autumn; better at that trip though and absent since October
runners.spotlight: Won two 5f handicaps in the autumn; 0-10 over 6f and although he was placed in the Coventry as a 2yo, he looks vulnerable over the trip after a 162-day break.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a bit easier this year [than last year]. Vintage Clarets' last couple of runs were good, he enjoys that ground, he broke well and I was able to get the run of the race - Osin Orr, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We got there plenty soon enough and in the last-furlong Vintage Clarets was only just doing enough but I did think we got nailed on the line.  He's a legend of a horse and he's been very consistent all year. It's great to get a win on him - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Woolhampton
runners.comment: Enjoyed a good year in 2024 but starts this season off a lofty mark as a result
runners.spotlight: Won four times in a productive 2024, the latest on heavy ground at Nottingham last October (5f); has won over 6f on Tapeta but not sure they're her preferred conditions; resumes off a mark that demands further progress.

stable_tour.quote: She seems to be an Ascot specialist- she loves the place and goes there again for the big £100,000 handicap this week. After that, all being well, she'll go- like Amazonian Dream- for the sprint final at Windsor on August 12. She's done very well over 5f (and won a qualifier over 5f at Windsor), but for £75,000 we'll have a crack over 6f. 11-07-24

runners.name: Malc
runners.comment: No win since debut but he's run well in three good Newcastle handicaps this winter
runners.spotlight: Still to add to his debut success as a 2yo but he has taken well to AW this winter, in the frame in three Class 2 handicaps at Newcastle; looks the clear pick of the Richard Fahey contingent.

quotes.race: Norfolk Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Malc has run a lovely race. His lack of experience maybe just told. He got outpaced mid-race but he stayed on well and I think he's going to come on when he steps up in trip - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Spangled Mac
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Adrian Mcalpine
runners.comment: Good record on AW and won in Bahrain in January; absence of cheekpieces the concern here
runners.spotlight: Two wins, a second and a third from his four AW starts; returns from a spell in Bahrain off a winning mark; best recent form has come when wearing cheekpieces and they are absent today.

quotes.race: Always Gamble Responsibly With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: We were on it from a long way down, they went very quick in front of me. Spangled Mac's form at six and seven furlongs has definitely benefited him - Billy Loughnane, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Acca Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: That's my seventh winner and thanks to Mr Boughey for putting me up. I won on SPANGLED MAC at Kempton and he's improved from there and picked up nicely when I asked him - Connor Planas, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He never ran as a two-year-old but quickly made up for lost time last year with four wins ranging from 5½f to 7f. I took him to Dubai where he wintered well, and I thought he would win on his final run there but he was drawn wide and Oisin Murphy could not get out of the traffic. His mark has dropped from 97 to 95, which might not sound a lot, but it may be just enough to keep him out of the Wokingham. I am desperate for him to get in that race as I think 6f off a strong pace on fast ground is 100 per cent what he wants. He's in very good form, and we have to make a brave call next week of do we run in the Buckingham Palace Stakes, where he will definitely get in, or wait and hope he makes it in the Wokingham. I wish they were run the other way round. 14-06-23

runners.name: Billyjoh
runners.breeder: Cleartherm Glass Sealed Units & J Holt
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on dangerous mark; sharper for last week's return; draw not ideal
runners.spotlight: C&D record reads 5112; smart handicap form last year, including when placed at Royal Ascot (7f) and in the Stewards' Cup (off 2lb higher); promising return to action at Doncaster last week, a race where he looked a bit rusty; not ideally drawn but could take a step forward and he's high on the list.

quotes.race: Your First Destination Baggage Factory Lakeside Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was so green in the first half of the race but once he kind of got himself straightened up in the last furlong and a half, he really put his head down and showed a good attitude. Billyjoh loved the ground, he never missed a foot on it. I don't think he's beaten a bad field there and being so green, I think you have to kind of upgrade that as well - Frederick Larson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Aramram
runners.comment: Strong form last autumn and ran well for second on last week's return; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Did well last autumn, winning 6f handicaps at Doncaster and Wolverhampton either side of his second in the Ayr Silver Cup; heavily backed on his seasonal return at Kempton last week and went close, finishing with a flourish but unable to quite peg back the front-running winner; up 2lb but strong claims all the same.

3:45.race_name: BetMGM: It's Showtime EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Tremorgio
runners.comment: Ended well on top in a Newmarket maiden (1m2f, soft) and a C&D novice (at 1-7)
runners.spotlight: Fitted with cheekpieces when ending well on top in a maiden at Newmarket (1m2f, soft; 9-1) in October and a novice over C&D (at 1-7; despite some interference) in February; this is a much harder task than last time but he's a useful prospect at the very least.

quotes.race: Boodles Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tremorgio has stepped up and he could be a mile-and-a-half prospect next year given how he finished off - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Our Enery
runners.breeder: Allevamento Le Gi Srl Societa' Agricola
runners.comment: 8-11, won four-runner novice at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) three weeks ago in tidy style
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling, late foal; showed promise at Newmarket (1m, soft) in October and justified 8-11 favouritism in four-runner novice at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; the latter was in tidy fashion and he'll be capable of better, but others currently have a better chance on form.

runners.name: Betelgeuse
runners.breeder: Gustut Zur Kuste Ag & Sarl Riviera Eq
runners.comment: 165,000gns yearling; behind on both starts as 2yo and best watched for the time being
runners.spotlight: 165,000gns yearling; behind in a maiden at Sandown (1m, good) in August and novice at York (1m, good to soft) in September; has an extra 4f but no form claims and best watched for the time being.

runners.name: Nightime Dancer
runners.comment: 16-1 at Newmarket (7f, good) in November, hanging but staying on nicely to be third of 15
runners.spotlight: 110,000gns foal, by Ghaiyyath; 16-1 for novice at Newmarket (7f, good) in November, drawn widest and hanging right from 3f out but he stayed on nicely to be third of 15; has Dante and Irish Derby entries; in the mix on that debut form and could be a big improver.

runners.name: Renato
runners.owner: Jonny Allison & Beppa E Gigi S R L
runners.comment: Nearly got to an odds-on favourite in maiden at Kempton (1m3f, Polytrack) in December
runners.spotlight: Late foal by Sea The Stars; last in a novice at Newmarket (1m, soft) in October but he nearly got to an odds-on favourite in maiden at Kempton (1m3f, Polytrack) in December, coming from mid-division to be second of 13; considered on that and he's open to further improvement.

runners.name: Rock Camelot
runners.comment: Doncaster 2nd (1m, soft); has a form chance and stoutly bred, open to further progress
runners.spotlight: 28-1 and 18-1 when making the running on both starts last season, seeing it out better when second of eight in maiden at Doncaster (1m, soft) in October; has a form chance and stoutly bred, open to further progress.

4:20.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Almaty Star
runners.comment: Comes here in top form and looks a solid candidate for a yard that runs two
runners.spotlight: In top form this year, winning at Wolverhampton either side of runner-up finishes there and over C&D; should make another bold bid; stable also runs Rhythm N Hooves.

quotes.race: Esprit Couture 1er Cru Handicap
quotes.quote: Almaty Star has been a bit of a revelation since dropping him back to five and using those forcing tactics. Ray has given him quite an intelligent ride. He stacked them up and got them all caught on heels - Robert Cowell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Cinque Verde
runners.comment: 7-16 on AW; impressive at Wolverhampton ten days ago but up 7lb in a deeper race
runners.spotlight: Enhanced her already smart AW record with a fine front-running display at Wolverhampton ten days ago; could yet have more to come but such progress is a must up 7lb in a deeper race.

stable_tour.quote: She was in very good form on the all-weather earlier this year, winning five times between February and May. She was fifth at Windsor last week and then sixth there again on Saturday. She may go to Brighton, where she's entered in the Bullet on Friday. 07-08-24

runners.name: Rhythm N Hooves
runners.comment: Two C&D wins already this year; behind stablemate Almaty Star at Wolverhampton latest
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins this year already; finished behind reopposing stablemate Almaty Star at Wolverhampton last month; the return to this track could narrow the gap.

quotes.race: Palace of Holyroodhouse Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rhythm N Hooves was inexperienced coming into this, it was only his fifth race. He learnt a lot at York the last day, that was a big shock for him going from all-weather novices through to these 20, 25-runner handicaps. He has obviously shown a high level of ability here, so hopefully we can either go to more of these high-grade handicaps, but I wouldn't put it past going for a Listed race maybe with him at some point - Archie Watson, trainer.

runners.name: Crimson Sand
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in good form and Oisin Murphy booked; first runner for Dan Horsford
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 in good form, winning 6f handicaps at Chelmsford and Wolverhampton before a close fourth at the latter track 97 days ago; first runner as a licensed trainer for Dan Horsford and they have secured Oisin Murphy to ride.

quotes.race: Betway Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Crimson Sand had a few niggly problems last year but this year he's been flawless and that was a good start. He was working well enough to go and win that so I'm delighted. We'll see what he gets but he'll be better over six than five - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I have to say he has been a massive trainer balls-up. I ran him over 5f in a bad race at Lingfield in February to get him to win and he did it well. So we backed up over 6f six weeks later and he won again. We went to Ascot in May, but the ground was slow and I was disappointed with his effort. His owners were keen to go to Royal Ascot, so I ran him at Nottingham to make him eligible for the 5f race at the royal meeting, but he got beaten a length and a quarter having got left at the start. That was Ascot out of the window, so we sent him to Newmarket last month, where he did not see his race out over 5f. He has to have conditions like a road to be at his best. 14-07-21

runners.name: Completely Random
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo; shaped well over 6f here in November; gelded since; interesting down to 5f
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo; well backed and shaped with plenty of promise when fourth in a good 6f handicap here when last seen in November; highly likely he's ahead of his mark; been gelded since last seen; interesting dropped to 5f for the first time.

runners.name: Marching Mac
runners.comment: Soared up the weights when winning 5 handicaps last autumn; returns on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a red-hot spell last autumn, winning five handicaps (5f-6f on good or slower) and soaring 28lb up the weights; only fifth at Nottingham when last seen five months ago; up against it on his return.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Apprentice Handicap (Hands And Heels Race) (Part Of The RE Series)
quotes.quote: Marching Mac is a five-furlong horse now and the stiff trip got him beat yesterday. He's a little bit keen and we had to hold on to him whereas back here in this sort of race, we can let him bowl along. Grace [McEntee] rides out at George's every day and she stuck Fred up for the ride. This horse came from George's as well so there's a lot of George Boughey connection there. He's entered at Chelmsford on Saturday in a 58 handicap because I knew he was 60 yesterday, the handicapper put him up for getting beat last week. Now I can run in a 58, rated 62 with no penalty for winning a kids' race. It's just stuff I love to do -  trainer Phil McEntee speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Brave Nation
runners.comment: Progressive sprinter last year, including C&D; excuse when last seen; yard in form; solid
runners.spotlight: String of good runs last year, winning twice at Doncaster and running a cracker over C&D last August; unsuited by soft ground when last seen (officially good but changed after the race was run); ran well on last season's reappearance despite slower ground than ideal; stable in form and he's a leading contender.

quotes.race: bettingsites.co.uk Betting Sites Handicap
quotes.quote: Brave Nation has been in great shape. He ran well here two starts ago and ran a great race again at Sandown last time. He's got a lot of natural speed and hopefully he can start to climb back up the ranks - Billy Loughnane, rider.

runners.name: Jered Maddox
runners.comment: Irish raider; fine record on AW/beach; 3lb rise for latest Dundalk win could find him out
runners.spotlight: Prolific on AW/beach in Ireland; as good as ever when winning a 5f handicap at Dundalk 16 days ago; 3lb higher mark to defy against deeper opposition.

runners.name: Sevensees

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate

runners.comment: Beat Moulin Booj over C&D last month, his second stable start; 2lb rise not beyond him
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo; confirmed the promise of his stable debut at Chelmsford when getting the better of Moulin Booj over C&D 16 days ago (made the running); 2lb higher mark to contend with but remains of interest.

runners.name: Sports Coach
runners.comment: Shaped OK on stable debut at Wolverhampton last month; still time to fulfil early promise
runners.spotlight: Promising 2yo on AW for Karl Burke; struggled in both turf runs for that yard last spring, after which he was sold for 40,000gns; had gelding and wind ops prior to stable debut at Wolverhampton last month and ran better than his odds suggested he would; still time to fulfil that early potential.

stable_tour.quote: I think he's a Group sprinter in the making. He won his last two races on the all-weather very well and will go to Bath for a £45,000 three-year-old handicap on Sunday. If it comes up very soft he'll wait for a 0-90 at Thirsk, then he'll go for the Westow at York. 03-04-24

runners.name: Moulin Booj
runners.comment: Consistent and has conditions to suit; beaten by reopposing rivals on last three starts
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; placed in all four runs since returning to AW in November, second to reopposing rivals on his last three starts; edging up the weights and although he's likely to run well, others may have his measure.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a huge amount of issues but thankfully they all are behind him now. He's a very good-looking horse and I always anticipated he'd start winning races, so it wasn't a surprise to see him win last time out. He just needed his first run of the year and he got it right at Southwell. It's a lot easier to bridge a gap in sprint races than in middle-distance contests, so I think he'll run in some nice races and will continue to be competitive even up in grade. A track like Epsom would suit him very well and I could see him popping up in a nice race this season and picking up the pieces on the right day. 29-03-24

runners.name: Muker
runners.comment: Capable sprinter and in good form on AW when last seen; five-month absence the worry
runners.spotlight: Useful sprinter who has run with great credit in his last three AW runs; back from five months off perhaps not the time to catch him.

quotes.race: Download The ITV App British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Muker's form has worked out well and he'll go for the Molecomb in three weeks. He's all speed - but for a horse with so much speed he has a great mind. - Paul Mulrennan, rider

quotes.race: Betway / British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: Muker was supposed to go to Doncaster, he was ready to go the first day and Phil's done a good job to keep him ticking along nicely until now. He's been really good at home, we've done plenty with him and we make sure they know their job, which he did today. He's been really professional and he couldn't have done it nicer. The owner will be absolutely thrilled to go to Ascot, if he won or ran well today that was the plan. - Sammy Jo Bell, partner of winning trainer Philip Makin

runners.name: The Thames Boatman
runners.comment: Talented sprinter on his day; needs the new cheekpieces to spark extra from him
runners.spotlight: Talented sprinter on his day and he boasts a fine record on AW; below best at Lingfield in February but that was a Class 2 event; new cheekpieces join the usual hood.

quotes.race: It's Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: The Thames Boatman needs pace in his races and looking at this race beforehand I knew he'd get that today, so that was an advantage. He's at his best when he has something to aim at, but he made life harder for himself by hanging in the last half a furlong. We do think he's a smart horse, especially on the all-weather - Finley Marsh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was brilliant at Lingfield on Saturday, taking his record at the track to 3-3. He just got there over 5f and we might see an ounce of improvement if we go to 6f. He loves Lingfield, so we'll probably stick to there for now. 18-09-24

runners.name: Fine Wine

prev_owners.owner: Paul Dixon Kevin Brennan and Partners

runners.comment: Smart at best; lightly raced last year; absent 350 days but given good weights chance
runners.spotlight: Developed into a smart 5f performer in 2022 and early 2023 (RPR 108); only seen three times in 2024, doing enough to think he retained some spark; absent for 350 days but he's been given a real chance by the handicapper and he could outrun his likely big odds.

quotes.race: Paddy Power 'Making Flat Less Flat' Handicap
quotes.quote: There were worries about turning out so quickly, he's always sore the day after he runs, going back to the first time I ran him. It was a good run at Hamilton and I had no intention of declaring him but I trotted him up and he was like a dressage horse, he was absolutely perfect so I had to declare him. That is by far his most impressive performance to date. You've got to keep sprinters going when they're in this sort of form because they can soon drop out of it and the Dash is the next target. I've been speaking about it for months, we've been second and third and I'd love to win it. It's a very hot race and it doesn't suit every horse, rolling down a hill, but Fine Wine is so quick and he almost broke the track record at Southwell - Scott Dixon, trainer.

runners.name: Dividend
runners.comment: 2-2 on the AW including on his return over C&D last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner and 2-2 on the AW, his latest success coming on his return from 156 days off over C&D last month (third has won since); 5lb higher, but there looks to be more to come; big player.

quotes.race: British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rossa thought Dividend was still green and he didn't do a lot in front, but he said we have to go for a black type race now. I think he'll only get better as the season goes on. When you looked at the card this morning with Juddmonte and Qatar, you have these massive super powers with massive trainers. I always thought he was a nice horse, that's why we came to Sandown - we thought the track would suit him down to the ground. To now see him prove it on the track what I've seen at home is very gratifying - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Molveno
runners.comment: Completed a hat-trick before out of his depth in a warm contest last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Completed an AW hat-trick over this trip during the winter, but was out of his depth in the conditions event won by the 2000 Guineas third-favourite Opera Ballo at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last time; respected back at this level.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: The plan was always to make the running like we did at Kempton last time out and Molveno relaxed really well in front. His ears were pricked forward just looking at everything, but he won really nicely - Marco Ghiani, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Big Sip
runners.comment: Easily won a weak Lingfield maiden on his return, but shouldn't be underestimated
runners.spotlight: Didn't have much to beat when sent off 1-7 for his reappearance in a Lingfield maiden (1m, Polytrack; first start since being gelded) last month; this looks tougher on handicap debut, but he shouldn't be underestimated.

runners.name: Tilted Kilt
runners.breeder: Sun Bloodstock S A R L
runners.comment: Returns from six months off having been gelded and may find a few too good
runners.spotlight: Best form has come on the Kempton Polytrack, making a winning debut there (7f) last June and going down by a neck in a nursery (1m) in September; returns from six months off having been gelded and may find a few too good; cheekpieces removed after one use.

runners.name: Thunder Wonder
runners.comment: Dam won on the AW in France but he still has plenty to prove back from seven months off
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a Thirsk novice (7f, good) last August, but tailed off on his nursery debut at Doncaster (7f, good) the following month; dam won on the AW in France but still has plenty to prove back from seven months off.

runners.name: Tremolo
runners.comment: Won over 7f here on final start at two; more is needed but still open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Improved in each of his three starts late last year, winning a slowly run novice here (7f) on his final outing; more needed on handicap debut after four months off, but still open to improvement and the longer trip should suit.

runners.name: Jamarr
runners.comment: 2-2 at Dundalk late last year; up 5lb and back from 4 months off, but cannot be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Irish raider who was 2-2 in Dundalk nurseries (1m, Polytrack) late last year; up another 5lb back from four months off and tackles a new surface, but cannot be ruled out.

runners.name: Joseph
runners.comment: Not beaten far in his last two starts over C&D, but 0-6 and doesn't seem to be progressing
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in his last two starts over C&D, but now 0-6 and doesn't seem to be progressing; tough task with his rivals all previous winners.

6:00.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Blue Bolt
runners.comment: Expensive newcomer who looks very much the part on breeding; respected
runners.spotlight: 400,000euros yearling; half-sister to winners Sea Theme (1m4f/1m5f including AW/Listed; RPR 108), Sky Angel (7.5f AW 2yo/1m Listed; 104) and Donnybrook (6f 2yo; 78); dam French 1m1f-1m4f winner (including Group 3; 111), sister to French 1m Group 2 winner; sire 15-58 (26%) here in past five seasons, so looks very much the part on breeding; respected.

runners.name: Cradle Of Love

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier/Mrs P Shanahan/K MacLennan/J P Magnier

runners.comment: 0-10 for Joseph O'Brien as a 2yo; interesting to see how she gets on for her new yard
runners.spotlight: 0-10 for Joseph O'Brien as a 2yo, showing some fair form (including on AW) but not really building on early promise; interesting to see how she gets on for her new yard (same owners) after five months off.

stable_tour.quote: She has plenty of ability but threw the race away at Listowel last time. She'd have an outside chance. 12-06-24

runners.name: Gigi Bliss
runners.comment: Unplaced in both starts; may not come into her own until tackling handicaps over further
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in both starts over 7f/1m on turf/Polytrack last autumn, looking inexperienced on both occasions; may not come into her own until tackling handicaps over further.

runners.name: Hello Luna
runners.comment: Third in her only start for Joseph O'Brien at Dundalk on December; form worked out well
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling/breeze-up 2yo; 6-1 when third of nine on her only start for Joseph O'Brien at Dundalk (5f, Polytrack) in December (first two have won since); makes her debut for her new yard having been picked up for 36,000gns in January; the longer trip should suit on breeding and in-form stable had winners here on Wednesday and Friday; interesting.

runners.name: Shwaimah
runners.comment: Runner-up on her Newcastle debut in November; big player if building on that
runners.spotlight: Sent off 40-1 for her Newcastle debut (7f, Tapeta) in November, but displayed plenty of ability in finishing second of the ten runners; any improvement on that would make her a big player.

runners.name: Tapioca Pearl
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Ma
runners.comment: Last of ten on her Kempton debut in November; major improvement required
runners.spotlight: 10-1 when last of ten on her Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) in November (behind Gigi Bliss); major improvement required.

runners.name: The Third Star
runners.comment: Finished in midfield on her Chelmsford debut in November; may need a bit more time
runners.spotlight: Hint of promise when finishing in midfield on her Chelmsford debut (7f, Polytrack; 12-1) in November; may need a bit more time, though.

runners.name: Tuesdays Child
runners.comment: Attractive pedigree and stable often gets them ready first time; respected
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to winners Alkaamel (7f-8.6f including AW/dirt; RPR 106), Give And Take (7.6f 2yo/1m2f Group 3; 101) and Glory And Gold (7f; 72); dam unraced sister to 1m2f-2m4f Group 1 winner Fame And Glory; attractive pedigree and sire 17-81 (21%) here in past five seasons; stable often gets them ready first time; respected.

runners.name: Wonderbolt
runners.comment: Out of the frame in both starts, but has very much caught the eye on each occasion
runners.spotlight: 175,000gns yearling; out of the frame in both starts over 6f/7f on the AW this year, but has very much caught the eye on each occasion; worth a second look.

5:30.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Way Of Stars
runners.comment: Beaten a neck at Goodwood (1m) on debut, best effort; gelded and makes handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten a neck at Goodwood (1m, good to soft) on debut last August; while neither of his subsequent starts lived up to that, it does look as if he will stay this trip; gelded since and makes handicap debut.

runners.name: Patrol

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Bs, China Horse Club & D Howden

runners.comment: Won two of six AW handicaps (Tapeta) this autumn/winter and bang there in all the others
runners.spotlight: Has had 12 races already, winning two of his six AW handicaps (all Tapeta) this autumn/winter and bang there in all the others; has proved himself at 1m4f and at this track, so another good run looks highly likely but he is more exposed than today's rivals.

runners.name: Ray Gun
runners.comment: A win and three 2nds in his four 1m4f handicaps; pipped last twice and cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Won handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in February and second in all three 1m4f handicaps on Tapeta since, beaten a neck here on penultimate outing and a nose at Wolverhampton on latest; needs a bit extra to win this and cheekpieces are enlisted.

runners.name: Zabeel Rain
runners.comment: 1m4f+ is likely to suit and she sports cheekpieces for this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Third at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in December was a bit better than her two runs at this track since, the latest over 1m3f; 1m4f+ is likely to suit and she sports cheekpieces for this handicap debut.

runners.name: Crackalackin
runners.comment: Gelded and makes handicap debut, with new trip plausible on pedigree; needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Fourth over 7f-9.4f on AW on all three starts this winter, probably showing the most promise on second occasion; gelded since latest and makes handicap debut, with new trip plausible on pedigree; needs a market check.

runners.name: Scarlet Moon
runners.comment: Others may have more solid claims but there's a great deal of promise in his pedigree
