runners.spotlight: Has failed to land a blow in three 1m races on turf last August-October (best form on second start); gelded since; others have more solid claims but there's a great deal of promise for this sort of trip in his good pedigree and he is very much one to note on handicap debut.

runners.name: Infantry Officer
runners.comment: Plenty in hand for Wolverhampton wins at 1m4f and 9.4f last month; still capable of better
runners.spotlight: Found stacks of improvement when upped to 1m4f at Wolverhampton on handicap debut last month, justifying 6-4 favouritism by 4l, and he also had plenty in hand when following up at 1-4 over 9.4f there ten days later; another 9lb higher today (15lb higher than first win) but he's probably a fair bit better than that as well.

6:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Bint Al Daar
runners.comment: May need this after six months off and further probably suits her better now
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins have come at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta), the latest from 7lb lower last August; may need this after six months off and further probably suits her better now.

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Bint Al Daar wasn't travelling that well early doors but she crept into it and I got a lovely split when I needed it. Kevin Phillippart de Foy's horses are in good form and she enjoyed the ground - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.name: Bellarchi
runners.comment: 2-2 around here and may step up again from her successful return over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 around here when beating Gaiety Musical by a head on her return from 124 days off over this trip last month; only 2lb higher and may step up again with the run under her belt.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bellarchi has really deserved to win a race as she's been good from day one. I was disappointed she didn't win on debut at Thirsk, but she jumps and runs and has a great mind. She does her job but she's bumped into one or two along the way. She pretty much runs to her mark every time, the only time she didn't was in the Marygate and we don't know why - Grant Tuer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: After plenty of places, she finally got her head in front at Catterick last time out. I was a little frustrated that it took me so long to get her to win, but now she has I think she could add to it. She has a mark of 71, which I think she can defy as there's scope for further progress. I'll speak to her owner and see what the plan might be, possibly running her in a nursery at Carlisle this Friday. If we could find the right race we could go for a novice with a penalty, but we'll discuss it. She's a lovely, straightforward filly who jumps off well and always wears her heart on her sleeve. 30-08-23

runners.name: Enola Grey
runners.comment: Back off her last winning mark, but well held behind a couple of these here last month
runners.spotlight: All five AW wins have come on Tapeta including one over C&D just over a year ago; back off her last winning mark, but well held behind three of these here last month; looks vulnerable to less-exposed rivals.

stable_tour.quote: A 10,000gns purchase who's been a revelation this winter. She's gone from strength to strength. To contend for the Arc Horse of the Year prize you have to keep them busier than you would like, but she thrived on it. Her last two wins at Wolverhampton and Southwell were arguably her best two runs of the whole campaign and she was fourth overall. We'll bring her back on the turf when she's had a rest. It'll be interesting to see if she can continue her progress. 23-05-24

runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.comment: A head behind Bellarchi over C&D last month, but her old rival was making her reappearance
runners.spotlight: Completed an AW hat-trick at around this trip at the start of the year and best effort since when beaten a head by Bellarchi over C&D last month; 1lb better off, but her old rival was making her reappearance so she may not be able to reverse the form.

runners.name: Viennoise
runners.comment: Beaten less than a length into third of six behind two of these over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Lingfield maiden winner (7f, Polytrack) for Archie Watson a year ago and was having her second start for this yard when beaten less than a length into third of six behind Bellarchi and Gaiety Musical over C&D last month; doesn't have many miles on the clock and shouldn't be far away again.

runners.name: Royal Velvet
runners.comment: Still 5lb above her last winning mark and something to find back from 200 days off
runners.spotlight: Four wins over 7f/1m (including two on Tapeta) between December 2023 and July last year, but out of the frame in her last three starts and still 5lb above her last winning mark; has won fresh, but still looks to have something to find back from 200 days off.

quotes.race: Bet £5 Get £20 At tote.co.uk Racing League Race 3 Handicap (Trainers Registered To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Royal Velvet has won really well there today. I did think the flat track and the easy mile really suits her and she likes that ground. She was quite backward last year and she's just really coming to herself. I think she could be quite useful - William Knight, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Liv My Life

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.comment: Paid for her emphatic win here in January; mark is dropping but still has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Bolted up by 4l over 7f here in January, but went up 9lb as a result and has failed to make the frame in three starts since; mark is now dropping, but she still has stamina to prove over this far.

runners.name: Eazy On The Eye
runners.comment: Won twice at Wolverhampton late last year; makes her handicap debut after three months off
runners.spotlight: Showed little in her first two starts last autumn, but then suddenly took off by winning a maiden and a novice at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta), making all on both occasions; makes her handicap debut after three months off and not certain to get her own way this time, but she remains open to further progress.

runners.name: Del Ray
runners.comment: Turf winner and twice placed on AW last year; makes stable debut; market informative
runners.spotlight: Made a successful debut on turf at Lingfield (7f) last May when trained by Archie Watson and was placed over the same trip on the AW at Kempton and Newcastle later in the year; makes her debut for her new yard after five months off having changed hands for 30,000gns in December; market informative.

runners.name: Happy To Fly
runners.comment: Newcastle winner in October; open to more progress now making her handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Both starts last October, improving from an underwhelming debut here (6f) when winning a Newcastle novice (7f, Tapeta; 40-1) 17 days later; open to more progress now making her handicap debut after 166 days off; still holds a 1000 Guineas entry.

2:10.race_name: Henners Vineyard Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Walks Like The Man
runners.comment: C&D winner in February and subsequently ran well in higher-grade company at Sandown
runners.spotlight: Made virtually all to score over C&D (soft) in February, his third start over fences, and was very creditable third in higher-grade company at Sandown (2m4f, good) last month; ought to be a very tough nut to crack.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Chris Gordon EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Walks Like The Man jumped really well today. He's obviously improved for the first run a lot and he was very slick and quick with his jumping. I thought Robbie (Dunne, jockey on runner-up) had the better of me turning in but he got no further clear of me going to the last and, to be fair to this horse, he put his neck out and galloped on really well to the line. He's a nice horse - Harry Cobden, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Another Folly
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie D'Ossau Et Al
runners.comment: Contender if judged on autumn form; needs to bounce back quickly from poor run on Monday
runners.spotlight: 0-11 under all codes; posted some good efforts in the autumn (2m3f-3m) and is a contender here if judged on those, but needs to bounce back quickly from a poor run a Wincanton on Monday.

runners.name: The Dream Goes On
runners.breeder: Dr Rdp Newland & Mr G Farmiloe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Kate Farmiloe And Mrs L J Newland

runners.comment: Came from off the pace for hurdle win last month; can probably improve again over fences
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on handicap hurdle debut in October but returned from four-month break with win from off the pace at Hereford (2m3f, good) four weeks ago; still has plenty of scope for further progress and connections are evidently very keen to launch her chasing career.

runners.name: Brother Boris
runners.breeder: S A Richards & Mrs L Kemble
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks

prev_owners.owner: S A Richards And Louise Kemble

runners.comment: Ran well at Fakenham on New Year's Day but below that form twice since
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over fences and 0-8 overall; ran well from the front in first-time cheekpieces at Fakenham (2m5f, good to soft) on New Year's Day, but was not in same form at Huntingdon (2m7f) on next two outings; others preferred.

runners.name: Warranty
runners.breeder: S C E A Des Bissons
runners.comment: Course winner but has 7l to find with Despereaux on their recent clash here
runners.spotlight: Did well for Gary Moore; has won twice on the Flat for his new yard but has 7l to find with Despereaux on their recent clash here; hard to rule out nonetheless.

stable_tour.quote: We have a nice team of juveniles and this one looks the part. He won at Beverley in July, beating Frankenstella, who has since won three. He appears to have a bit of class and I like him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Jubilant
runners.comment: On a tough mark but Alex Chadwick returns claiming his 5lb; shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Went up 8b for winning by 7l at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) and no real excuses for his subsequent defeats; has dropped 2lb and Alex Chadwick returns claiming his 5lb, while cheekpieces are also added; shouldn't be far away.

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It looked as if Jubilant was always going to win and it's no surprise as we were waiting to run him over this sort of trip. We had to pull him out twice because of soft going, but he handled this ground which had dried out a bit. He could be a good spring horse before going chasing next season - James Owen, trainer.

runners.name: Shared
runners.comment: Losing run of nine but hasn't run badly the last twice and this is a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Three wins include a handicap off 9lb higher in October 2023; rather patchy form in his subsequent nine defeats but hasn't run badly the last twice and this is a drop in grade.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Money Back Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. Shared ran well last time even though he didn't handle Musselburgh at all, Paul could hardly get him round the bends. He needed a third run so he came here in the hope that he might get in the Fred Winter, but I don't know whether or not he'll be rated high enough to get in - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch RacingTV With Free Trial Now Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shared has done that really nicely. He had a decent level of ability on the Flat and I bought him thinking he had a pedigree to stay. There was a risk he might not take to it, but all of his schooling has been good - Harry Derham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Chepstow had been the plan all the way along and we were delighted with his win there on Saturday as we weren't sure how he'd cope with the ground. He's a gusty horse with a huge heart. I'd imagine we'll step him up in trip after Christmas as it can be really hard for those four-year-olds. He did well last season for his level and hopefully he can improve a little bit. 18-10-23

runners.name: Despereaux
runners.comment: Had Warranty some 7l behind when going close over C&D (good) a month ago
runners.spotlight: The cheekpieces have worked well on his last four starts and he had Warranty some 7l behind when going close over C&D (good) one month ago; up another 3lb but has been rated higher in the past; sound claims.

stable_tour.quote: He's brilliantly named as Despereaux is a speedy little mouse and this horse is not very big to say the least. But what he lacks in size he makes up for in heart and effort. After running out on his debut in October, he won his first completed start at Huntingdon in November. I then ran him in the Chatteris Fen at Huntingdon, where he would have been second but for jumping the last a bit long and then veering right. The runner-up won afterwards, making the form look very decent, and it was no surprise when Despereaux won again in a junior hurdle at Taunton on Monday. Due to his size, he looks more of a hurdler than a chaser and is clearly above average. 15-03-23

runners.name: San Pedro

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Won again here in February but he's become a very difficult horse to predict
runners.spotlight: Winning for a third time here when all out over C&D in February (3lb lower; soft; has won on good) but he was soon back in the doldrums at Lingfield; no real significance in the removal of cheekpieces and he's too hard to predict.

quotes.race: nagsbet.com £10 Free Bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Last time at Lingfield you just have to completely scrap that, I think I gave San Pedro a pretty poor ride. Today he's just gone and shown his quality - Freddie Gordon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Tie The Knot Wedding Catering Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's all coming together now and the horses are running better. San Pedro got a nice tow into the race and he finished off very well - Freddie Gordon, jockey and trainer's son.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He has progressed with every run and as well as being tough and genuine, he has speed. I'd imagine he'll start off in a Guineas Trial next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer of San Pedro

stable_tour.quote: A good, solid horse for the owners. He came back to form at Plumpton in early February but then was pulled up at Lingfield last week. We'll keep him in the lowest grade we can for the rest of the season. 26-02-25

runners.name: Bohemian Breeze
runners.comment: Three Flat wins, over 1m2f (turf) and 1m4f (AW); likely contender now hurdling
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 3-28 on the Flat, over 1m2f on turf and 1m4f on AW (best RPR 82); interesting contender on hurdle debut for yard that's won three of the last five runnings; market can guide.

runners.name: God Of Fire
runners.comment: Three wins at 1m2f and 1m3f for previous yard last summer; hurdle debut; betting helpful
runners.spotlight: Had fine spell for the Kublers on the Flat last summer, winning three on the trot at 1m2f (turf; RPR 94) and 1m3f (AW); was below that level for this yard in late 2024, but dam's successful offspring include a winning hurdler so there are hopes he can take to this game; betting helpful.

quotes.race: Unibet - Proudly Supporting Women In Racing Apprentice Handicap (Racing Excellence) (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Since God Of Fire joined the stable he's progressed nicely and grown in confidence. He did that really nicely and, subject to how he comes out of this, we'll likely target Monday (at Windsor) - Claire Kubler, winning trainer speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mint Edition
runners.comment: Three AW wins at 1m/1m1f in 2023; well beaten for new yard in 2024; hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins at 1m and 1m1f for previous yard in early 2023, but well beaten in three 1m runs for new connections in 2024 and best watched on hurdle debut back from another layoff; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Thankyouandplease
runners.breeder: Sarl Igep Haras Du Chateau De Rabodanges
runners.comment: Very tough tasks in both hurdle runs and recent 2nd was a remote one to 1-14 shot
runners.spotlight: Has faced very tough tasks in both hurdle runs at about 2m5f, at Wincanton and Exeter, and his second on the latter track was a remote second of three to a 1-14 shot; handicaps likely to prove more his game.

runners.name: Wild Goose
runners.comment: Shown promise in both bumper starts, on AW and turf; can progress now hurdling
runners.spotlight: Promise in both starts, chasing home a subsequent AW novice winner in a Lingfield Polytrack bumper, then front-running third in a Huntingdon bumper last month; good chance he'll take to hurdles and should improve.

runners.name: Public Enemy
runners.comment: Promising hurdle debut against two more experienced rivals; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Ran well from the front in the second of three Flat runs in France (1m6f) and there was plenty to like about his hurdle debut third at Taunton (2m, good to soft) in February against two much more experienced rivals (second has won since); likely improver.

2:45.race_name: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Time For Tea
runners.comment: First completion for this yard when 80-1 third at Southwell; wasn't beaten far
runners.spotlight: Showed bits of promise for Henry De Bromhead; now 0-11 but it was her first completion for this yard when an 80-1 third at Southwell (2m4f handicap on good to soft) and was beaten under 6l; clear chance if building on that.

runners.name: A Little Something
runners.comment: Disappointing over 2m3f the last twice but has hinted at winning potential
runners.spotlight: Placed in a novice hurdle and again on handicap debut at Hereford when only 2l off the winner (2m, good to soft); subsequent efforts at about 2m3f weren't so encouraging, weakening on both occasions; has a bit to prove now but still commands some respect.

runners.name: Melleray Hill
runners.comment: Irish point winner; three very underwhelming runs in novice/maiden hurdles this year
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; three very underwhelming runs in novice/maiden hurdles this year (1m7f-2m3f) and was due to make her handicap debut over 3m only to be withdrawn.

runners.name: Rockette
runners.comment: Poor the last twice but returning to further can help, as might the cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Some promise for Dan Skelton and again when fifth of 16 on debut for this yard at Warwick (2m3f handicap) after a long absence; tailed off since over 2m (latterly only last week at Stratford) but returning to further can help, as might the cheekpieces.

runners.name: Eliza Dolittle
runners.comment: Twice disappointed since a C&D win in December; soft lead would aid her cause
runners.spotlight: Front-running winner over C&D in December when only 1lb lower; soft ground an excuse next time but her Fontwell effort (2m5f, good) was also underwhelming; difficult to know what to expect from her but an easy lead would aid her cause.

runners.name: Set In The West
runners.comment: Beaten ten times under rules and tried fences when last seen a year ago; 3lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in 2021; beaten ten times under rules and tried fences when last seen a year ago; returns to hurdles from 3lb out of the weights and is best watched; had wind surgery.

4:27.race_name: Goodoaks Homecare You Can Rely On Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Jubilee Gold
runners.comment: Had an excuse latest and weighted to go well on form in early 2024 (soft and good ground)
runners.spotlight: Won 2m maiden at Fakenham (good) in May 2022; off for long time after but he ran three good races at about 2m4f early in 2024, on soft and good ground, and can be excused a pulled-up run at Exeter (heavy) last time when back from another layoff; has prospects off reduced mark.

runners.name: Clinton Lane
runners.comment: C&D winner in October; below best since December fall; down weights; cheekpieces return
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins, at Fontwell (2m1f, heavy; second-time cheekpieces) and over C&D (good to soft); below best since falling at Christmas and needs the return to this track for the first time since the win and the refitted cheekpieces to turn things round.

quotes.race: V2 Radio "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clinton Lane was a big price but we knew the wind op would help him massively and it was just a question of how much it did improve him. He's still a bit green and I know he's run plenty, but he's still a big, raw baby. His mind hasn't caught up with him yet but he's exciting. I was disappointed with his first couple of runs. He showed a bit at Wincanton and dad was persistent because he knew the horse had ability, it was just about trying to find it - Fergus Gillard, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Hardy Buck

prev_owners.owner: Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate/W G Hanly
Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate

runners.comment: Close second over 2m7f in December; remote 2nd over 2m2f latest; trip query again
runners.spotlight: Back from a spell of pointing with close second at Fakenham (2m7f, good to soft) in December but he didn't take kindly to the return to fences next time and his remote second at Market Rasen (2m2f, good) on yard debut leaves him with questions to answer at this trip; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Two C&D wins; comfortable 2m winner before having excuses the next twice; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins; comfortable Huntingdon winner (2m, good) on second run for new yard but 2m3f was a shade further than ideal next time and the race didn't fall his way at Sedgefield on Thursday; visor replaces cheekpieces; good claims if none the worse for quick return.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Goodwin Face
runners.comment: Lightly raced; work to do with Clinton Lane on C&D form and modest handicap debut since
runners.spotlight: Limited chances but has work to do with Clinton Lane at the weights on C&D form (good to soft) in October and his Hereford handicap debut in December was a modest effort; still time for him to do better though.

runners.name: John Betjeman

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

runners.comment: Game 2nd at Wincanton in March; not so good latest but entitled to be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Game effort when shaken off only late at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) in March and he had more to do when sixth at Taunton since; headgear discarded; ran well on only previous course start; thereabouts.

runners.name: Mi Sueno
runners.comment: Two soft-ground wins last spring but gone walkabout this winter, over hurdles and on AW
runners.spotlight: Two soft-ground wins last spring, including over C&D, but he's gone walkabout over hurdles and on the AW this winter; down the list.

runners.name: Arenas Del Tiempo
runners.owner: D Edmonston, T Helliwell & John Moynihan

prev_owners.owner: D Edmonston, T Helliwell, If Only Ptr

runners.comment: Three Flat wins; stuck at it when 2nd on handicap debut (2m, good to soft); can improve
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins in 2021; had just the four hurdle runs and she did stick at it when runner-up on handicap debut at Fakenham (2m, good to soft) last month; not too late for her to improve at this level.

quotes.race: John Benstead Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Arenas Del Tiempo wears her heart on her sleeve and is going in the right direction. She's rangey and can get a bit excitable, but I think she can go on with another winter under her belt. She's suited to Epsom - the twists and turns - and I'm already thinking what we can do with her here next year - Simon Dow, trainer.

quotes.race: Twickenham Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Arenas Del Tiempo would lead as Hollie Doyle changed the whole game plan with the lovely ride she gave her to win at Brighton. She's at the right end of the handicap to still be learning and it's exciting to see what she can do now. We'll look to keep her to courses that suit this style and our 'home' track at Epsom would be perfect for her. Something at the August Bank Holiday fixture might be just what she wants - Simon Dow, trainer.

5:02.race_name: Celebrating Sussex Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Ajs Diamond
runners.comment: Finished a clear second at Warwick and that form sets the standard here
runners.spotlight: Dam won a bumper; this 5yo was 4-1 at Warwick (soft) and came a long way clear of the remainder in chasing home Betty's Daisy who was well beaten at Aintree on Thursday; that was an encouraging start and the form sets the standard here.

runners.name: Anbowlin
runners.breeder: Miss D Quigley & Mrs S O'Toole
runners.comment: Sister to bumper winner Noahsgreatrainbow; stable also runs Jack N Jones
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; sister to bumper winner Noahsgreatrainbow; dam unraced half-sister to useful winners Carrigmartin (2m-2m5f hurdle/chase), City Slicker (bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Hannah's Princess (bumper and 2m2f/2m3f hurdle); jockey bookings would imply that Jack N Jones is the yard's main hope here.

runners.name: Commanche Princess
runners.comment: Lengthy odds when beating one home at Kempton and pulling up at Fontwell
runners.spotlight: Lengthy odds when beating one home at Kempton and pulling up at Fontwell.

runners.name: Girlfromtheglen
runners.comment: Runner-up in sole Irish point and sold on for £35,000; yard won this last year
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in sole Irish point and sold on for £35,000; trainer normally does well in bumpers but not this season; still merits attention, and the yard did win this 12 months ago.

runners.name: Hard Market
runners.comment: Dam bumper and useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner; respected newcomer
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-sister to winners Red House Hill (bumper/11.3f Flat; RPR 73), All Clenched Up (bumper/2m hurdle) and Sand Fly (bumper/2m4f hurdle); dam bumper and useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner; respected newcomer for a yard that wins plenty of these races.

runners.name: Jack N Jones
runners.comment: Irish point winner two years ago; stable's bumper runners have gone well all season
runners.spotlight: It wasn't a strong Irish 3m point (good) that she won two years ago and she has been a good-while absent; however, her stable's bumper runners have been going well all season so she would be interesting if at all strong in the market.

stable_tour.quote: Has been given time to mature and strengthen since she won in March last year. She'll also start out in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 06-11-24
She was a cosy winner of her point-to-point and looks a more than useful prospect, especially when she goes over hurdles, but a bumper run will come first. 28-09-23

runners.name: What A Peach
runners.comment: £1,200 2yo; stable 0-25 in bumpers the last five seasons
runners.spotlight: £1,200 2yo; sixth foal; half-sister to 3m1f chase winner Party Fuzz; dam point/3m1f hurdle winner; stable 0-25 in bumpers the last five seasons.

runners.name: Ace Artist
runners.comment: Prolific family and it could be that soft ground didn't suit when well held at Newbury
runners.spotlight: From a prolific family and it could be that soft ground didn't suit when well held at Newbury, though she was very green; can probably do better.

runners.name: Arayapearl
runners.comment: Bred to be competitive in races of this nature and the market needs checking
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to winners Park This One (point/bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle) and Ayiko (bumper/3m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to useful winners Port Moresby (7f-1m2f), Santia (bumper and 2m/2m1f hurdle) and Lord Over (bumper); needs checking in the betting.

stable_tour.quote: She has never run before but works really well at home. We haven't had time to give her a run in between but her work is better than any of our youngsters. She's a really nice filly and will run in the Aintree bumper as well. She'd be my dark horse. 26-03-25

runners.name: Sukrain
runners.comment: Hooded for a 1m5f bumper at Fontwell and finished tailed off at 80-1
runners.spotlight: Hooded for a 1m5f bumper at Fontwell and finished tailed off at 80-1.

runners.name: Abitlikethat
runners.comment: Remote ninth on debut at Thurles last month, likely to need more experience
runners.spotlight: Remote ninth on debut at Thurles last month; likely to need more experience.

runners.name: Butcher Hollow
runners.owner: Ciaran John Mooney & John Francis Ryan
runners.comment: Third at Navan only 1/2l behind today's rival Smooth Scotch; good chance on overall form
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner; consistent in defeat in maiden hurdles last season, when placed on all four maiden hurdle starts; probably needed Punchestown run in February on seasonal and handicap debut; better when third in a seven-runner maiden at Navan last time, only 1/2l behind today's rival Smooth Scotch.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW (C & G) (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Butcher Hollow is only four and we'll sit down and talk with the lads and see what they want to do next. We won't rush into any plans but they wanted a horse to get them to Cheltenham - Tom Cooper, trainer

runners.name: Easy Doyen
runners.comment: Remote sixth in a bumper, down the field on hurdling debut, not a likely contender
runners.spotlight: Remote sixth in a bumper; down the field at Naas on hurdling debut; not a likely contender.

runners.name: Gerrymandering
runners.comment: Half-brother to two hurdle winners and two point winners; pulled up on sole point start
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two hurdle winners and two point winners; pulled up on sole point start in December.

runners.name: Good Deal
runners.comment: Front-running winner of a 2m bumper at this venue in January, struggled in a Grade 2 event
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in two bumpers early last year; returned after almost a year off to make all in a bumper at this venue in January; dropped away to finish in rear when attempting similar tactics in a Grade 2 contest at Leopardstown.

runners.name: Lauros Legend
runners.comment: Well beaten in two bumpers, never going well when pulled up at Clonmel on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two bumpers, never going well when pulled up at Clonmel in December on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Qaasid
runners.owner: Four Fools & A Fast Horse Syndicate
runners.comment: Five Flat wins in Britain, no encouragement from his two hurdle runs early this season
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner on the Flat in Britain, best on AW, though his most recent success was in a 1m2f Doncaster handicap off 84 for Julie Camacho last July; unseated early on his hurdles debut at Ballinrobe; absent since a remote sixth at Kilbeggan last September.

stable_tour.quote: He is a Shadwell-bred gelding and although he's only got his head in front twice he has run consistently well and is a hard horse to criticise as he tries every time. He's in the same bracket as Dingle in that he will be a good all-weather horse this winter - all of his wins have been on the all-weather. He'll be ready to resume again in December and hopefully give us a lot of fun. 06-09-23

runners.name: Slea Head
runners.comment: Second foal; brother to minor hurdles winner Max Time, makes a belated debut at seven
runners.spotlight: Second foal; brother to minor hurdles winner Max Time, makes a belated debut at seven.

runners.name: Smooth Gale
runners.comment: Had two runs on Flat almost two years apart, tailed off on recent hurdling debut at Navan
runners.spotlight: Had two runs on Flat almost two years apart; tailed off on recent hurdling debut at Navan; tongue-tie and cheekpieces added now.

runners.name: Smooth Scotch
runners.comment: Closely matched with Butcher Hollow on running at the same venue last time, cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Every chance when falling on handicap debut at Punchestown last May after a long layoff; solid maiden form this season, fifth behind Cheltenham winner Air Of Entitlement at Down Royal, third in a decent four-runner contest at Navan; closely matched  with Butcher Hollow on running at the same venue last time; cheekpieces now as well as usual tongue-tie.

runners.name: Speedy Box
runners.comment: 0-8 in points, outran his three-figure odds when fourth in a 2m1f maiden at Down Royal
runners.spotlight: Plenty of experience in point-to-points, though 0-8 in that sphere; outran his three-figure odds when fourth in a 2m1f maiden at Down Royal on rules debut.

runners.name: St Cuthberts Cave
runners.comment: Has made the frame in his last four starts, rated the equal of Smooth Scotch, good chance
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner for Rose Dobbin in 2023; four good efforts in maiden hurdles this season, including when beaten a neck on heavy ground at Clonmel in February; showed that he could handle better ground when third at Cork last time; unlikely to be far away.

stable_tour.quote: This guy won a Kelso bumper for Rose Dobbin. We liked that performance and he's a nice looking young horse. He'll be out in a maiden hurdle soon, probably starting off over two miles. 24-10-23

runners.name: The Burrow
runners.comment: Point winner in January, completely tailed off in a bumper at Gowran last month
runners.spotlight: Won at Ballycrystal in January on third point-to-point start; completely tailed off in a bumper at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Twelve Tribes
runners.comment: Pulled up on his single bumper appearance in 2022 and absent since, arduous task
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on his single bumper appearance in 2022 and absent since; arduous task against that background, tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Lets Do This Buddy
runners.comment: Dam showed little and has yet to enjoy any success at stud, unlikely to feature
runners.spotlight: Dam showed little and has yet to enjoy any success at stud; unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Mags Collins
runners.comment: Remote fifth in a bumper at this venue on debut, poor form in three subsequent outings
runners.spotlight: Remote fifth in a bumper at this venue on debut; poor form in three subsequent outings.

runners.name: Bearami Creek
runners.comment: First reserve, sister to two hurdle winners, no evidence of winning potential in points
runners.spotlight: Sister to two hurdle winners; no evidence of winning potential in points; first reserve.

runners.name: Welluknow
runners.comment: Second reserve, made a satisfactory introduction over this trip at Cork, likely to improve
runners.spotlight: Made a satisfactory introduction when sixth in a 19-runner maiden over this trip at Cork; likely to improve; second reserve.

2:35.race_name: Paddy Kehoe Suspended Ceilings Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)

runners.name: A Tipp For Gold

prev_owners.owner: Ms Margaret Mullins & F W Healy

runners.comment: Is held by several of these on form and looks a place prospect at best
runners.spotlight: Listowel maiden hurdle winner last autumn and some solid efforts in decent company since; however, is held by several of these  on that form and looks a place prospect at best.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: A Tipp For Gold is a grand horse and I like him. He had winter form and put in a lovely run last time. He's improving as I felt he wasn't fully there either, and think he will come on again - Mags Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Ballygunner Castle
runners.comment: Second in a 3m Grade 3 last time; needs more today but is Townend's pick so respected
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner last season took a maiden hurdle over 2m at this track on seasonal debut; solid in defeat on next two starts, including a Clonmel 3m Grade 3 last time; needs more today but this trip might be ideal and is Townend's pick from three runners so respected.

quotes.race: Kettles Country House Hotel Supporting Fingal Ravens GFC Raceday Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballygunner Castle had to overcome plenty from very early. He got a good bump at the start and I nearly fell off him at the first. I had to ride him on then and I made him do plenty throughout the race. There was no hiding places and it was messy up the straight but he still pulled out again. It's the sign of a good one. He will relax better, I had him lit up to take on his hurdles early today because of what happened at the first. He'll be fine, he's learning on the job - Paul Townend, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice sort who needed the summer to mature. I'm very happy with what he's doing at the moment and he should be a smart staying novice hurdler. 25-11-24

runners.name: Eastern Legend
runners.comment: Maiden winner last time; already placed in a Grade 1; drying ground will suit; a player
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner comfortably go off the mark over hurdles at Navan (2m) recently following some fine runs in defeat, including in a Grade 1; has form over a similar trip to this and drying ground will suit; a player.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: I think Eastern Legend can keep going during the summer and I think on a bit of nicer ground he can improve. He could end up being a Galway Hurdle type of horse if his jumping shaped up and Galway came up on the better side - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

quotes.race: Jet, Peggy & Eamonn O'Carroll Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Eastern Legend handles soft ground, stays really well, so he would be an exciting prospect to go juvenile hurdling with - Ger Flynn, travelling head groom

runners.name: Fleur In The Park
runners.comment: Not at his best behind two of these rivals last time; has to find a bit more to prevail
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner last season won a 2m Wexford maiden on seasonal debut; four solid efforts in defeat in graded company since up to 2m7, though not at his best behind two of these rivals last time; has to find a bit more to prevail.

runners.name: Joystick
runners.comment: Second in a 2m4f Grade 3 last time; seems stable second-string but still respected
runners.spotlight: Leopardstown bumper winner over this trip won a 2m maiden hurdle at Naas before pulled-up in a Grade 1; bounced back with a second in a 2m4f Grade 3 back at Naas last time; seems stable second-string but still respected.

stable_tour.quote: A nice bumper winner for Rich and Susannah Ricci last season, he goes novice hurdling this season. Whatever he does over hurdles will definitely be a bonus as he's a really nice staying chaser for the future. 25-11-24

runners.name: Mr Percy
runners.comment: Beaten 19l on handicap debut over this trip at Christmas time so has questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden winner scored over hurdles at Limerick last October before runner-up in a Navan Grade 3, both over 2m; beaten 19l on handicap debut over this trip at Christmas time so has questions to answer now; cheekpieces tried.

quotes.race: Racing Again September 21st Maiden
quotes.quote: Mr Percy got it easy on the front end and he's a lovely, relaxed horse so I didn't want to break his momentum as he stays well. He stretched out well to the line and is a nice horse - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Scalpnagoon
runners.comment: Improving sort has to make further progress to take this, which is possible
runners.spotlight: Improving sort won a Thurles maiden over this trip before taking a Naas novice over 2m2f; holds A Tipp For Gold on latter running but has to make further progress to take this, which is possible.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Scalpnagoon put up a good performance. I was worried about the ground but he showed a good attitude. He's a big strong horse and he will jump a fence in time. The final of this is probably the aim - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Scalpnagoon had a nice run the last day when he stayed going well and I was a bit worried about the ground today. He'll jump a fence in time - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Wingmen
runners.comment: Forgiven a below-par run in the Albert Bartlett at Cheltenham and is top-rated today
runners.spotlight: Point and dual bumper winner took a Navan maiden hurdle over this trip on seasonal bow before a string of fine runs in defeat, notably in two Grade 1s; can be forgiven a below-par run in the gruelling 3m Albert Bartlett at Cheltenham and is top-rated today so a big player if repeating his best.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a great run. I'm very happy with that and Wingmen will go to the Albert Bartlett now. Stepping up in trip will suit him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wingmen is a smart horse. His jumping got better when Jack let him on a bit. He could be better going the other way. He's a big chasing type for next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: JP & M Doyle (C & G) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Wingmen is a very good horse we think. He's a very quick horse but he will stay further - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's settling so much better these days and the Albert Bartlett is the plan. He kept on well for second behind Final Demand at Leopardstown. It will be interesting to see how he gets on. I think he'll stay.  19-2-25

runners.name: You Oughta Know
runners.comment: Won a maiden over 2m; jumping needs to improve but can be a player if staying this trip
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner last season when beat subsequent Grade 1 winner Croke Park but his form dipped latterly; reappeared with a comfortable Punchestown maiden win over 2m; jumping needs to improve but can be a player if staying this trip.

quotes.race: Racing Again June 4th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: You Oughta Know is not particularly a horse for this track, he probably wants a more galloping track. We went a real strong gallop and it was a messy race. Everyone who rode him at home liked him but he wasn't the sharpest workhorse so we didn't think he'd do what he did but a strong gallop really played into his hands - Patrick Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed towards the end of last season. We gave him a break, but he's back now and goes novice hurdling. 25-11-24

runners.name: World Of Fortunes
runners.comment: Should be competitive on these terms even though this trip is her minimum
runners.spotlight: Smart mare has won a bumper and four hurdle races up to 3m, including twice in Listed company; has been well held both starts in graded company but should be more competitive on these terms even though this trip is her minimum; cheekpieces retained.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was all down to Jordan Gainford as he told me how to ride World Of Fortunes and that she'd stay. He has her to look forward to in the better races in the spring - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: Cheesestrings Irish EBF Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: World Of Fortunes is a lovely mare with loads of ability and is a nice one going forward. She can sharpen up a bit more - Jordan Gainford, rider.

3:07.race_name: Fairyhouse Easter Festival, It's Tradition Novice Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Arctic Gale
runners.comment: Second in three maiden hurdles last summer, not at his best on last two runs before break
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; second in three maiden hurdles last summer at up to 2m7f; disappointing when racing too keenly over roughly this trip at Cork in October; failed to show his best form over 2m at Galway later that month; makes handicap debut after a winter break.

runners.name: Is Charlie Around
runners.comment: Promise in two maiden hurdle outings at Clonmel, opening handicap mark looks harsh
runners.spotlight: Has shown promise in two maiden hurdle outings at Clonmel in recent months; opening handicap mark looks harsh.

runners.name: Pen To Paper
runners.comment: Indicated ability on second of three starts, hard to assess, the market may provide clues
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite on debut at Naas last season; chased home easy winner Rath Gaul Boy over 2m at this venue on second outing; unfancied (20-1) when down the field at Navan in November; hard to assess; market may provide clues.

stable_tour.quote: He was very immature last year and is still a bit backward but he's coming on all the time. He'll start off in a maiden hurdle. He's a big horse and wants soft ground. 18-11-24

runners.name: Lygon Lad
runners.comment: Best run came on handicap debut at Navan in December over 2m, has failed to build on that
runners.spotlight: Best run came on handicap debut at Navan in December over 2m on yielding to soft; has failed to build on that in three subsequent starts; soundly beaten in fourth over this trip at Down Royal last month.

runners.name: Crescent Moon
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Promise at Cork in January, ran poorly at Gowran, more like it over 2m at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Promising run on handicap debut over 2m1f at Cork in January, staying on strongly under tender handling to finish second; ran no sort of race when favourite over this trip at Gowran; more like it when fourth over 2m at Leopardstown.

runners.name: Jeu De Pic
runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet, Marc Trinquet, Olivier Trinquet
runners.comment: Good efforts in a pair of maidens over this trip last July; twice less effective over 2m6f
runners.spotlight: Good efforts in a pair of maiden hurdles over this trip last July; not as effective over 2m6f at Downpatrick and Listowel; makes handicap debut on return from winter break.

runners.name: Sticwiththeprocess
runners.comment: Some ability in maidens, unknown quantity in handicaps, Mark Walsh partners Pen To Paper
runners.spotlight: Has shown some promise in maidens and could slot into handicaps effectively; Mark Walsh, who was aboard for his penultimate start, partners Pen To Paper.

runners.name: Aurea Fortuna
runners.comment: Two creditable runs in December, does not need to improve much to win a race in this grade
runners.spotlight: Ran four times over fences between May and October last year while his trainer was serving a suspension; shaped well in his first two handicap hurdle attempts; second in a 19-runner contest over 3m at Punchestown and third in a 23-runner event over  2m4f at Leopardstown; tongue-tie on now; does not need to improve much to win a race of this standard.

runners.name: Leahs Contessa
runners.comment: Course winner, pulled up over C&D on handicap debut in February, questions to answer now
runners.spotlight: Was having her fourth start when landing a maiden over slightly further here in January, surviving a mistake at the last to win a shade snugly; pulled up over C&D on handicap debut in February; questions to answer now.

runners.name: Pirate Island

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late M J Daly

runners.comment: Promising form in maidens last season;, plenty to prove now after three outings this term
runners.spotlight: Promising form in maidens last season; plenty to prove now after three outings this term.

runners.name: Hangry
runners.comment: Good run at 33-1 when fifth over C&D, failed to reproduce that form at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Modest sort on the Flat; good run at 33-1 when fifth over C&D in December on handicap debut; failed to reproduce that form at Limerick two weeks later.

runners.name: Backfromtheraces
runners.comment: Placed in her first two handicaps at Wexford and Naas, more recent form not as convincing
runners.spotlight: Fine efforts in defeat in her first two handicaps at Wexford and Naas; well below best on next two outings; more like it when fifth at Wexford, up in trip now.

runners.name: Divilabother
runners.comment: Placed twice in the first half of the season, stays this trip and suited by good ground
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in the first half of the season; disappointing at Limerick in October after a good run at Galway; stays this trip and suited by good ground.

runners.name: Gaucher
runners.owner: Mrs Rose Boyd & Mrs Marie J Armstrong
runners.comment: Sprang a 20-1 surprise in a Grade 2 event at Navan last time, up against it with a penalty
runners.spotlight: Two wins on the Flat in France; 3-9 over hurdles, including when favourite for a four-runner Grade 3 novice hurdle at Tipperary in October; only a moderate sixth in a Grade 2 at this venue in December; better when fourth in a 2m handicap at Leopardstown; sprang a 20-1 surprise in a Grade 2 event at Navan last time; up against it with a penalty.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Gaucher settled well off a strong gallop. He had a tough race at Listowel so it was good to see him tough it out well. The flat track helped - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "2Up&Win" Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaucher missed the start but he was very keen and pulled his way to the front. Once he got there he settled. He was out to his left at one or two but quickened away well from the back of the last - Kieran Callaghan, rider.

runners.name: Belloccio
runners.comment: Useful on Flat, plenty to prove as hurdler, Naas run behind Gaucher was too bad to be true
runners.spotlight: Listed winner on soft in France at two; three wins at Kempton in 2022; won Punchestown maiden hurdle last May and landed the 1m6f Copper Horse Handicap at Royal Ascot; jumping was untidy when unplaced in a Grade 2 here in December; last month's Naas run behind stablemate Gaucher was too bad to be true.

quotes.race: Copper Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: I was so disappointed with My Lyka [19th in the Ascot Stakes] and I was wondering, could Belloccio make up for it? Then I was disappointed when he didn't jump out as fast as I hoped, but William didn't panic. He waited until the race was starting in earnest and produced him with a perfect run. This fellow will probably go to the Ebor. He's entered here on Saturday, but we won't make any decisions about this weekend yet. We'll see how he comes out of this race, and I think the bigger picture may come into it. The long-term aim might be to qualify for the Melbourne Cup. We'll see how things go and I'll have another word with William - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tuesday Treat At Punchestown Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Belloccio brought a good level of form to the race, showed a good attitude for jumping and did it nicely. He will have no problem adjusting, he will be learning on the job a little bit. If they get him going he should be smart - Paul Townend, rider,

stable_tour.quote: He is very similar to Wonderful Tonight in that he wants 1m4f and soft ground. The day he gets his conditions he will put up a very different level of form to last time. As a two-year-old he won both starts, the latter a Listed race at Toulouse, but this year things have not been in his favour. His first run back was in the Sandown Classic Trial, where he lost a shoe and came back very sore for a while. I felt he ran a stormer next time out in the Dante despite the going as we had nowhere else to go. Now he is ready to go again but I am going to wait for the rain and do the right thing by the horse. I have a lot of time for him and he is possibly the best three-year-old I have ever trained, which I know sounds a big statement when you consider Wonderful Tonight, won two Group 1s last year, but I really believe he has that potential. When he gets everything in his favour he will raise a few eyebrows and we have him in at Royal Ascot as well as the Grand Prix de Paris [on July 14] and then we have to decide whether to go down the St Leger route as there are a lot of stayers in his family or shorter, when the Arc could be an option. The form of his Listed win last year has taken quite a boost as the runner-up, Cirona, subsequently won a Group 3 and was a head second in the Group 1 Prix Saint-Alary at Longchamp. Olivier Peslier rode him on that occasion and he regularly rings me up to inquire how the horse is doing, which pretty much says it all. Keep an eye out for him as I am sure he'll be worth the wait. 02-06-21

runners.name: Downmexicoway
runners.comment: Distant second behind Karniquet at Tramore, took advantage of good Down Royal opportunity
runners.spotlight: Point winner; made a bright start for the stable when narrowly losing out in a Galway maiden; distant second behind Karniquet at Tramore in November; took advantage of a good opportunity at Down Royal in December.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice young horse. He's a point-to-point winner who ran a lovely race at Galway on his first run for us last month, when he was maybe a little unlucky to be caught on the line. He was still a bit babyish that day. We'll aim for a maiden hurdle in the next couple of weeks when we get some softer ground. 18-11-24

runners.name: I Started A Joke
runners.comment: Down the field in the Cheltenham bumper, no hurdling experience, up against it
runners.spotlight: Narrow winner of a bumper at Limerick in December; unplaced when a surprise favourite for a Grade 2 bumper at Leopardstown, down the field in the Cheltenham bumper; no hurdling experience.

runners.name: Ill Sort That
runners.comment: Winners of two bumpers since a debut hurdles run, this looks highly ambitious
runners.spotlight: Winner of bumpers at this venue and Naas; has made considerable progress since running in a maiden hurdle at Cork on debut; however, this looks ambitious with so many experienced runners in opposition.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Prices (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Obviously I'll Sort That is not going to Cheltenham but could go to Fairyhouse for a winners of three and then out to grass. We'd be looking forward to him next year, he's a lovely horse to have - Declan Queally, jockey.

runners.name: Irancy
runners.comment: Failed to land a blow in the Supreme Novices', plenty to find with stablemate Karniquet
runners.spotlight: Won AQPS on soft ground in 2021; shaped well in a maiden at this venue on his only start last season; made all for an impressive win on good ground at Punchestown in November; failed to land a blow in the Supreme Novices'; plenty to find with stablemate Karniquet.

runners.name: Karniquet
runners.breeder: I Pacault, M Pacault & A Pacault
runners.comment: Set a high standard on his Grade 1 form behind stablemate Kopek Des Bordes
runners.spotlight: Ex-French; won well at Tramore on debut for Willie Mullins; subsequently beaten in Leopardstown Grade 1 contests won by Romeo Coolio and stablemate Kopek Des Bordes, running well on the latter occasion to take second place; fine effort when fourth in the Supreme Novices', in front of Friday's Grade 1-winning stablemate Salvator Mundi.

quotes.race: 2025 Annual Badge At Tramore Racecourse Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Karniquet only jumped a couple of hurdles but he had two runs over hurdles in France and is well able to jump. He's entitled to come on a bit from it as well and he has a nice way of going. He gave me a lovely feel - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a real nice type, a sharp individual. Hopefully he could be a name worth remembering. 25-11-24

runners.name: Runcok
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Cerdeval
runners.comment: Failed to win in three bumper starts, takes a big jump in class following maiden win
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in three bumper starts; takes a big jump in class following maiden win on heavy ground at Punchestown.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: He shows us plenty at home, but I suppose Runcok had been disappointing on the track. Maybe getting his head in front in a hurdle will help him now, he's a brilliant jumper. It was a good opportunity for him today. He loved jumping and an obstacle will definitely bring him on - Paul Townend, jockey

runners.name: Sea Of Sands
runners.comment: Remote fifth behind Kopek Des Bordes at Leopardstown, safely held by stablemate Karniquet
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins in Germany; made a winning debut over hurdles at Listowel last September; third in a Grade 2 here in December; found to be clinically abnormal after being pulled up at Leopardstown later that month; remote fifth behind Kopek Des Bordes at DRF, safely held by stablemate Karniquet.

runners.name: Whinney Hill
runners.comment: Jumped poorly when set an ambitious task in a Leopardstown Grade 1, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; made a satisfactory start over jumps when third to Kopek Des Bordes at Leopardstown; jumped poorly when set an ambitious task in Grade 1 at the same venue; hard to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: Finished second in a bumper this month at Punchestown. He should be capable of going one better soon with that experience under his belt. 28-10-24

runners.name: Beauforts Storm
runners.comment: Fair standard of hurdles form but unlikely to match the geldings, flopped on AW on latest
runners.spotlight: Fair standard of hurdles form (official rating of 124) but unlikely to match the geldings; has flopped on AW since third in a Grade 3 mares' event over 2m2f at this venue.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beauforts Storm is a nice mare and will come back here for a Listed novice before Christmas. She's a good-ground filly, is getting better with every run, and that will boost her confidence - Tim Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Swing Davis
runners.breeder: M Claude Quellier, M Alan Quellier & Mme Svetlana Timon-Quel
runners.comment: Made amends for previous failures with maiden win at Navan, little appeal on overall form
runners.spotlight: Point winner and subsequent 320,000euros purchase; made amends for previous failures with maiden win at Navan; makes little appeal in this grade on overall form.

quotes.race: Pick Your Places At BoyleSports Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was there a long way out but I was staying on and I still had a fair chance. Swing Davis was unlucky to fall the last day and I was staying on well that day as well. Two and a half isn't a problem and she jumps very well so she'll jump a fence in time -  Sam Ewing, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Smart young mare who couldn't have won much easier than she did at Loughanmore. That was her second point start for Denis Murphy. She was going as well as anything when she came down four out on her first point outing, too. Hopefully she's lovely. 28-10-24

4:12.race_name: Whistlin' Donkeys @ Fairyhouse Easter Saturday Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Redstone
runners.owner: Thomas Cox & Ralph Kelly & H Rogers
runners.comment: Taking a big step-up in trip for a new yard and best watched unless the market speaks
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced; won a 2m maiden hurdle at this track in 2023 but lost his form after, including in a chase; taking a big step-up in trip for a new yard and best watched unless the market speaks.

quotes.race: 2nd To The SP Favourite At Novibet (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've always liked Redstone and he's going to be a very nice horse in time ? he's big too. It was nice to do that today and you wouldn't have thought the inside track here would be the ideal place for him as he's a big horse. He's not slow and travelled well but you could certainly see him going up in trip. You probably won't see the best of him until he goes over fences - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse who goes well at home. He made a winning start at Fairyhouse last month when he beat an odds-on favourite. We'll step him up in grade now and he'll probably go to Navan for the For Auction Hurdle or the Monksfield, depending on the ground. 10-11-23

runners.name: Arion Soldier
runners.comment: Tailed-off over fences only run in last year; not dismissed but might need softer ground
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced; showed major improvement for the step-up to this trip when winning a Cork maiden hurdle on soft a year ago; tailed-off over fences only run since; not dismissed but might need softer ground.

quotes.race: Hibernian Hotel Mallow Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Arion Soldier had been working well. It was a big step up in trip but we thought that this would be his trip. After the last day we were hopeful. We won't rush him, he is worth minding - Eamon Courtney, trainer.

runners.name: Slanagaibhgoleir
runners.comment: Good run over 2m4f at Gowran last time; this trip suits better and he can go well
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m7f Punchestown maiden hurdle last year and some solid efforts in defeat in handicaps since, including over 2m4f at Gowran last time; this trip suits better and he can go well.

quotes.race: Download The Bet Victor App Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Slanagaibhgoleir has been disappointing but I would say the step up to 3m suited. He picked up well from the mistake at the last and you would have to be pleased - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He had a nice run in a maiden hurdle at Punchestown last season and should progress this year. 24-10-23

runners.name: Topgun Simmy
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan

prev_owners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan

runners.comment: Largely consistent; up 2lb from last time and back with his former trainer; considered
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner over almost 3m at Punchestown last summer and mostly solid runs since in defeat including over fences; up 2lb from last time and back with his former trainer; considered.

quotes.race: John Dowling Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Topgun Simmy is a lovely horse but I was just a bit worried about the jump up in trip. Paddy gave him a great ride as he didn't panic and gave him a chance. We'll plan something for Galway - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This chap is a very nice horse. He ran a cracker at Galway in a hot bumper and had bumped into Brighterdaysahead before that at Fairyhouse. That form isn't working out too bad. He might run in a bumper at Leopardstown over Christmas. 27-11-23

runners.name: Notkeepinyagoing
runners.comment: Best run in last year when 5l runner-up over C&D in November; a shout if back to her best
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner won a 2m4f Leopardstown maiden hurdle last year in testing ground; best run since when 5l runner-up over C&D in November; up 1lb but has a shout if back to her best.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Driving Range Mares' Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Notkeepinyagoing deserved that. She's been consistent. It wasn't the greatest of maiden hurdles, we can pick and choose our races and hope the handicapper doesn't take this literally - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were going to run her in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham last weekend but just didn't feel she was 100 per cent, though she had previously been working really well. She should be able to get black type in a bumper and we'll go hurdling then. I think she'll go on any ground. 21-11-22

As things have grown in recent seasons, we've been very lucky in that our owners have been stocking up with some lovely young horses, like Notkeepinyagoing. She was sent to us after winning her point-to-point at Oldcastle 12 months ago. She's had one run for us, when landing a Galway mares' bumper by 13 lengths from Presenting J, who won next time out. Notkeepinyagoing hasn't run since due to a small issue which cost us some time but she's working well again and the plan is to go for the mares' bumper at Aintree or, failing that, Punchestown. That'll be her final bumper as I intend to go hurdling with her this summer, when I hope she can prove my opinion of her correct and get some black type. She handles good ground best, so we'll try and make hay in the summer and give her a break when the ground goes soft in the winter months. 06-04-23

runners.name: Now Where Or When
runners.comment: Pulled-up at Cheltenham; hasn't run over hurdles since 2021 and probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Better known as a chaser; won over 3m at Down Royal in January but was pulled-up in the Fulke Walwyn/Kim Muir Chase at Cheltenham; hasn't run over hurdles since 2021 and probably best watched.

quotes.race: Start Your Free Trial Now At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Now Where Or When was also in the 3m handicap tomorrow but we came here in case there was a deluge. This was plenty sharp enough for him. He was gaining lengths at every fence - Stuart Crawford, trainer

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Local Business Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Now Where Or When had a good run at Down Royal and his jumping sharpened up plenty. It was nice to see him winning over 2m. The cheekpieces helped him too - J.J. Slevin, rider.

runners.name: Crossing The Bar
runners.comment: Won over an extended 3m in January and a solid run over 2m6f since; can be involved
runners.spotlight: Won his fourth hurdle race when scoring at Catterick over an extended 3m in January and a solid run over 2m6f at Thurles since; this trip suits better and can be involved.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the Newmarket sales and he won at Carlisle on the Flat and is rated 83. He's quite unusual for a Flat horse as he's very big and needs soft ground. He'll be one more for the winter months. 25-10-21

runners.name: Doctor Churchill
runners.comment: Won at Naas (2m3f) in January but made mistakes when not so good there over 2m last time
runners.spotlight: Won for the second time over hurdles when scoring at Naas (2m3f) in January but made mistakes when not so good there over 2m last time; this trip is a query.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't run his race at Listowel but we found the problem when we got him home. You can put a line through that run and he'll pay his way through the winter. 18-10-22

runners.name: Born Bright
runners.comment: Up 7lb for Thurles win; this trip is at limit of her stamina but likely to run well
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden over 2m4f at this track and scored in handicap company over 2m6f at Thurles last time, appreciating the sound surface; up 7lb for that and this trip is probably at limit of her stamina but likely to run well.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's fantastic and I'm delighted with Born Bright. She won a point-to-point and my son got to ride her in a few bumpers but she wants good ground and it went soft in Sligo and Listowel. This was a race that really suited and it was local. She'll run away over hurdles now - Claire O'Connell, trainer.

runners.name: West Is Awake
runners.comment: Has taken time to drop down the handicap and isn't easy to fancy at present
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner including over C&D off 102 in 2023; has taken time to drop back down the handicap and has had a few runs over fences too; not easy to fancy at present.

runners.name: Young Lucy
runners.comment: Consistent in defeat on her last three starts; looks as if this trip could and  considered
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner is yet to score over hurdles but has been consistent in defeat on her last three starts over approx 2m4f; looks as if this trip could suit and is considered.

runners.name: John Storey
runners.comment: Got off the mark over C&D but was well below that level since off this mark
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over hurdles over C&D in January but was well below that level at Leopardstown since off this mark and questions now.

quotes.race: Happy Retirement To Noel Fanning Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Storey got a very good ride. They went very quick early on and Danny just took his time. He ran a nice race at Punchestown last time. He's all stamina and he's tough. Hopefully he can jump a fence somewhere down the line - Liam Cusack, trainer.

runners.name: The Miracle Man
runners.owner: A Trappe & Declan Trappe & Garry Trappe & James J Gallagher
runners.comment: Just denied over this trip at Leopardstown last time and should go well off 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m4f at Sligo last October and mixing hurdles with fences since; just denied over this trip at Leopardstown last time and should go well off 2lb higher.

runners.name: Brave Adam
runners.comment: Ran a solid race on handicap hurdle debut at Punchestown over this trip; considered
runners.spotlight: Won a Killarney beginners' chase last October but not as good over fences since; however, did run a solid race on handicap hurdle debut at Punchestown in December over this trip; considered.

4:47.race_name: BoyleSports Supporting Irish Racing Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Blue Reed
runners.comment: Went close last twice over 2m4f including at this track; faster ground to contend with now
runners.spotlight: Yet to score over hurdles but has gone close from the front the last twice over 2m4f including at this track; faster ground to contend with today but a chance if handling it.

runners.name: Oakley
runners.breeder: Dr A Bolte U Dr H H Leimbach
runners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & Oliver Crampton & Djcc Investments Limited

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & O Crampton & D A Cloudsdale & J Crampton
Mrs P Crampton & O Crampton & D A Cloudsdale & J Crampton

runners.comment: Fine run at Leopardstown last time; raised 1lb for that and top rider stays aboard; chance
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner is yet to score over hurdles but a fine run at Leopardstown last time; raised 1lb for that and top rider stays aboard; chance.

runners.name: Woodford Warrior
runners.comment: Likely to do much better now tackling handicaps; check for market confidence
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in four maiden hurdles but is likely to do much better now tackling handicaps; check for market confidence.

runners.name: Wheres Nanny
runners.comment: Poor on completed hurdle starts; could do better in this grade but still questions
runners.spotlight: Debut bumper winner in 2023 but has been poor on completed hurdle starts and fell at Wexford last time; could do better in this grade but still questions to answer.

runners.name: Cleopatras Needle
runners.comment: Won over C&D last October but was poor at Navan since off this mark; has to return to best
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D last October but was poor at Navan since off this mark; will have to get back to best on return.

quotes.race: Frank Lynch & Co Chartered Certified Accountants Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was Cleopatra's Needle's first run in a handicap and Sean was very good on her. He put her to sleep and was the last one to get into it. She's not a bad filly and she likes jumping. She showed a bit early on on the Flat and she was unlucky not to win three in a row. Then things just went wrong with her, she's a hard mare to keep right - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Your Navan Summer BBQ Packages Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Cleopatra's Needle worked very well last week but she always did work well and is a well-bred mare. She loves top of the ground and she's going jumping as she has schooled over hurdles. Robbie Power had her for a while, schooling her, and said she had plenty of scope - Harry Rogers, trainer.

runners.name: My Policy
runners.comment: Yet to win over hurdles and pulled-up on return so others preferred
runners.spotlight: Yet to win over hurdles in nine starts including when pulled-up on return from a break so others preferred.

runners.name: Malbas
runners.comment: Flat winner is 0-22 over hurdles and was well beaten when last seen so others preferred
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-22 over hurdles and was twice well beaten when last seen so others preferred.

quotes.race: BetVictor Handicap
quotes.quote: Malbas was on box rest for a few weeks and he looks like he's back. He had a lovely run at Leopardstown and he showed there that he was well handicapped. If he comes out of this okay, he might run over the weekend - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Pepperpots
runners.comment: Shock bumper winner last summer; well beaten both handicap starts so loads nore needed
runners.spotlight: Shock bumper winner at Downpatrick last summer; well beaten both handicap hurdle starts so loads nore needed.

quotes.race: Dennison Rentals Point-To-Point INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Pepperpots works real well at home. We ran her in a few point-to-points and she just wasn't getting the three miles. We ran her in Tipperary in a mares' point-to-point bumper and she finished seventh. I'd say she needed the run from a point-to-point field to a bumper - Barry John Walsh, trainer/jockey.

runners.name: Bhean Saibhre
runners.comment: Just denied on handicap bow last time and a player if handling this faster ground up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden was only beaten 9l on juvenile hurdling debut over C&D last November; just denied on handicap bow last time at Clonmel (hvy) and a big player if handling this faster ground up 3lb.

runners.name: Mooretown Lad
runners.comment: Rated 70 on Flat; not much in three maiden hurdles but surely do better in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Rated 70 on Flat; not much to shout about in three maiden hurdles but will surely do better in handicaps.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mooretown Lad is a work in progress. He is a brother to I Am Superman but he is a slow learner and more like his half-brother Fastnet Crown. He has taken time and he will be a better horse next year - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Quinn The Eskimo
runners.comment: Little to show in three maiden hurdles but will surely do better in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Little to show in three maiden hurdles but will surely do better in handicaps.

runners.name: King Of The Bronx
runners.owner: Lucky Seven Syndicate/Seven Plus One Syndicate
runners.comment: Flat winner over 1m; beaten 18l on handicap hurdle debut last time but can do better
runners.spotlight: Flat winner over 1m; beaten 18l on handicap hurdle debut last time but can do better, so one to consider.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: I was hoping King Of The Bronx would be one for handicaps. The race fell apart in front of him to be fair to him. We were off the bridle going up the hill on the far side but he just stayed on past a few and he got a bit of confidence from that - Nigel Slevin, trainer

runners.name: Midnight Eugene
runners.comment: Well beaten in three completed maiden hurdles but can do better in this company
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three completed maiden hurdles but can do better in this company.

runners.name: Esticky End
runners.comment: Triple Flat winner but hurdles form is mostly poor so not easy to fancy
runners.spotlight: Triple Flat winner but hurdles form is mostly poor and lost his action at Clonmel 10 days ago; not easy to fancy.

5:22.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Total Enjoyment Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)

runners.name: Churchfield Sunset
runners.comment: Two wins, finished behind four of these in Leopardstown Grade 2, tough task with penalty
runners.spotlight: Debut winner on good ground at Cork last May; beaten 6l in a winners' event at Roscommon in June; made all in a seven-runner Listed mares' bumper at Navan in November; faded in the final quarter-mile when trying similar tactics in Grade 2 Leopardstown event won by Bambino Fever; four of these rivals in front of her then, tough task with penalty.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-y-o Fillies INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Churchfield Sunset has a great attitude and stays well. She is smart and one to look forward to. She has been very straightforward. We will probably look for a winners' bumper - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won on debut at Cork and was impressive in a Listed bumper at Navan earlier this month. It was a decent race and she showed a great attitude. All being well, we'll probably head for the Grade 2 bumper at the Dublin Racing Festival. 25-11-24

runners.name: Amen Kate
runners.comment: Failed to confirm Listowel form with Carrigmoornaspruce at DRF, held by Switch From Diesel
runners.spotlight: Beat Carrigmoornaspruce by 7 1/2l on debut at Listowel last September, that rival reversed the form in the Grade 2 DRF bumper won by Bambino Fever; also needs to turn the tables on runner-up Switch From Diesel.

runners.name: Cameletta Vega
runners.comment: Limitations exposed since Galway win, finished behind five of these rivals at DRF
runners.spotlight: Daughter of the top-class Quevega; won on debut at Galway; limitations exposed in Listed bumpers at Gowran and Navan  (fourth behind Churchfield Sunset); made little impact in DRF event won by Bambino Fever, behind five of these rivals then.

runners.name: Carrigmoornaspruce
runners.comment: Two wins after debut second behind Amen Kate, one place behind Switch From Diesel at DRF
runners.spotlight: Beaten 7 1/2l by Amen Kate on debut at Listowel in September; made amends at Naas the following month and backed that up at Leopardstown in December; confirmed a high standard of form when third at the DRF; hooded now, and has a fighting chance of turning the tables on the more exposed Switch From Diesel.

quotes.race: Plusvital Flat Race
quotes.quote: Carrigmoornaspruce was unreal. It was kind of the same as Naas. We just said to the boys that we would let her gallop around at the back and come home as well as we can. We're planning on coming here for the mares' bumper at the Dublin Racing Festival. It worked out and she's a very talented filly - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.name: Future Prospect
runners.breeder: Margaret Treacy On His Own Stables
runners.comment: Behind three of these rivals at Leopardstown hooded now, unwise to rule out
runners.spotlight: Won a Castlelands point-to-point for Denis Murphy; subsequently bought for 150,000GBP; made all at Fairyhouse on bumper debut; well held in fifth behind stablemate Bambino Fever and three of these rivals when ridden by Patrick Mullins in the Grade 2 event at DRF; hooded now, unwise to rule out.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice filly, strong, and she's progressing nicely. We'll look for a bumper for her soon. 25-11-24

runners.name: Jolie Folie
runners.comment: Fifth behind Bambino Fever at Punchestown, faces a stiff task against previous winners
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on her debut at Navan and again when around 20l fifth behind Bambino Fever at Punchestown.

runners.name: Moon Eclipse
runners.comment: Overcame inexperience when scoring first time out at Leopardstown, promising mare
runners.spotlight: Overcame inexperience when scoring first time out at Leopardstown; promising mare takes a big jump in class; could hold her own against more experienced rivals.
