runners.name: Oh Janey
runners.comment: Improved for Ayr run when third at Down Royal, takes a major rise in class now
runners.spotlight: Well-related mare; unplaced in a point-to-point; dropped away tamely in a bumper at Ayr; much better when third at Down Royal last month; takes a major rise in class now.

runners.name: Royal Hillsborough
runners.comment: Made a winning debut in a four-runner contest at Ayr,  a lot more on her plate now
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut in a four-runner contest at Ayr, a race in which the short-priced favourite flopped; a lot more on her plate now

runners.name: Switch From Diesel
runners.comment: Very experienced mare, Naas winner since fine effort behind Bambino Fever at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Is 2-10 in bumpers; placed six times, including twice second to a Willie Mullins-trained rival in the Grade 2 mares' event at the DRF; Tipperary winner for Seamus Fahey last season; had a reverse at Limerick on first start for this stable; back to peak form when chasing home Bambino Fever at the DRF (five of these rivals behind); won readily at Naas four weeks ago.

runners.name: Torpille Dagrostis
runners.comment: Second in a point at Loughanmore last October, thrown in at the deep end by Gordon Elliott
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; sister to bumper/hurdle/chase winner Itchy Feet, half-sister to two French chase winners; second in a point at Loughanmore for Ger Quinn last October; thrown in at the deep end by Gordon Elliott.

5:07.race_name: Annual Membership Available Today Fillies Maiden
5:07.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Bella Isabella
runners.comment: Improved effort when no match for a Group-class filly at Dundalk in February
runners.spotlight: Smart pedigree; no match for a Group-class filly at Dundalk in February (1m) but that was a nice step forward and there's surely more to come from her.

runners.name: Curroy Lady
runners.comment: Insufficient promise in her first two races to believe she'll be that competitive here
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise in her first two races to believe she'll be that competitive here; has only raced in the mud.

runners.name: Love Sonnet
runners.comment: Beaten about 8l in two 1m maidens on the AW and unlikely to be winning this
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 8l in two 1m maidens on the AW and unlikely to be winning this.

runners.name: Lovely
runners.comment: Although down the field upped to 7f at the Curragh that was in a good maiden
runners.spotlight: Always outpaced on 5f debut and although down the field upped to 7f at the Curragh that was in a good maiden; perhaps one for handicaps.

runners.name: Midnight Horizon
runners.comment: Lost lengths at the start when only 14th in a 7f maiden at Naas last August; new trainer
runners.spotlight: Lost lengths at the start when only 14th in a 7f maiden at Naas last August; new trainer.

runners.name: Mittens
runners.comment: An Irish 1,000 Guineas entry bodes well and would be interesting if strong in the betting
runners.spotlight: Sister to Scandinavian 7f/1m winner Empress Bling and half-sister to 1m4f AW winner Torre Del Oro (RPR 90); dam Listed-placed 1m4f winner (94); an Irish 1,000 Guineas entry bodes well and would be interesting if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Ms Olivia
runners.breeder: Mr J B A Al Attiyah
runners.owner: Riverstown Racing Syndicate/N Ohare/E Hughes/K Cromwell
runners.comment: Only fifth at Dundalk but that was over 5f and she went off one of the favourites
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree; only fifth of the seven runners at Dundalk but that was over 5f and she did go off one of the favourites; could be capable of a lot better.

runners.name: Naoi
runners.comment: First foal; dam once-raced sister to useful 1m winner La Figlia; much respected yard
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam once-raced sister to useful 1m winner La Figlia and closely related to 1m2f winner An Cailin Orga; the betting is usually a good guide with newcomers from this yard.

runners.name: Not Simple
runners.comment: Dam unplaced 6f/8.5f US turf, out of a maiden half-sister to smart winners
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unplaced 6f/8.5f US turf, out of a maiden half-sister to smart winners King Charlemagne (6.5f Group 1) and Meshaheer (6f 2yo Group3); likely best watched.

runners.name: Ribean
runners.comment: Blinkers soon added after finishing last over Dundalk's 7f in February (16-1)
runners.spotlight: Always in rear and finished last over Dundalk's 7f in February (16-1); the tongue-tie tried there is now joined by blinkers; reservations for now.

runners.name: Sapphire Princess
runners.comment: Dam was Listed class and this filly is a sister to a useful 7f/1m winner
runners.spotlight: Second foal; sister to 7f/1m winner Red Pixie (RPR 88); dam 8.6f-1m2f winner (Listed; 110), sister to 7f-1m2f winner Jewel House and half-sister to useful 7f/1m winner Ransom out of close relative of 5f/6f Listed winner Kind (dam of Frankel); lots to like on paper.

runners.name: Shahada Ace
runners.comment: £7,500 yearling; first foal; dam placed 6f/7f (RPR 68); wouldn't be the obvious answer
runners.spotlight: £7,500 yearling; first foal; dam placed 6f/7f (RPR 68), half-sister to winners Mr Excellency (7f-1m2f), Mount Ruapehu (5f/6f) and Sappho (US 1m); would need to see some confidence behind her.

runners.name: Spanish Temptress
runners.comment: Friendless 125-1 chance when a remote last of the 16 runners at Dundalk in November (1m)
runners.spotlight: Friendless 125-1 chance when a remote last of the 16 runners at Dundalk in November (1m).

runners.name: Temperance
runners.comment: Has performed to a useful level and latest second at Dundalk was no backward step
runners.spotlight: Beaten five times but has performed to a useful level and latest second at Dundalk (6f) was no backward step (winner looks okay); solid chance on the figures.

runners.name: Touted Plan
runners.comment: Showed a bit over 1m here in September but failed to improve on that at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit over 1m here in September but failed to improve on that at Dundalk; opposable in a race of this nature.

4:32.race_name: Dine In Our Panoramic Restaurant Handicap
4:32.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Green Icon
runners.comment: 2-4 for Owen Burrows and sold on for 62,000gns; now gelded and retains potential
runners.spotlight: Had just four races for Owen Burrows and won a maiden and handicap over 7f; final run for that yard too bad to be true and was sold on for 62,000gns; now gelded and retains plenty of potential.

runners.name: Shiota
runners.comment: Best form yet was her closing fourth in a 7f good-ground handicap at the Curragh in Sept
runners.spotlight: 6f winner at Naas; best form yet was her closing fourth in a 7f good-ground handicap at the Curragh in September and looks open to further progress.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Shiota is more of a three-year-old. She is growing like mad and I think seven is ideal for her. We ran her here to familiarise herself with Naas before the Ballyhane Stakes next month - Joe Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Just Before
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Well held over 1m2f this year but she did win her maiden at this trip
runners.spotlight: 7f maiden winner on soft ground last October but was last of four on her AW return and well beaten on last week's handicap debut at Leopardstown (1m2f); this could be more her trip.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: I was shocked when the handicapper gave Just Before a mark of 74 and disappointed. I thought she was better than that and she obviously is - Willie Browne, trainer

runners.name: Iceford
runners.comment: Promising maiden runs and the extra furlong looks sure to suit on this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Not too far away in three sprint maidens and was doing his best work late in the final one at the Curragh three weeks ago; the extra furlong looks sure to suit on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Nyman
runners.comment: Only 4lb higher than for his handicap win at Dundalk; can improve again as a 3yo
runners.spotlight: Only 4lb higher than for his handicap win at Dundalk (7f; first-time tongue-tie) and got too far behind in a median auction race back there; now gelded and could well improve again as a 3yo.

runners.name: Grand Dante
runners.comment: Shown ability and gelded ahead of this handicap debut; could be interesting
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a barrier trial and in 6f/7f maidens; gelded ahead of this handicap debut and goes in a tongue-tie; market should be instructive.

runners.name: Saint Brandon
runners.comment: 7f maiden winner; too free over 1m when strong in the market for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Built on early promise when winning a 7f maiden on good ground at Down Royal; sent off 11-8 favourite for handicap at Dundalk (1m) but didn't see it out after racing freely; drop back to 7f could work.

runners.name: Rion Rubette
runners.comment: Potentially well handicapped if able to tap back into her initial promise
runners.spotlight: Her second at Naas behind one now rated in triple-digits reads well but she didn't progress from there in three subsequent runs; potentially well handicapped if able to tap back into that initial promise.

runners.name: School Of Athens
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv
runners.comment: Modest thus far but in good hands and should be more competitive in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Best maiden run was her first when beaten just over 5l at Tipperary (about 7f); in good hands and should be more competitive in handicaps.

runners.name: Unique Journey
runners.owner: N W T Dalzell/James Morgan/Karl Kirwan/Mrs John Murphy
runners.comment: Second and third in his two handicaps and returning to 7f will do him no harm
runners.spotlight: Too keen and a weakener over 5f in a Naas handicap two weeks ago but he stayed the 7f well when second in a Galway handicap last October; has form on this drier ground and hard to rule out.

runners.name: Scott Key
runners.comment: Final maiden run more encouraging; open to improvement as a 3yo having been gelded
runners.spotlight: No closer than eighth in 6f/7f maidens, though did show more the final time at the Curragh; open to improvement as a 3yo having been gelded.

runners.name: Bluebelardo
runners.comment: Close up in a maiden and could have a future off this low a mark in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Close up in a 6f Naas maiden (just behind Rion Rubette) before finishing down the field in a sales race; could have a future off this low a mark in handicaps.

runners.name: Widely Acclaimed
runners.comment: Penultimate run wasn't devoid of promise and handicaps are now the way forward
runners.spotlight: Beaten 20l at the Curragh last week but his previous AW run wasn't devoid of promise and handicaps are now the way forward.

runners.name: Vegas Muse
runners.comment: Like many in here, handicaps should see her in a better light
runners.spotlight: Restless in the stalls before finishing midfield in a 7f maiden at the Curragh 21 days ago; like many in here, handicaps should show her in a better light.

runners.name: Hugos Girl
runners.comment: Hasn't run too badly on the AW this year but others are more intriguing
runners.spotlight: More exposed than some in here after seven defeats; hasn't run too badly on the AW this year but others are more intriguing.

runners.name: Navajo Point
runners.comment: Down the field in his qualifying races but handicapped accordingly and it's early days
runners.spotlight: Well down the field in his qualifying races but handicapped accordingly and it's early days; worth a market check with Chris Hayes booked.

3:25.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cork Stakes (Listed Race)
3:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Chicago Critic
runners.comment: Progressive last year, third in Jersey Stakes at Ascot, 6f a query on seasonal return
runners.spotlight: 2-8 on turf and rated 107; progressive at 7f-1m last season after gelding operation; won a 1m Naas handicap off 90 on good; was beaten just 1l into third in the Group 3 Jersey Stakes at Ascot in June (7f, good to firm); fourth on soft in a 7.5f Listed race on his final start of 2024; drop to 6f a worry on seasonal return.

quotes.race: Jersey Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We're absolutely delighted - that was fantastic. We came over because we thought we had a nice horse on our hands, but when you look at the strength of the race, it was a very, very good race and Chicago Critic ran his heart out. Ben gave him a great ride. We got excited up there for a couple of seconds - we thought he was coming, but he just couldn't get there. No fault of the horse, he ran brilliantly. Today was the plan, and now we know we have a horse of this level, we will think about what's next. He'll stay at seven or a mile - I think he'll get a mile no problem - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Trials At Naas Handicap
quotes.quote: Chicago Critic has been gelded since his last run so maybe that and the good ground both helped. I'm delighted with that and he could be a horse to go to Ascot for the Britannia Handicap - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Ben (Coen, jockey) said Chicago Critic is very professional, very genuine and should get a mile and a quarter next year - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: King Cuan
runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: 3-4 on turf, rated 99, won two big pots at Naas in 2023, missed 2024, gelded, check market
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 3-4 on turf in 2023 and rated 99; won the valuable Goffs Sportsman Challenge (6f) and Irish EBF Auction Series Race Final (7f) at Naas; missed the entire 2024 season and has been gelded; entitled to need this but yard can ready one, preferred by Lee and he is worth a market check on his return.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race Final (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I knew I was probably on the best horse in the race. King Cuan cruised there and picked up to win well. He was just getting a bit lonely in front and on that ground you are never going to be ultra impressive. He gets seven well which opens up options for next year. He's a game little horse - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Goffs Sportsman's Challenge
quotes.quote: King Cuan is a grand horse. Things did not go smoothly but he was able to overcome it with his ability. I was keen that he ran at Cork last week before coming here. That might be it for this year, he has a lot of talent - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: King Cuan was given plenty of time to mature and fill his frame after the Curragh and he confirmed here what he showed there. He is a quick horse - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Ostraka
runners.comment: 3-12 on turf, shock 5f Gr 3 winner at Dundalk, has run well here before, can't discount
runners.spotlight: 3-12 on turf and rated 100; pulled off a shock 66-1 win in a 5f Dundalk Group 3 in October; no impact in a Listed heat at Southwell on latest in February; ran well over 5f in a handicap here last June; good ground suits and she can't be discounted.

quotes.race: Rathkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: Ostraka is a grand filly and I was confident coming here. We might aim her at the Joe McGrath Handicap in the autumn - Danny Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Extra Place Races At Novibet Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Ostraka is a very laid back filly and had been working well at home but ours generally take a run, but the better ones don't so she's probably in that bracket - Michael Halford, joint-trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Easy
runners.owner: Team Valor International Llc & Gary Barber
runners.comment: 2-4 on turf, rated 102, won this last year on heavy, ground a concern on return
runners.spotlight: 2-4 on turf and rated 102; won this race on reappearance last year but that was on heavy ground; was subsequently twice a non-runner on account of good ground so conditions have to be a concern on her return from 290 days off.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cork Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Easy is a Group 1 horse if I ever had one. I knew she would improve for this an awful lot. Hopefully we are heading for a Group 1 at Royal Ascot - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: Firebird
runners.comment: 2-5 on turf, rated 99, C&D maiden winner, touched off in a Gr 3 at Naas, check the market
runners.spotlight: 2-5 on turf and rated 99; won a C&D maiden on her seasonal reappearance last year; followed up at Naas and then produced a career best when touched off in a Group 3 there in August; beaten 2l in a 6f Curragh Listed when last seen in October; the market should reveal expectations.

quotes.race: Taste Of Kildare At Naas Racecourse 20th - 22nd September Race
quotes.quote: Firebird is a nice filly, she's only cantered in between runs and she seemed in good form. I'm very happy with her. Billy [Lee] said she'll get further but we might stick at six for the moment. She's entered in the Ballyogan back here later in the month - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Gutsy Girl
runners.comment: AW winner, 1-6 on turf and rated 89, came up short in Listed company, watch on stable bow
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 1-6 on turf and rated 89; showed some decent form in handicaps for Charlie Fellowes last year but came up short in Listed company at Ayr; probably best watched on first start for Joseph O'Brien.

runners.name: Vespertilio
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Top rated at 108, Gr 2 winner at 7f, placed in French 1,000 Guineas, 6f trip a query
runners.spotlight: 1-8 on turf and rated 108; sole win came in a 7f Curragh Group 2 in August 2023 and finished a 1.25l second in the Moyglare subsequently; best run last year a 0.5l third on her seasonal return in the French 1,000 Guineas (1m, soft); down in class here but she hasn't run over this distance since her debut; obvious chance on paper but the trip raises questions.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Pouliches (Group 1) (3yo Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Willie McCreery has done a fantastic job to bring Vespertilio here in great condition. We had a doubt whether she would see out the mile but she's put that to bed and we'll see how she is. She's in the Irish 1,000 Guineas and the Coronation and I know the owner would love to go to Royal Ascot - Kieran Lalor, racing manager for owners Al Shira'aa.

quotes.race: Alpha Centauri Debutante Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: That was lovely. Vespertilio ran a lovely race the last day. She gets a free entry now for the Moyglare and we'll stick her in that now. We'll stay local, she actually qualified for a race in France today because she was bought in Arqana but I really wanted to come here instead of travelling at this time of year. She's lovely, gorgeous, and she has tactical speed as well - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: One Smack Mac
runners.comment: Rated 98, placed in listed at 6f last year, ground not ideal latest, yard in form, chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 98; sole win from four starts on debut in a 6f Naas maiden (good); touched off in a Fairyhouse Listed (good) over the same trip after a break last September; ground and 1m not ideal on his seasonal reappearance at Naas two weeks ago; should come on for that and this ground and trip more his bag; go well for in-form yard.

runners.name: Lady With The Lamp
runners.owner: K Blake/Mrs E Palmer/M Wilson/N Luck
runners.comment: 66-1 Listed win over 5f at Dundalk last year, turf form not as good, lacks a run, watch
runners.spotlight: 1-3 on turf and rated 98; won a 5f Listed on the AW at Dundalk in October when a 66-1 shot; held by Ostraka on their meeting in a 5f Group 3 back there later that month; has to prove she is as effective on turf and lacks a recent run; best watched.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Rest' Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There was a strong headwind here so I was keen to follow something early on, Lady With The Lamp has got a great cruising speed and knuckled down well when it came to it. For me, I'd be dropping her back to 5f, it was six the last day and she paddle a bit late on, it was the same today in the last half-furlong - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

3:57.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Noblesse Stakes (Listed Race)
3:57.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Sea The Boss

prev_owners.owner: John G Hennessy & C Acheson & Mrs John Harrington

runners.comment: 101 rated filly, Gr 3 winner on reappearance last season but Foley prefers stablemate
runners.spotlight: 101 rated filly won a 10.5f Naas Group 3 (good) first time up last year; not disgraced in a 1m2f Longchamp Group 2 subsequently but was then tailed off in the Group 1 Prix Vermeille on her final start of the season; her record fresh is a plus and she'll enjoy the ground but Shane Foley prefers Comic Book.

quotes.race: Al Shira'aa Racing Irish EBF Jannah Rose Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Sea The Boss was good last year and I ran her back too quick after Champions Weekend on soft ground. She doesn't go on soft ground. It was a big ask for her today as she hasn't run for seven months and there were three in there who had run. I thought her fitness might catch her out, but she was good and stayed well. She got the trip very well and she has that turn of foot. This was just her fourth run, so she should come forward a good bit from that. I don't think we'll drop back to a mile for the Guineas; she'll move up to a mile and a half at some stage - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden
quotes.quote: We've always liked Sea The Boss. We liked her a lot in the spring and she grew a lot. She is only really a frame of a filly and is next year's model. We'll see what we do and there is the final series of this race for her - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I'm happy with her and she seems in great form. All being well, she'll head for the Salsabil Stakes at Navan and I think the step up to a mile and a quarter will suit her. She's grown nicely over the winter and is in good form. 24-04-24

runners.name: Elizabeth Jane
runners.comment: Top rated, fourth in Irish Oaks on good, Listed winner on heavy, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Top rated at 105; both wins have come on heavy at 1m-1m2f including a Listed heat at Leopardstown on her final run of 2024; however, she ran a fine race when fourth in the Irish Oaks on good; yard has started the season in flying form; the one to beat.

quotes.race: Thomas's Of Foxrock "Jim And Kathleen Murphy" Memorial Trigo Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Things didn't go right for Elizabeth Jane in the Blandford. She's been working very well and I was reasonably confident she'd win today. I think a mile and a half will be her best trip. Group level [races] over that trip will be no problem for her next year - Dermot Weld, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ameerat Jumaira
runners.comment: Dual h'cap winner in 2024, creditable runs in two Listed races, place chance on stable bow
runners.spotlight: Rated 98; 3-9 on turf; dual handicap winner last August off 79 at Dundalk (10.5f) and on good ground at the Curragh off 81 (1m4f, good); not disgraced in a couple of Listed races subsequently; place claims on first start for Jack Davison.

quotes.race: Neville O'Byrne Memorial Irish EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Ameerat Jumaira had a lovely first run back at Roscommon. I had this race in mind for her and decided to give her a run at Dundalk to give her some confidence on that surface. She likes a level track. I'm impressed with how she quickened up there. We'll see what's there for her on Champions Weekend - Michael Halford, co-trainer.

runners.name: Annaghmccanns
runners.comment: Rated 81, 2-5 on the AW, won a handicap off 73 on latest, tough task on turf debut
runners.spotlight: 81 rated filly is 2-5 and has raced solely on AW; won a 10.5f Dundalk handicap latest off 73; looks to be punching above her weight on turf debut.

runners.name: Bubble Gum
runners.comment: French recruit, came up short in Gr 1s, placed at Listed level, stable debut, check market
runners.spotlight: French recruit; won a Saint-Cloud maiden (1m, heavy) and a Longchamp conditions race (1m1f, soft) on her first two starts of last season; came up short in Group 1 company before a 3.75l third in a Longchamp Listed heat in September (10.5f, good to soft); stamina a query on first start for Paddy Twomey; market should reveal expectations.

runners.name: Comic Book
runners.comment: 1-6, rated 101, placed in a Gr 3 on final start of 2024, preferred by Foley, could go well
runners.spotlight: 1-6 and rated 101; progressed well after 1m4f maiden win at Bellewstown (good); just missed the places in a 12.5f Deauville Group 3 and 1m6f Longchamp Listed before getting black type when a 5l second behind Time Lock in a Newmarket Group 3 (1m4f, soft); preferred by Foley and could go well.

stable_tour.quote: Is another I like. Her work seems to be above average, although it will be the middle of the season before she's out. 21-04-23

runners.name: Fairy Wings
runners.comment: Progressive in h'caps last year, dual winner on heavy, this looks a big ask, may need soft
runners.spotlight: Progressed well in handicaps last season, winning at Gowran and the Curragh on heavy off 64 and 74; finished with a rating of 84 and tries her hand at Listed company; this looks a big ask and she may need softer ground.

quotes.race: Racing Again November 9th Handicap
quotes.quote: Fairy Wings had a few little setbacks as a young individual but she seemed to fight well there and she liked the ground - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Goodie Two Shoes
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 3-6 on the Flat and rated 99, fit from the jumps, ground ideal, place claims
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare is 3-6 on the Flat and rated 99; came up short when tried in Listed company in 2022 and 2023 but soft ground wasn't ideal; fit from the jumps and it wouldn't be a surprise if she nicked some black type on ground she will enjoy for last year's winning yard.

quotes.race: McEnery Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It's nice to see Goodie Two Shoes back in good form, she did it nicely. I'd say she will mix it between the Flat and hurdles. She had a hard fall at Fairyhouse that set her back a bit so it's good to see her back - Frank Berry, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Goodie Two Shoes learned a bit from Killarney and I would say that was a good performance, it rode a lot sharper today. 1m4f would suit her - Frank Berry, racing manager to J.P. McManus.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see her get off the mark over hurdles at Killarney. She doesn't want the ground too heavy so we'll have to pick the right spots for her, but I think she is capable of getting some black type over hurdles. 27-11-23

runners.name: Joupe
runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, 1-24 on turf, 0-9 in stakes company, prefers soft ground, watch
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 1-24 on turf and rated 89; 0-9 in stakes company but has placed on two occasions; best form is on testing ground and may need this after a break; watch.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet Boost Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Joupe was ridden to perfection. We'll come back here again and might go further in trip - Peter Lawlor, trainer.

runners.name: Lady Doris
runners.owner: Mrs Treasa Oloughlin & Mrs M V Magnier
runners.comment: 2-7 on turf and rated 94, no joy in four Listed starts in 2024, needs to find more
runners.spotlight: 2-7 on turf and rated 94; maiden and handicap winner off 81 last season; campaigned at Listed level with no success in final four starts of 2024; good ground suits but she needs to find more.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish EBF Ulster Oaks Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady Doris was second in her maiden to Port Fairy the other day at Dundalk and was a touch unlucky there. She's never going to be a flash winner as she only does the bare minimum ? I just tried not to get there too soon. She seems to have plenty of ability - Gavin Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Madam Celeste
runners.comment: 0-3 on turf, rated 100, 5lb swing for neck defeat by Sea The Boss last year, place claims
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-3 on turf but has shown smart form and is rated 100; beaten a neck in a Naas Group 3 by Sea The Boss on her return last season but she is 5lb better off here; struggled in the Irish Oaks; had Ameerat Jumaira behind when touched off in a Dundalk Listed race in September; place claims at least for in-form yard.

runners.name: Riviera Queen
runners.comment: Tramore maiden winner, rated 95, fourth in a Naas Listed on yielding, may want it softer
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; Tramore maiden winner under this jockey last year is rated 95; suggested she could pick up black type when fourth in Listed company at Naas (1m4f, yielding) last October but she may need softer ground.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly. She ran very well when third at Leopardstown earlier this month and has really strengthened up over the winter. She should be a nice staying filly as she's bred to get a mile and a half, maybe a mile and six furlongs. 24-04-24

runners.name: Satin
runners.comment: 3-13 and rated 95, smart h'cap form in 2023, didn't fire in 2024, deserted by Foley, watch
runners.spotlight: Fourth runner for yard; 3-13 on turf and rated 95; smart handicap form in 2023 but didn't really fire in four starts last season; deserted by Foley and is best watched.

stable_tour.quote: She had a great campaign last season, winning three times and improving plenty. We'll wait until the ground dries up as she needs good ground. She'll probably start off over a mile and a half and we could try a mile and six with her at some stage during the season. 24-04-24

1:42.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
1:42.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Baby Basma
runners.comment: Half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Magic Basma (RPR 86); dam French 5.5f winner (91)
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Magic Basma (RPR 86); dam French 5.5f winner (91), half-sister to French winners Timizmiz (6f-10.5f including at two) and Insolent (6.5f AW 2yo); well worth checking in the betting.

runners.name: Itsnotme
runners.comment: Fifth foal; half-sister to 7f 2yo AW/KSA 6f winner Tropical Air (RPR 76)
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to 7f 2yo AW/KSA 6f winner Tropical Air (RPR 76); dam unplaced 1m-1m2f in France, half-sister to winners Aesop's Fables (1m Group 1) and First Winter (useful 1m/1m2f); claimer ridden for debut and likely to want further.

runners.name: Luna Beaux
runners.comment: Saxon Warrior filly; half-sister to 6f AW 2yo winner Good Banter (RPR 93)
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior filly; half-sister to 6f AW 2yo winner Good Banter (RPR 93); dam 6f-1m winner (80), half-sister to useful winners Ghost Serge (6f-1m4f Flat including 2yo; 2m hurdle) and Barley (1m); bred to be an early type.

runners.name: Mina Bonita
runners.comment: 12,500euros yearling; closely related to smart winning juvenile Rivellino
runners.spotlight: 12,500euros yearling; 13th foal; closely related to winners Rivellino (6f-7f AW inc 2yo/Listed; RPR 110) and Brazilian Breeze (5f; 79), half-sister to three winners including Ensured (1m2f/1m4f; 98); dam 5f/6f 2yo winner (Group 3; 106); bred to win races.

runners.name: Portmagee Girl
runners.comment: Half-sister to 8.6f AW winner Timespan (RPR 81); dam 8.6f AW winner (71)
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-sister to 8.6f AW winner Timespan (RPR 81); dam 8.6f AW winner (71), sister to 1m2f 2yo Group 1 winner Passage Of Time (dam of 1m-10.5f Group 2 winner Time Test); possibly one for further down the line when sent further.

runners.name: Salacious
runners.comment: Bred to be sharp but yard not renowned for 2yo winners
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Ardenode (5f 2yo including Listed; RPR 101), Dandy Dinmont (5f/6f; 85), Defying Orders (6f 2yo; 75), Queenoftheclyde (5f 2yo; 57) and Love Kisses (Italian 7.5f-1m); dam 5f 2yo winner (67); bred to be sharp but yard not renowned for 2yo winners.

runners.name: Slaney View
runners.owner: Molly & Paul Willis Racing, Mrs J S Bolger
runners.comment: 13-8 when second at the Curragh and probably bumped into a very good horse
runners.spotlight: Strong 13-8 market leader when runner-up at the Curragh (soft) and probably bumped into a very good horse in market rival Power Blue, with the front two coming clear; improvement is on the cards and very much the one they all have to beat.

runners.name: Star Reign
runners.breeder: Cloneymore Farms Ltd & James C Murtagh
runners.comment: Plenty of speed in her pedigree and dam a half-sister to top sprinter Kyllachy
runners.spotlight: 3,000euros yearling; eighth foal; half-sister to winners Kraken Power (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 85) and Kodi King (Greek 6f/7f); dam unplaced 6f/7f (33), half-sister to numerous winners including 5f Group 1 winner Kyllachy; plenty of speed in her pedigree.

runners.name: Sup Of Red
runners.comment: Half-sister to winners Kodi Red (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 89) and Aparajeo (6f 2yo; 82)
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros yearling; third foal; half-sister to winners Kodi Red (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 89) and Aparajeo (6f 2yo; 82); dam 5f 2yo winner (74), half-sister to Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Bohemian Flame; likely best watched.

runners.name: Venerated
runners.comment: Weak 25-1 chance when finishing last at the Curragh three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Weak 25-1 chance when finishing last at the Curragh three weeks ago (Slaney View runner-up); hard to recommend on the back of that.

2:17.race_name: Buy Your Tickets Now For The Easter Festival Rated Race
2:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Likedbymike
runners.owner: Mrs Michael J Byrne & Jerry P Murphy
runners.comment: Beat Passing Phase by 4.25l over C&D in Oct, jockey's claim useful, chance if fit
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; built on promise of second start when hacking up in a C&D maiden on good to yielding in October, beating Passing Phase by 4.25l; awarded a rating of 90 on the back of that effort; jockey's 5lb claim is a plus and he holds solid form claims if fit for his return.

runners.name: Bodhi Bear
runners.comment: 6f maiden winner on yielding, has form over 7f on good, drop to 5f should be ok, chance
runners.spotlight: 6f Navan maiden winner on yielding third time up last October, making all; solid form on debut at Naas over 7f when beaten 2.5l by Cercene; has shown plenty of speed so the drop to 5f shouldn't inconvenience him; claims.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Bodhi Bear had two very good runs coming in here and he had his chance today. He stepped forward nicely in what felt like a strong maiden - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Town And Country
runners.owner: Mrs M Roden & Mrs R Nolan
runners.comment: Navan maiden winner at 5f, outclassed in Gr 3 at Ayr over 6f, this C&D may not suit, watch
runners.spotlight: Landed a 5f Navan maiden (good) on her second start last August, staying on well up the hill; came up short in an Ayr Group 3 over 6f on her last start of 2024; not sure this easy 5f will suit her and she is probably best watched on her seasonal reappearance.

runners.name: Turners Cross
runners.owner: Dan Kiely & P V Breen & Chris Dineen & M Stafford
runners.comment: 0-5, highly tried last season, placed in two 5f Navan maidens, Foley prefers stablemate
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; highly tried five-race maiden who ran well in defeat in a pair of Navan maidens over 5f on good and yielding ground; has been gelded and Shane Foley prefers the chances of his stablemate Passing Phase.

runners.name: Passing Phase
runners.comment: Weighted to get closer to Likedbymike, has a fitness edge, Foley rides, thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Decent form in maidens at 5f-6f on varying ground last season; beaten 4.25l by Likedbymike over C&D in October; pleasing reappearance third in a 6f Curragh maiden, shaping like the drop back to this trip would suit; preferred by Foley, weighted to get much closer to Likedbymike and has a fitness edge this time; thereabouts.

runners.name: Smoke Them Out
runners.comment: 1-7, course handicap winner over 6f, held by Gazelle d'Or on Bellewstown meeting, watch
runners.spotlight: 1-7, the win coming here off 72 in a 6f handicap on good to yielding in October; beaten 0.5l off 82 at Naas later that month; previously finished 2l behind Gazelle d'Or in a Bellewstown maiden over 5f in August and is 7lb worse off here; lacks a recent run and is best watched back at 5f.

runners.name: Unexpected Issues
runners.comment: 5f debut Navan winner, no impact in stakes company at 6f-7f, drops in trip, check market
runners.spotlight: Won a 5f Navan maiden (yielding) on debut; came up short in stakes company over 6f and 7f the next twice; drops in class, is back to her last winning trip and is worth a market check on her seasonal reappearance.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Unexpected Issues is going to be an early two-year-old. I suppose we'll run maybe once more and think about something in Ascot for her. She was a little bit green, a little bit slow away and then ran around a bit. She should come forward for that. She's only worked once on grass so she should improve - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

runners.name: Ohmyviette
runners.breeder: Mme Alix Rambaud & M Hughes Rambaud
runners.comment: 2-6 on the AW, has won over 5f and 6f, beaten off 88 on h'cap bow, watch on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; raced exclusively on AW so far and is 2-6 with wins at 5f and 6f; beaten 4.5l when last of eight on handicap debut in February; best watched on turf debut.

quotes.race: Happy Valentines Day Rated Race
quotes.quote: Ohmyviette is still green as you can see. He doesn't do a whole lot when he gets to the front, but has galloped right out to the line. He has done it well in the end - Sam Coen, rider.

runners.name: Billie Be Quick
runners.comment: Won a 5f Down Royal handicap off 70 when last seen, Foley jumps ship, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; 1-7 on turf; won a 5f Down Royal handicap on yielding ground off 70 on her final start of 2024; deserted by Shane Foley and others appeal more.

runners.name: Gazelle Dor

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Renata Coleman & Aidan Gleeson & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Won two last season, ran well in a C&D maiden last July, ground ideal, place chance if fit
runners.spotlight: Had a busy 2yo campaign, winning twice; landed a 6f Navan handicap off 72 on her final start of the season on good to yielding ground; ran well in a maiden over C&D last July; gets her favoured good ground here and she could run into the places if fit for her return.

quotes.race: Slane Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Gazelle D'or has done very well to win that. The whole thing today was about just switching her off and getting her to come home good. She travelled lovely the whole way and, just when she got there, she just idled a small bit underneath me - Jack Cleary, rider.

2:52.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places on Round course

runners.name: Viamonte
runners.comment: Rated 67 after three AW runs, best run a 0.75l third at 5f, should act on turf, needs more
runners.spotlight: 4yo earned a rating of 67 after three runs on the AW at Dundalk; best effort a 0.75l third on latest over 5f in February; his pedigree suggests that he will handle turf but he needs to improve plenty to figure here off top weight, though rider's claim a help.

runners.name: Elusive Duke
runners.comment: Second here over 6f on debut, not as good upped to 7f on AW, gets a mark after this, watch
runners.spotlight: Good run when a 4.5l second over 6f here on debut on good to firm last September; failed to back that up over 7f at Dundalk a month later and off since; drops back to 5f and will qualify for handicaps after this; watch.

runners.name: Far Above Dream
runners.comment: Big prices but not disgraced in two runs last year at 7f and 6f, probably one for h'caps
runners.spotlight: Big prices but not disgraced in two runs last season, in a 7f claimer at Dundalk and in 6f soft ground maiden at the Curragh; probably one for handicaps.

runners.name: Hello Silas
runners.comment: Hello Youmzain colt, half-brother to three winners, tongue tied for debut, watch market
runners.spotlight: Hello Youmzain colt cost 50,000euros as a yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to winners Brioni (1m AW/1m2f turf; RPR 100), Dream Story (1m4f) and High Charm (9.5f AW 2yo); dam unraced sister to useful 1m-1m2f winner High Dream, half-sister to 5.5f 2yo Group 3 winner; tongue tied for debut but worth a market check.

runners.name: Morally Sound
runners.comment: No Nay Never colt, cost 200,000euros as a yearling, related to winners, check market
runners.spotlight: No Nay Never colt cost 150,000gns as a foal and 200,000euros as a yearling; third foal; half-brother to winners Dora Milaje (1m/1m2f inc 2yo; RPR 99) and Barefoot Warrior (1m inc AW; 89); dam unraced half-sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Beauty Parlour; yard can ready one so check the market.

runners.name: No Return

prev_owners.owner: N W T Dalzell & R P Behan

runners.comment: 0-10 overall, 0-6 on turf but has ability and rated 80, drop in trip a query, place claims
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 0-10 overall and 0-6 on turf but has shown ability and is rated 80; beaten 3l in a 6f maiden on first start for Danny Murphy at Dundalk; drop to 5f not an obvious move but she has place claims nonetheless.

runners.name: Pinmoney
runners.comment: Well beaten at 200-1 on debut for this yard at Naas, drops in trip, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10.5l on sole start on AW for Ollie Sangster in January; 200-1 and always behind on debut for this yard at Naas last month; different ground and drops in trip but she may need more time.

runners.name: Bobbi Rosa
runners.comment: 0-6 overall, 0-3 on turf and rated 78, ran well over C&D last August, can't discount
runners.spotlight: 0-6 overall and 0-3 on turf but has run well in defeat, including in a C&D maiden on fast ground last August; rating of 78 leaves her with a bit to find but her yard is in good form and she can't be discounted on her seasonal reappearance.

runners.name: Lil Angel
runners.comment: Dark Angel filly, plenty of speed in pedigree, yard can ready one, monitor the market
runners.spotlight: Dark Angel filly; unsold for GBP40,000 as a 2yo; dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (RPR 96), closely related to 5.5f 2yo winner Miss Rosina, half-sister to winners Hungry For Fashion (Qatari 6.5f/7f) and White Wind (Swiss 10.5f), out of half-sister to 5f Listed winner; nicely bred, yard can ready one and Keane rides; worth monitoring closely in the market.

runners.name: Mini Mai
runners.comment: Mehmas filly, dam from a decent family, Keane prefers her stablemate, best watched
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; Mehmas filly unsold for 11,000euros as a yearling; first foal; dam unplaced 5f-7.5f (RPR 72), half-sister to useful 1m/8.6f AW winner Kestenna out of 1m winning half-sister to German 6f Group 2 winner Electric Beat and Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Gray Pearl; looks the stable second string on jockey bookings; watch.

runners.name: Saratoga Special
runners.comment: Top rated at 93, Listed placed last year, well-treated by race conditions, big chance
runners.spotlight: Top rated at 93; smart form in defeat last year including a 0.5l second in a 5f Listed heat at the Curragh on good ground; very well-treated by the conditions of this race and this looks a gilt edged opportunity for her to get off the mark.

2:50.race_name: Prix la Force (Group 3) (3yo Colts & Geldings) (Moyenne Course) (Turf)

3:25.race_name: Al Shira'aa Racing Prix Vanteaux (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Moyenne Course) (Turf)

runners.name: Blown By The Wind
runners.breeder: Earl Haras De Cisai & Mme C Von Leithner

runners.name: Flaming Stone
runners.breeder: Mrs A Wigan & Juddmonte Farms Ltd

runners.name: Premonition
runners.owner: Scea Jlc, F Chappet Et Al

quotes.race: Darley Prix des Reservoirs (Group 3) (2yo Fillies) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The major question mark was how Gezora would handle very soft ground because she only works on sand tracks at home, and she only ever gets on the grass when she goes to the races. She has shown herself to be a very good filly on good going and ground with a little ease in it, so it's great that she handled this so well. She just has a lot of quality and she thoroughly deserves a break now. I didn't want to pitch her into the Criterium against the colts, which is what we did with Shiffrin last year, so we came back in trip by 200 metres to stay against her own sex. I'll sit down and discuss her programme for the spring with Nicolas de Chambure. She has really strengthened up during the autumn and I'm delighted - Nicolas Le Roch, trainer.

runners.name: Horizon Dore
runners.owner: Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al
Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al

quotes.race: Prix d'Ispahan (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's always hard when you're beaten by such small margins, but Horizon Dore showed his true self today. We'll see how he comes out of it, but his options are the Prince of Wales's and the Eclipse, and hopefully he'll get a proper pace to run at in Britain - Pauline Chehboub, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Dollar (Group 2) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That run to the second post makes it difficult to judge as it's not what Horizon Dore is used to, but Mickael (Barzalona) knows him by heart. If he recovers well we can look forward to trying to win back the title that Sealiway won for us in the Champion Stakes at Ascot - Pauline Chehboub, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Prix du Prince d'Orange (Group 3) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We're delighted because Horizon Dore will come forward for this as we head to Arc weekend and the Prix Dollar. He wasn't at 100 per cent today, that's undeniable. And, as opposed to Sealiway's year, there is a three-week gap between Arc weekend and the Champion Stakes which is great - Pauline Chehboub, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Prix Eugene Adam (Group 2) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Horizon Dore may be a gelding but he showed plenty of character as a two-year-old and even more this year. Still, we have a lot of hope invested in him and he showed his talent there. There are several options going forward and we'll have to discuss the options with the other co-owners. But Horizon Dore could very well run across the Channel, in America or even in Asia -  Pauline Chehboub of Gousserie Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He had a slow start to the year but his last two runs have been excellent. He really needs a good pace to run at and often races over ten furlongs in France lack that. Over a mile and a furlong in the d'Ispahan they went fast enough for him to produce that turn of foot. He's already run well at Ascot and, with his ability to accelerate and Mickael Barzalona on board, the real Horizon Dore he has a leading chance. 13-06-24

quotes.race: La Coupe de Maisons-Laffitte (Group 3) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Certain Lad was always a good horse, he won the Strensall as a four-year-old but had a couple of nasty injuries at five and six. This is the first year he's come into a season with no injury. He's sound and well, and a happy horse. He's got a great mind and is easy to train because he wants to do it. The two races for him are the Preis von Europa over a mile and a half or the Prix Dollar. I think I'll probably lean towards the Prix Dollar, but I'd love to run him in a Group 1 at some stage. He'll stay in training at nine and we'll see if he retains the same zest. We might have a look at something like the Prix Ganay at the start of the year. He's an eight-year-old and I won't have too much longer with him, so we won't mess around, we'll run him in some nice races - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Rock Partnership Recruitment Solutions Handicap
quotes.quote: Certain Lad was rated 112, he's come back down to 100 (before York) and he's back to a mark he can win off, it's as simple as that really. He's still a very good horse, even at seven. He was a Listed winner as a two-year-old, he was third in the Railway Stakes and has won in Dubai. The handicapping system is there for a reason, he's come down and won two very nice races now. It has been discussed in the office a few times, whether we missed this and went straight to the November Handicap. Let's see how he comes out of this as he's had a couple of quick runs there. If he's bouncing, which I'm sure he will be knowing him, we might have a little look at it, if not we'll keep a mile and a half up our sleeve for next year because he loves racing and he's as good an advocate as you could have for racing, so he'll be carrying on next year as well - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet And Symphony Group Strensall Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Certain Lad gave me a great ride. He was stepping down in trip and he settled really well. He hit a bit of a flat spot three and a half down but we came across to the stands' side and he was very tough, once I got daylight he really ran to the line for me. The further I went the better and he thrived on the ground - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Zabeel Turf Sponsored By Riviera 1 (Listed Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Certain Lad is improving with every run. He does everything a horse should do to get himself beat, but he keeps winning. In the prelims he gets very warm and is notorious for it. He gets hot and sweaty, but it doesn't seem to bother him in the race. He ran a bit fresh and keen the first two furlongs, but once he got into a rhythm, I was delighted. He picked them up well and kept going all the way to the line - Ben Curtis, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a good season, winning a Group 3 at Longchamp on his last run in early September. Unfortunately, he had a little bit of a setback a couple of weeks ago, which meant he missed Paris last weekend. I have him in a Group 1 in Germany on November 10, and I'll get him back for that if I can. If not, we'll wrap him up for the year. We might have a look at Dubai or just aim him straight for the Prix Ganay in France next spring. 10-10-24

quotes.race: Prix Exbury (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: In Map Of Stars's Listed win last October he ranged up to challenge very easily and then didn't put the race to bed straight away, only just doing enough. He doesn't have a lot of experience but it's great when they find everything so easy. I've no doubt he'll stay 2,400 metres and he deserves his chance in a good race up in trip. But for now he'll head to the Group 2 Prix d'Harcourt and, if he runs well there, the Ganay after that - Francis Graffard, trainer.

runners.name: Journalism
runners.owner: Bridlewood Farm, Don Alberto Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Likely to be a threat; won Santa Anita Grade 2 35 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Narrow scorer in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago; completed his hat-trick last time; should be on the premises.

runners.name: Citizen Bull
runners.owner: Sf Racing Llc, Starlight Racing Et Al
runners.comment: In with a shout; winner of four of his five career runs.
runners.spotlight: Winner of four of his five runs to date and completed hat-trick last time out; got the job done by just under 4l over 1m here (Grade 3, bobbled at the start) in January; looks likely to be involved.

quotes.race: FanDuel Breeders' Cup Juvenile - Thoroughbred Aftercare Alliance (Grade 1) (2yo C&G) (Main) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Citizen Bull was just running easy early and the other horse (Gaming) was just cruising in second. And when it was time to go the horse just took off - Martin Garcia, jockey.

runners.name: Westwood
runners.comment: Not beaten far last month; wins-runs record of 0-3.
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred (by Authentic) and related to Stakes winner Tarabi; good effort when close up three weeks ago in a maiden special weight.

runners.name: Barnes
runners.comment: Clear chance; placed in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: This son of Into Mischief looks the part on breeding and won a Grade 2 in January here; behind Journalism when beaten just under 2l to finish second in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago; should be involved.

runners.name: Baeza
runners.owner: C R K Stable Llc & Grandview Equine
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and others more appealing.
runners.spotlight: Related to Grade 1 winner Mage; got the job done by just under 5l when opening his account at the third time of asking 50 days ago in a maiden special weight; having his first crack at a big race and can be taken on.

runners.name: Perfect Pairing
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jerry Chow Shiu Ming
runners.comment: Failed to threaten in nine Class 4 outings this season; today's ease in grade should help
runners.spotlight: Winless in 12 local starts and has failed to threaten in nine Class 4 outings this season; today's ease in grade at least offers some hope.

runners.name: Chilli Baba
runners.owner: Henry Cheng Wai Hong, Alan Lai Ka Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Ended a losing streak on New Year's Day; held off revised mark since; step forward needed
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing streak with a 1m1f win here on New Year's Day; held off his revised mark since, so needs to take another step forward.

runners.name: Super Treasure
runners.owner: Martin Yung Ping Fai & Kwok Yi Chit
runners.comment: Beaten out of sight in all six starts to date; impossible to recommend at present.
runners.spotlight: Beaten out of sight in all six starts to date; impossible to recommend at present.

runners.name: Ivictoriam
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Henry H L Chan & Mr & Mrs Michael T H Lee
runners.comment: Posted a career best on his penultimate outing; today's trip may unlock more progress
runners.spotlight: Posted a career best when second over 1m here on his penultimate outing; today's longer trip may unlock more progress.

runners.name: Skyey Blue
runners.comment: Showed little in novice events last season and hasn't improved since switched to handicaps
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in novice events last season and hasn't improved since moving into handicaps; plenty to find.

runners.name: Oriental Tycoon
runners.comment: Little to recommend on 13 local starts so far; others readily preferred.
runners.spotlight: Little to recommend on 13 local starts so far; others readily preferred.

runners.name: Smart Zipang
runners.comment: Continued to struggle in handicaps this term; major improvement required
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in novice events last season and continued to struggle in handicaps this term; major improvement required.

runners.name: Super Hong Kong
runners.comment: Went close over 1m3f at Happy Valley last month; highly respected off his current mark
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but went close over 1m3f at Happy Valley last month; highly respected off his current mark.

runners.name: Joyful Champion
runners.owner: Raymond Chow Wai Kam & Lau Wing Sang
runners.comment: Made his breakthrough with a 1m1f dirt victory last season; needs more to strike again
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough with a 1m1f dirt victory last season; competitive at times this term but needs to find more to strike again.

runners.name: Gold Tack
runners.owner: Robert Chung Wai Shu & Jeanette Chung Siu Wah
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who looked to be improving but was well held last time
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who looked to be improving earlier this year but was well held last time; has proved competitive off much higher marks than this.

runners.name: Golden Fairy
runners.owner: Rex Wong Siu Han, Ivan Wong Siu Kei & Ann Wong Pui Gee
runners.comment: Narrowly denied in December but two poor efforts have followed; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied at Happy Valley in December but two poor efforts have followed; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Chateau Le Peche
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Looked to be progressing earlier this term but recent efforts have been flat
runners.spotlight: Looked to be progressing earlier this term but recent efforts have been flat; capable of better off current mark.

runners.name: Turtle Again
runners.breeder: Mrs H G & W G Bax & Goldeye Trust
runners.owner: Ho Koon Wah, Dominic Ho Tsz Kin Et Al
runners.comment: Off the mark over 1m1f last season; fair third in November but hasn't built on that effort
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over 1m1f last season; fair third here in November but hasn't built on that effort in recent outings.

runners.name: Leather Master
runners.breeder: Mrs C N Taylor & Taylor Family Trust
runners.comment: Almost broke through over 1m here last month; dangerous to dimiss
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who almost broke through over 1m here last month; up 3lb for that effort but remains dangerous to dismiss.

runners.name: Wood On Fire
runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from a pleasing seasonal return; needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Winless since November 2023 and hasn't kicked on from a pleasing seasonal return; needs to raise his game.

10:50.race_name: Wu Yee Sun And Lee Woo Sing Alumni Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.name: Ghorgan
runners.comment: Smart when trained in Germany but made a very disappointing HK debut over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Smart when trained in Germany but made a very disappointing Hong Kong debut over C&D last month and is difficult to enthuse over after that performance.

runners.name: Tourbillon Prince

prev_owners.owner: Ms S M Moloney & M A Epis

runners.comment: Ran well from out of the weights over C&D last month and has each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f here in December and was very respectable fourth from out of the weights over C&D three weeks ago; dips back into Class 3 and is effectively 3lb lower today; each-way claims at least.

runners.name: Star Mac
runners.comment: Has remained in good form since breakthrough Hong Kong win in January; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Belatedly off the mark in Hong Kong with 1m1f success at Happy Valley in January and has remained in good form since; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: The Best Peach
runners.comment: Lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this season
runners.spotlight: Lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this season and needs to turn a corner.

quotes.race: Cazoo Silver Bowl Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll keep taking it a step at a time, but we'd be hoping that Whoputfiftyinyou is a Britannia horse. We said we'd go there if he won this and there'd be no reason to change that really, but we'll see - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Newcomers' EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whoputfiftyinyou had done a couple of nice pieces of work at home and it was a good opening for him. He was a bit green in the mid-part of the race but asserted close home, giving the impression another furlong is in reach - Hector Crouch, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his first three races and Tom [Marquand] gave him a super ride at Newbury on Sunday. I think he'll get a mile and the weekend got me excited because I think he can improve on that. 21-04-22

He won his two starts last season at Haydock and Kempton over 6f. That earned him a mark of 83, which he made light work of first time out in the spring at Newbury and maintained his perfect record to go four from four at Haydock, where he showed a very good turn of foot. He's an absolute dude who is so laid-back but has real star quality. The fact that he got a mile at Haydock was very encouraging and he heads for the Britannia at Royal Ascot, but I've also entered him for a race in France next weekend as a precaution. That recent run looked very decent as the runner-up Mighty Ulysses had a reputation and they pair of them pulled more than five lengths clear. With his turn of foot, he looks a very exciting prospect. 09-06-22

runners.name: Luck Is Back
runners.comment: Made quite promising HK debut in November but well beaten all three starts since
runners.spotlight: Dual Brazilian Group 1 winner (1m/1m2f); made quite promising Hong Kong debut in November (6f, dirt) but well beaten on all three subsequent appearances (6f-1m).

runners.name: Lupo Solitario
runners.comment: 3-6 when based in New Zealand but yet to be placed after five Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: 3-6 when based in New Zealand, including 7f Group 3 win, but yet to be placed after five Hong Kong starts and needs to find some improvement from somewhere.

runners.name: Ching
runners.comment: Ran well over 7f in first-time blinkers last month and this return to 1m will suit
runners.spotlight: Has rather mixed record this season but seemed to respond well to first-time blinkers when staying-on fourth over 7f here three weeks ago; remains on a good mark and will be suited by today's move back up in trip; contender if the headgear continues to aid.

runners.name: Dragon Joy
runners.breeder: Mrs A P, D E & R W E Moore
runners.comment: Dual course winner this season (7f/1m) but form has slumped on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Dual winner this season, latterly when clinging on by a short head over C&D in January; two lesser efforts have followed, though, and he now has questions to answer.

runners.name: Sky Jewellery
runners.comment: Progressive 3yo with 2-4 strike-rate; seems likely to be suited by this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 3yo who has collected two Class 4 wins this season (6f/7f) and lost out only by a neck when upped to this grade three weeks ago; has shaped very much as though today's longer trip will suit; major player.

runners.name: Flying Luck
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Horatio Ho Yiu Wing, Ho Garrick Sai Man & H L S Kit
runners.comment: Up in grade after last month's ready C&D win but ought to give another good account
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive 4yo who doubled his tally with a ready C&D win four weeks ago; latest 6lb rise enforces today's rise in grade but he ought to give another good account.

runners.name: Glorious Success
runners.comment: Ex-Australian 5yo who has been placed on four of his six Hong Kong starts; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 5yo who has been placed on four of his six Hong Kong starts; below form on latest outing but still enters calculations.

runners.name: Morgan Success
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Second HK run was much less encouraging that his debut but he might bounce back
runners.spotlight: Won in Ireland last year (1m, AW) and was promising fourth here (7f) on Hong Kong debut in February; took a backward step over C&D a week later but it would be foolish to write him off after that.

quotes.race: Fairways Dundalk Hotel Maiden
quotes.quote: Shamsuddin has been coming along and I thought a mile around here would suit him well. Ben set nice fractions and he quickened up well. We'll look at a handicap now and bring him along that way - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: The Absolute
runners.breeder: C C E & Mrs I S Thompson
runners.comment: 7f course winner on seasonal debut in December; well held in this higher grade twice since
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win readily over 7f on seasonal debut in December but was unable to land any sort of blow when upped to this grade for last two outings and is far too inconsistent to rely upon.

runners.name: Solid Win
runners.comment: Largely in good form over 7f/1m this season but others appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Largely in good form over 7f/1m this season and recent 1m1f defeat from out of the weights is not viewed harshly but others appeal more all the same.

runners.name: Rising From Ashes
runners.comment: Regressive 7yo; form has dipped again since his 7f second here in January
runners.spotlight: Regressive 7yo; suggested he might be ready to capitalise upon some help from the handicapper when close second over 7f in January but his form has dipped again since.

runners.name: Lucky Man
runners.comment: Competitive in Class 4 company this season but was disappointing in this grade latest
runners.spotlight: Competitive in Class 4 company this season but posted a disappointing effort when dropped into this grade in February; better is expected.

runners.name: Manythanks Forever
runners.owner: Chan Wing Kwong, Patrick Ng Pak Hong Et Al
runners.comment: Opened his account with a C&D win in December; disappointed twice since but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Opened his account with a C&D win in December and backed that success up with another solid effort; has disappointed twice since but not ruled out.

runners.name: Perfect Peach
runners.comment: Returned with a near miss in September; hasn't fired since though so needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a deserved victory and returned with a near miss in September; hasn't fired since though so needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Perfecto Moments
runners.comment: Winless in eight starts and hasn't shown enough to warrant support; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Winless in eight starts and hasn't shown enough to warrant support; others preferred.

runners.name: Regency Happy Star
runners.comment: Continued his solid run of form last month; hard to oppose in current mood
runners.spotlight: Continued his solid run of form with a convincing C&D win last month; 6lb rise demands more but hard to oppose in current mood.

runners.name: Family Fortune
runners.owner: Tony Stradmoor, Billy Li Sze Kuen Et Al
runners.comment: Beaten in all nine career starts and needs significant improvement to figure.
runners.spotlight: Beaten in all nine career starts and needs significant improvement to figure.

runners.name: So Awesome
runners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing & Edwin Law Pok Hin

runners.comment: Has hinted at improvement recently; one to consider from a basement mark
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but has hinted at improvement recently; one to consider from a basement mark.

runners.name: Sonic Boom
runners.owner: George Lee Hing Fai, Wong Che Leung Et Al
runners.comment: Scored on his final start last season and stuck to dirt since; not dismissed back on turf
runners.spotlight: Scored on his final start last season and has stuck to dirt ever since; not entirely dismissed back on this surface if reproducing his best form.

runners.name: Almighty Kick
runners.comment: Yet to make a serious impact in 11 starts but is sliding down the weights
runners.spotlight: Yet to make a serious impact in 11 starts but is sliding down the weights; needs to show more.

runners.name: Double Bingo
runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.comment: Looked promising on debut last season but has disappointed in 11 outings since
runners.spotlight: Looked promising on debut last season but has disappointed in 11 outings since; hard to support.

runners.name: Flying Phantom
runners.comment: Strong-finishing second over C&D in December and was a fair third last time; capable
runners.spotlight: Strong-finishing second over C&D in December and was a fair third on the dirt last month; capable off this mark.

runners.name: Timestorm
runners.owner: D Mong Tak Yeung, J Mong Shuk Mei & J Mong Shuk Ching
runners.comment: Has been modest in four starts this season; needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Broke through with a 6f success at Happy Valley last term but has been modest in four starts this season; needs to raise his game.

runners.name: Speedy Chariot
runners.comment: Winless in 22 starts but has threatened on several occasions this term; may breakthrough
runners.spotlight: Winless in 22 starts but has threatened on several occasions this term; wouldn't be a shock if he finally gets his head in front.

runners.name: Beau Gosse
runners.comment: Made the frame over 5f in December but was disappointing last time and needs to do more
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; made the frame over 5f in December but was disappointing last time and needs to do more.

runners.name: California Icon
runners.comment: Posted a personal best two runs ago but was well held back on dirt last time
runners.spotlight: Posted a personal best when fourth two runs ago but was well held back on dirt last time; needs to find some consistency.

runners.name: Multidarling
runners.comment: Yet to add to his 6f win at Happy Valley last season and hasn't been competitive recently
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his 6f win at Happy Valley last season and hasn't been competitive recently; needs to step up.

runners.name: Magniac

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J Andrews, R F Drage Et Al

runners.comment: Down in class; landed two recent trials for this new trainer; has won off 15lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Dirt and turf 6f winner on a 12-race losing run; has moved trainer and won two trials since he was last seen in December; 15lb lower than for latest victory; interesting dropping to Class 4 for the first time.

runners.name: Mount Everest
runners.comment: Narrow C&D debut winner who is 6lb higher here; this could be a better race.
runners.spotlight: Got up in the very last stride to win at odds of 19-1 over C&D on his debut four weeks ago, with two of these rivals behind; should progress for that despite 6lb rise.

runners.name: Matters Most
runners.comment: British import who is yet to shine in seven local runs, mainly over this C&D.
runners.spotlight: Yet to reproduce his decent British form in seven Hong Kong starts and could manage only seventh on his C&D Class 4 debut four weeks ago.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't got Matters Most on the grass before his first run and he was green and got squeezed, but today he was very professional. He wants a sixth furlong and I don't know where we'll go, but there might be a race at Pontefract coming up, which could suit him. He's very straightforward and we like him. He's out of a Pastoral Pursuits mare so he's bred to handle this ground, but he moves like he'd handle quicker ground and I've have no qualms about trying him on a faster surface - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.name: Bull Attitude
runners.comment: Trial winner in New Zealand and placed in two more here; has possibilities despite draw.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners out of a Listed winner who cost NZ$200,000 as a 2yo; he won a trial in New Zealand and has been placed twice in Hong Kong so shapes like he could make an impact on this debut despite wide draw.

runners.name: Dazzling Fit
runners.breeder: Ms R Bennett & D A Dollimore
runners.comment: Suffered bad traffic problems when sixth as a 6-1 chance over C&D on debut; could go well.
runners.spotlight: Won a local trial and was quite well fancied for his C&D debut three weeks ago only to be repeatedly denied a clear run in the straight and finish sixth; capable of better.

runners.name: Pejibaye
runners.comment: Expensive yearling purchase who has gone well in trials so merits respect on this debut.
runners.spotlight: Cost NZ$320,000 as a yearling; won two trials in his native land and two more in Hong Kong; full-brother to a sprint winner and half-brother to another; looks a good prospect.

runners.name: Run Ran Run
runners.comment: Largely disappointing ex-Irish gelding but good C&D second off 1lb lower two starts ago.
runners.spotlight: Irish import who has been defeated in all nine local starts; failed to build on much-improved 0.5l second over C&D in January when trying 7f last time.

runners.name: Smart Engineer
runners.comment: Newcomer; breeding suggests that he will need further than 6f; beaten in all five trials.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winners who was bought for AUS210,000 as a yearling; has shown ability without winning in five trial race starts; unlikely to be fast enough for a 6f debut win.

runners.name: Top Throne
runners.comment: Good never nearer 0.75l fourth on recent C&D debut; now tried in cheekpieces.
runners.spotlight: Did well in trials before finishing 0.75l behind Mount Everest as a well fancied 4-1 chance on C&D debut; should improve for that run and with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Precious Hill
runners.comment: Beaten in both 5f starts to date; needs to have been transformed by seven week break.
runners.spotlight: Possible front-runner who has won a recent trial and is returning from seven weeks away; needs huge improvement on what he has shown in two starts to date to get competitive.

runners.name: Amazing Galaxy
runners.comment: Impossible to fancy on the back of three poor efforts so far.
runners.spotlight: Yet to manage a top-five finish in three starts, including two over this C&D; big outsider.

runners.name: Shiny Rapidash
runners.owner: Kwok Pui Yan, Lam Kwong Yiu Et Al
runners.comment: Much improved C&D fourth last time but this looks like a better race.
runners.spotlight: Posssible leader who produced a huge new personal best following four moderate efforts when beaten 2.75l as a 150-1 chance over this C&D three weeks ago; needs to prove that was not a fluke.

runners.name: Pochettino
runners.comment: Has one good effort (2l third over 7f) and six not so good ones to his name so far.
runners.spotlight: Would have an outside chance if repeating the level of his 2l third over 7f on penultimate run; lesser 1m effort since and is now dropped back to sprinting.

runners.name: King Oberon
runners.comment: Would be a factor if repeating his three best efforts; recent form is underwhelming.
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden who has finished runner-up over this C&D off higher marks than today's on three occasions; form of his last two runs gives him plenty to find.

runners.name: Enjoy Golf
runners.comment: Serial runner-up this year including over C&D off this mark a fortnight ago; reserve.
runners.spotlight: 7f winner who has finished second in all four 2025 runs (one over C&D, three over 5f); on the same mark again here if he gets a runs.

runners.name: Draco
runners.comment: Yet to win but placed twice already this year; lesser effort last time; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Winless after eight attempts; slightly lesser effort following two fair third places when beaten 3.25l over 7f last time; now 2lb lower.

runners.name: Beauty Viva
runners.comment: Hard to fancy on his local form but has Purton aboard for his first try in Class 4.
runners.spotlight: Dual British 7f winner who is dropping down to Class 4 for the first time after six modest Hong Kong runs; blinkers removed after one try; could make a big leap forward with Purton booked for the first time.

quotes.race: Federation Of Bloodstock Agents Handicap
quotes.quote: Validated was a straight forward ride, There was a no pace on early but he picked up nicely out of the Dip - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Validated would be a nice horse since we got him. He looks a picture and I was thinking of going for a novice contest next as it would've been a free hit, but his handicap mark might be affected now - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.name: Beato
runners.comment: C&D winner who has been placed in three of his last five outings so merits consideration.
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer off 3lb lower 15 months ago and only beaten 0.75l when dead-heating for third with Special Hedge (three of these rivals behind) a fortnight ago.

runners.name: Good Luck Babe
runners.comment: Continued recent run of good efforts when third last time; could prove hard to peg back.
runners.spotlight: Has slowly run into form since his arrival from Australia and again went well when beaten by 1.25l into third over 7f last time; probably stays 1m; may try to make all from stall 1.

runners.name: Matsu Victor
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.owner: Lau Ying Kin & Lau Mok Yuen Kee
runners.comment: Bidding for a third 1m win of the season but is probably a touch high in the weights now.
runners.spotlight: Already a dual 1m winner this season; has gone up a combined 12lb as a result and only a fair fifth when last seen six weeks ago.

runners.name: Times Table
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Eddie Li Sing Ip
runners.comment: Best Hong Kong run came when fifth (behind two of these rivals) over C&D last time.
runners.spotlight: Won two of his five New Zealand starts; first real sign of hitting form after four modest efforts when 2.75l fifth as a 74-1 chance over C&D two weeks ago; further progress would see him in with a squeak.

runners.name: Oriental Smoke
runners.comment: Good sprnter a couple of years back; some 1m placed form off this lowly mark this season.
runners.spotlight: Five-time 6f winner who has showed surprising stamina to twice finish placed over this trip in recent weeks; most recent outing was a step backwards.

runners.name: Owners Praise
runners.comment: Fairly treated on the pick of his 7f form but has been a touch off colour in recent runs.
runners.spotlight: Most recent of two 7f victories came a year ago and none of his five starts this season have suggested that a return to form is imminent.

runners.name: General Smart
runners.owner: Alex Chau Man Lok, Jack Chan Hoi Et Al
runners.comment: Will again be a big outsider after starting his career with three poor 7f runs.
runners.spotlight: Three poor 7f efforts at huge odds so far; hard to imagine that this step up to 1m is going to make much difference.

runners.name: Victory Patch
runners.comment: Little sign of ability in three starts over shorter; back from two month lay-off.
runners.spotlight: Has failed to finish in the first nine in the first three starts (two at 6f, one at 7f) of his career; now trying 1m after two months on the sidelines.

runners.name: Smiling Collector
runners.breeder: Mapperley Stud Ltd & Windsor Park S
runners.comment: Well treated on his best form and good run last time but is not one to rely upon.
runners.spotlight: Triple winner (once over this C&D) who has become inconsistent; posted one of his better efforts when 1.75l third over this C&D four weeks ago.

runners.name: Little Squid
runners.comment: Has been a big price and run accordingly on his first four starts; tongue-tie added.
