runners.spotlight: Has finished outside the first eight (though beaten by less than 5l the last twice) in all four starts; now upped from 7f with a tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Special Hedge
runners.breeder: Mrs K A & N J Auret
runners.comment: Dead-heated for third with Beato last time over C&D; chance again here off the same mark.
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of his tumbling mark to score over 7f in February; ran well off this revised rating when dead-heating for third with Beato over C&D last time; repeat would put him in the shake-up here.

runners.name: Celtic Times
runners.comment: Is 6lb lower than for C&D win a year ago; poor recent form; visor added here.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner a year ago who has been badly out of form in recent weeks; now tried with a visor on his second start for a new handler.

runners.name: Ping Hai Comet
runners.comment: Finished 0.75l fourth off 8lb higher mark over C&D a year ago; all other form is poor.
runners.spotlight: Did manage a close fourth over this C&D a year ago; otherwise his career has begun with five disappointing efforts; no real encouragement when back from a break last time.

runners.name: Everyones Classic
runners.owner: Yeung Chi Ming & Yeung Ching Ching
runners.comment: Needs huge improvement on what he has shown so far to feature in the finish; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Has run moderately in all three career starts; stepping up from 7f here; hard to fancy.

runners.name: C Yeah
runners.breeder: Rich Hill Thoroughbreds Ltd & L Williams
runners.owner: Hong Kong Young Owner Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: No promise in three career starts to date; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Has been sent off at triple-figure odds and finished with the backmarkers in all three career starts.

runners.name: Akashvani
runners.comment: Impressed with all-the-way 1.25l C&D success on last month's debut; up 8lb; poorly drawn.
runners.spotlight: Showed plenty in trials and made light of a wide draw to beat 11 rivals by 1.25l and more on his C&D debut four weeks ago; upped 8lb for that and again poorly drawn.

runners.name: Flash Current
runners.comment: C&D winner who was 2l third to Akashvani last time; now 8lb better off with that rival.
runners.spotlight: Has made a solid start to his career, following an unlucky debut with a C&D win and a 2l third to Akashvani last time; now 8lb better off but that may not be enough to turn the tables.

runners.name: Golden Luck
runners.owner: Chan Kam Shing, Wu Kai Char Et Al
runners.comment: Triple Happy Valley 6f winner; last two runs have been poor after numerous good efforts.
runners.spotlight: Triple 6f Happy Valley scorer who begun this season strongly but seems to be losing his way in recent weeks; still 2lb above his highest winning mark.

runners.name: Lucky Archangel
runners.comment: Looks well treated but lacks recent form and is much better at Happy Valley.
runners.spotlight: Happy Valley 6f specialist (all seven wins there) who is down to a good handicap mark but has not shown much in his last six outings.

runners.name: Legend Star
runners.comment: Australian trial winner but local trial form is modest and is likely to need this run.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winning sprinters who cost AUS$200,000; won a trial in Australia but has been unplaced in all three local trials so it will be a surprise if he is good enough to win at the first attempt.

runners.name: Lucky King
runners.comment: Offered little promise for the future in poor 1m dirt run on his debut two months ago.
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in trials but was a 62-1 outsider for his solitary outing two months ago and beaten only three of his 13 rivals; now down from 1m with a hood added.

runners.name: Star Figure
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Failed to live up to market expectations on last month's debut; worth another chance.
runners.spotlight: Was strong in the market (joint favourite) for his debut (6f, Happy Valley) a month ago, but could finish only tenth; likely to improve for that experience.

runners.name: Sunny Sing Spirit
runners.comment: Newcomer; unlikely to be involved in the finish on the evidence of his six trial races.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a pair of winners but cost only AUS$35,000 as a yearling and his performances in six trials have been modest.

runners.name: Sight Dreamer
runners.comment: Has failed to build on the promise of a 1.25l C&D debut third in two subsequent runs.
runners.spotlight: Fair third on his debut but that was a weak race and he has struggled in two subsequent appearances.

runners.name: Joyful Treasure
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Chow Kay Yui & Anna Chow Hoi Yan
runners.comment: His form has taken a downward turn in his last two starts; may appreciate return to 6f.
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in the second and third of three C&D outings to kick off his career but has ran poorly in two 7f races since then; may enjoy this return to 6f.

runners.name: Affirm
runners.comment: Long-standing maiden and five-time runner-up; hard to predict after three month break.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has finished second five times but never won in 19 career starts; perfectly capable of going close off this mark but has questions to answer following three months off.

runners.name: Sea Sapphire
runners.comment: Now 2lb lower than for his only win (this C&D) but seems off colour at the moment.
runners.spotlight: Solitary win was over C&D 13 months ago off a 2lb higher mark; changed trainer last summer and has run just three times (a fair fourth and two poor efforts) since.

runners.name: Brave Of Friends
runners.comment: Has not shown much so far but freshened by a seven-week break; won a recent trial.
runners.spotlight: Has finished outside of the top six in all six starts so far but did win a recent five-runner trial and could be invigorated by a seven-week break.

runners.name: Excellent Daddy
runners.comment: Won off much higher marks but that was some time ago; best recent form has been on dirt.
runners.spotlight: Four-time 6f winner here, most recently on dirt off a 6lb lower mark in January; two subsequent dirt runs have been disappointing, now returned to turf.

runners.name: Glaciated
runners.owner: Alan Chiu Chun Ming, Sandy Cheng Chuk Wah & W Law Chi Yin
runners.comment: Only small signs of ability on his 5f debut theee weeks ago; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Finished eighth, 4.25l behind the winner, as a 22-1 chance over 5f on his only start here three weeks ago; extra furlong to cover today.

runners.name: Big Stride
runners.comment: Newcomer who has not showed much zip in four local trial races; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Debutant who is related to plenty of winner but he does not look like an early-maturing type judged by his trial form and is likely to need further than 6f.

runners.name: Lifeline Express
runners.comment: Kept on strongly for C&D win last month but 8lb rise asks a lot of him
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 4yo who kept on strongly for a C&D win three weeks ago; subsequent 8lb rise asks quite a lot of him, though, and he probably lacks the early zip to make full use of his inside draw.

runners.name: Winning Ovation
runners.comment: Comfortable 6f novice winner in Britain last August; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.spotlight: Ended three-race 2yo campaign in Britain with comfortable 6f novice win last August; makes Hong Kong debut after 235-day absence; market may guide.

quotes.race: Michael Brunton Memorial British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Nascimento did it easily. He had the form to go and do it and so it's what we expected. He's a smart horse who has always worked very well. He had a bit of a break after the Coventry because he's a big horse and has only had one or two pieces of work. The plan is to go to Ireland for the Goffs Million. That's over seven furlongs but he'll get a mile as a three-year-old - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

runners.name: Geneva
runners.comment: Creditable second over C&D three weeks ago and has much better draw today; respected
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in early part of season and returned from break with creditable second from stall 10 here three weeks ago; has much better draw today and may still be on the upgrade; respected.

runners.name: Gracious Express

prev_owners.owner: G Doyle, K Ivory & F Young

runners.comment: Well handicapped on early-season 6f/7f form but not firing on all cylinders lately
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season 6f/7f form but not firing on all cylinders lately.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sharp Power is bordering on being a seven-furlong horse so I will let him do the talking there. He could be a Victoria Cup horse one day. I think the stronger he is getting the quicker he is getting? I won't throw him in the deep end this year. That was a fifty-thousand-pound race and I'm glad to get that. We won't be too hard on him this year as I think we will benefit for it next year - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely horse who has been placed in four of his five races. He made his debut at Kempton in February when second to Desert Cop and then finished third, beaten less than a length, in a race at Southwell after that. Last week at Lingfield I thought he had a winning opportunity but he was very free and had to settle for second. I think when things go his way he is the sort who can really progress and easily outperform his current mark of 74. 29-06-23

runners.name: Moduleconstruction
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Arthur Lam Chi Ping & M L C Min

prev_owners.owner: Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Arthur Lam Chi Ping & M Lam Chi Min
Eddie Lam Kin Wing & Arthur Lam Chi Ping
Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Conrad Fung Kwok Keung Et Al

runners.comment: Last month's belated seasonal debut was the first disappointing run of his career
runners.spotlight: Made the frame over C&D in his first 11 races (including two wins) but last month's belated seasonal reappearance with the first disappointing run of his career, and he has a wide draw today.

runners.name: King Of Dubai
runners.comment: Made satisfactory HK debut in October but not seen again since and drawn much wider today
runners.spotlight: 1-7 when based in Australia, the win gained in 5.5f maiden handicap in November 2023; made satisfactory Hong Kong debut when eighth over C&D in October but has not raced again since and is drawn much wider today.

runners.name: Genius Baby
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Pang Wai Hak, Frankie Pang Ka Yeung & A Pang Ka Wai
runners.comment: 5f debut winner in Australia last June; makes HK debut after ten-month absence; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in 5f maiden handicap in Australia last June; looks an interesting recruit to the Hong Kong scene but has fitness to prove after ten-month absence and is not drawn well.

runners.name: Lo Pan Spirit
runners.comment: Placed over C&D last month but his dreadful run of luck on the draw front has continued
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season; posted sound effort when keeping-on third behind Lifeline Express three weeks and has the services of Zac Purton today but his dreadful run of luck on the draw front has continued.

runners.name: Target Audience

prev_owners.owner: M Keesom, J Heasley Et Al

runners.comment: Justified odds-on favouritism when winning 6.5f maiden on debut in New Zealand last June
runners.spotlight: Justified odds-on favouritism when winning 6.5f AW maiden on debut in New Zealand last June; with good stable for Hong Kong career; interesting to see how he fares.

runners.name: Blazing Wind
runners.comment: Placed in this higher grade since C&D win in January but form dipped sharply last month
runners.spotlight: Opened account with Class 4 C&D win in January and was placed in this higher grade on his next outing (first-time cheekpieces) but seems very quickly to have gone off the boil since and has the outside draw to contend with today.

runners.name: Free Pony
runners.owner: Edwin Fong Yick Chung, Edmund Ho Kwok Shing & So Wai Keung
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both Hong Kong starts (7f/6f); hood added today
runners.spotlight: 2-12 when based in Australia and seemingly versatile regarding trip but he was soundly beaten on both Hong Kong starts last month (7f/6f); hood added today.

runners.name: Savvy Warrior
runners.comment: Fair handicapper when based in British (dual 7f winner); tough task on Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Fair handicapper when based in British, winning twice over 7f last year; well drawn for Hong Kong debut but probably up against it in this grade.

runners.name: Wonderstar
runners.comment: Five-time winner when based in Macau but has found things tough in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner when based in Macau but has found things tough in Hong Kong for Pierre Ng this season; now with another new stable.

runners.name: Legendary Impact

prev_owners.owner: Miss D M Guy & Mrs G V Guy

runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after three Hong Kong runs
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner in New Zealand last May but yet to show anything more than minor promise after three Hong Kong runs (5f-6f) and now eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.name: Savvy Brilliant
runners.comment: Below form on latest outing but won two of first four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who is 2-5 in Hong Kong (both wins over C&D); didn't fire when last seen in December but could still have improvement to come if back on song.

9:10.race_name: Faculty Of Education Alumni Handicap (Class 2) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.name: Helene Feeling
runners.comment: Placed all three starts since 1m1f Group 3 win in January; probably on the premises again
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win 1m1f Group 3 handicap at Happy Valley in January and has been placed on all three subsequent appearances (1m-1m1f); holds no secrets from the handicapper but is likely to be on the premises again.

quotes.race: Cambion Electronics Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Indian Dream was a nice horse at the start of the year but his tackle ruined his head and he's coming on now since he's been gelded. He made hard work of it but kept staying on and should go on from this - Ian Smith, travelling head lad.

runners.name: The Golden Scenery
runners.comment: Began season with 7f win off 5lb higher in September but largely disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Now 5lb lower than when winning over 7f here on seasonal debut in September but has largely been disappointing in the meantime and needs to raise his game.

runners.name: Winning Dragon
runners.owner: Alexander Yeung Kwok Kai, Edward Yeung Et Al
runners.comment: Excelled himself when fourth in 1m2f Group 1 in February; held in a subsequent handicap
runners.spotlight: Excelled himself when fourth in 1m2f Group 1 here in February but managed only sixth when back in a handicap last month (1m1f) and today's drop back to 1m is probably not ideal.

runners.name: C P Brave
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Leung Lun, Paul Leung Yuk Hung & K Leung Yuk Wai
runners.comment: Late-maturing 8yo; below form last time but current mark is workable if he rebounds
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 8yo who won three times over 1m1f here last season and has made the frame on two of his four 1m starts this term; disappointed when last in action but current mark is workable if he rebounds.

quotes.race: Berkshire Youth Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Piranesi has done well, I think a mile is his trip. He seemed to handle the ground, I think he handled the ground at Newbury last time but I'm not sure he quite stayed so we've come back to a mile today, it looks about right. He's still a big baby and he's still learning. When he went to go, he lugged off to the right a bit. When the other horse came to him that really helped him, pushed him on and straightened him up - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Voyage Samurai
runners.comment: Front-runner who has made the frame on both C&D starts since blinkers were added
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has made the frame on both C&D starts since blinkers were added in February; nudged up to new career-high mark today but could be very dangerous if allowed to dominate.

runners.name: Snowfield
runners.comment: Dual Group 1 winner in Brazil last year but made low-key Hong Kong debut last month
runners.spotlight: Signed off in Brazil with two Group 1 wins last May/June (7.5f/1m) but made low-key Hong Kong debut when sixth of eight here (7f) a fortnight ago and needs that run to have brought him on.

runners.name: Woodfire Bro
runners.comment: Began season with a win in September but has been out of form this year
runners.spotlight: Began this season with 1m win off 2lb higher at Happy Valley in September but has been out of form this year and was particularly disappointing when tried in a visor (now removed) three weeks ago.

runners.name: Mighty Steed
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a disappointing run but some of his early-season runs were encouraging
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a disappointing C&D run and is now 0-6 but some of his early-season 7f/1m runs were very encouraging and he has possibilities if back on song after four-month break.

runners.name: Ka Ying Superb
runners.breeder: D R Haworth, K & M Miles Et Al
runners.comment: 0-7 in HK but was a very close third over C&D last month and is only 1lb higher today
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Hong Kong but was beaten under 1l when third over C&D last month and was nudged up only 1lb for that; can make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Fun Together
runners.breeder: M W Gething, I N & Mrs S K Gillatt
runners.comment: Close second over C&D on New Year's Day but has quickly gone off the boil again since
runners.spotlight: Went close over C&D on New Year's Day but seems quickly to have gone off the boil again since and has the outside draw today.

runners.name: Etalon Or
runners.comment: Only sixth when warm favourite here last month and now 0-8
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who managed only sixth when warm favourite over C&D last month and has become very expensive to follow; will need to up his game to open his account from stall 12 today.

runners.name: Autumn Vibes
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who moves up in trip after a promising start to his career over 6f
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who recovered from very slow start to finish third over 6f on debut in February and was not given a hard to when fifth from a wide stall on second start; moves up in trip today and probably still has significant potential.

runners.name: Roman Crown
runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Dual 7f AW winner when trained in Britain but placed on only one of his ten HK starts
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f AW winner when trained in Britain but placed on only one of his ten Hong Kong starts; not the most obvious answer today.

runners.name: Shamus Storm
runners.comment: Second over C&D on debut and didn't run badly on second start; remains of strong interest
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for second over C&D on debut in December and arguably ran better than finishing position (eighth) suggests when a beaten favourite here six weeks ago; remains very much of interest.

runners.name: Celestial Patch
runners.comment: Always towards rear when a 48-1 outside for C&D debut six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear when a 48-1 outside for C&D debut six weeks ago.

runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.comment: Unable to justify warm favouritism but still made very promising debut last month (6f)
runners.spotlight: Expensive Australian yearling purchase who is out of a half-sister to a Japanese Group 1 winner; unable to justify warm favouritism but still made very promising debut when keeping-on third at Happy Valley (6f) last month; must be considered.

runners.name: Carryon Smiling
runners.owner: Charley Chan Wing Chin & Li Kit
runners.comment: Displayed sudden jolt of improvement to cause 84-1 surprise over C&D in February
runners.spotlight: Displayed sudden jolt of improvement to cause 84-1 surprise over C&D in February, his sixth start; 6lb higher in a competitive race today but has a much better draw this time and further progress is possible.

runners.name: Raging Rapids
runners.comment: Began career with three promising 6f runs; Hugh Bowman booked for first 7f attempt
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who has shown significant promise on all three 6f starts this year; well drawn for this first 7f attempt and Hugh Bowman takes the ride; considered each-way.

runners.name: View All Things
runners.comment: Kept on for fifth over C&D on last two outings but others have more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all four starts; kept on for fifth over C&D on last two outings and is well drawn again today but others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Always My Folks
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Second over 6f here in January but some lesser efforts have followed; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Improved form when second over 6f here in January, his third run, but some lesser efforts have followed and he was particularly disappointing when upped to 7f a fortnight ago.

runners.name: Sportic Warrior
runners.owner: Edmund Wong Yan Ming, Michael Lee To Ming Et Al
runners.comment: A down-the-field outsider on all five starts (6f-7f)
runners.spotlight: A down-the-field outsider on all five starts (6f-7f) and will soon be eligible for a much-needed drop in grade; hood removed.

runners.name: He Was Me

prev_owners.owner: Price Bloodstock Management Ltd & Farmhouse Holdings P/L

runners.comment: Yet to get seriously competitive after five Hong Kong starts (6f-7f)
runners.spotlight: Yet to get seriously competitive after five Hong Kong starts (6f-7f); tries a new headgear combination today.

10:15.race_name: S H Ho And CW Chu Alumni Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.name: The Boom Box
runners.comment: 3-3 over 6f; did not enjoy the run of the race when close third over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Very promising 4yo who began his career with three ready 6f course wins from off the pace and didn't really enjoy the run of the race when close third over C&D last month; probably still has a lot more to offer.

runners.name: Brilliant Express
runners.comment: Bang-in-form 4yo who has won twice over C&D this year; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form 4yo who has won twice over C&D this year and posted another good effort when fourth over 1m here last month; drops back in trip today; likely contender again.

runners.name: Superb Boy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mak Yiu Hay & Mak Kai Chung
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on seasonal debut in September but out of form in recent months
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D on seasonal debut in September but out of form in recent months and difficult to enthuse over at present.

runners.name: Silo
runners.comment: 0-8 in HK and drawn wide today but was knocking on the door towards end of last year
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in Hong Kong but has been knocking on the door over 7f/1m this season; below form when drawn wide here last time and has same awkward berth in stall 12 on this first start for three months but still enters calculations.

runners.name: Turin Starspangled
runners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Ken Huang Jian Hua Et Al
runners.comment: 1m winner in September; absent since running as though something was amiss in November
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo who came good in Hong Kong with 1m course win in September; can cope with today's drop back in trip but ran as though something was amiss in November and we haven't seen him again since.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: He's always worked like a fair one. Devious shouldn't be that fast being that big and strong so I'd say he's a proper horse. I was thinking coming here today that we could look at the Coventry but showing the speed that he did we could look at the Norfolk maybe instead. We have nothing that can take him off the bridle at home, he's just natural. He's got so much boot that the nice ground helps him but he would get slower ground as well as he's big and powerful - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Keefy

prev_owners.owner: B K Racing & Breeding, Raffles Thoroughbred Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Third over C&D last month but no longer the force of old and has poor strike-rate nowadays
runners.spotlight: Outran 63-1 when staying-on third over C&D three weeks ago but is no longer the force of old and has a poor strike-rate in recent years; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Eighty Light Years
runners.comment: Turned things around with big-odds second over C&D last month; still well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Generally in poor form this season but turned things around when close second at triple-digit odds over C&D three weeks ago; drawn much wider today but remains well handicapped; player if able to build on that recent effort.

runners.name: Igor Stravinsky

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Looked useful when winning 7f Irish maiden for Aiden O'Brien last May; Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Looked useful when winning 7f Irish maiden for Aiden O'Brien last May; gelded during subsequent 11-month break and now makes his Hong Kong debut; the market may point the way.

runners.name: Fortunate Son
runners.breeder: A M Aldridge, Mrs F V & G F Moughan

prev_owners.owner: M C Sharkie, P Vawdrey & D Painter

runners.comment: Well handicapped on early-season form but needs the new blinkers to perk him up
runners.spotlight: Placed twice off higher marks here (7f/1m) in early part of this season but recent efforts have been very underwhelming; needs the new blinkers to perk him up.

runners.name: Solid Impact
runners.comment: Placed over C&D in January but has not built on that performance; younger rivals preferred
runners.spotlight: Seemingly back in good form when third over C&D in January but was safely held here a fortnight ago; younger rivals have much more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Lost Child
runners.comment: Back from layoff with three down-the-field runs this year; needs to get back in the groove
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season but returned from layoff with three down-the-field runs this year and needs to get back in the groove.

runners.name: Aurio

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Love Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Safely held on last two 6f start and did not convince stamina-wise on previous 7f attempt
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in Hong Kong; placed over 6f at Happy Valley in February but safely held over that trip twice since and did not convince stamina-wise on previous attempt at 7f.

runners.name: Riding Together
runners.comment: Has made a quiet start to his Hong Kong career and probably needs a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 6f winner in Britain last year but has made a quiet start to his Hong Kong career and probably needs a drop in grade.

stable_tour.quote: He is another by Profitable who was a nice purchase from the breeze-ups and looks a horse with a future. He made his debut at Salisbury last month when second to a warm favourite of Tom Dascombe's who finished fifth in the Chesham at Royal Ascot. Cool Dividend is a horse I like and I'm sure he can progress from that run. He seems to have come out of his first run very well. 02-08-23

7:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM
